1.content:
You were as surprised as anyone to get the invitation to the prestigious Inventory club. In fact, you don’t even know how you got it. Maybe you were entered in to some online contest? Who knows? All that matters is that the car is here to pick you up and take you to your destination.

         You decide to take one last look in the mirror before you go. Your reflection stares back at you. You see an:

Adult Male Gamer: You are in your late teens or early 20s. It’s a bit hard to tell. You aren't strikingly good looking, but you wouldn’t say you are unattractive either. You aren’t all that athletic, but you aren’t overweight either. Neither are you particularly skinny. You are…fairly average. You have brown hair and stubble on your face.
You are Wearing: A zip-up hoody, sneakers, socks, a button-up shirt, a humorous t-shirt, jeans and boxer shorts.

Adolescent Male Gamer: You are in your early teens, somewhere between 11 and 13. Though you have hit a growth spurt recently you still have many childlike features. You have blonde hair and will likely grow up to be pretty attractive, but you still look like a kid for now.
You are Wearing: A baseball cap, a jacket, sneakers, socks, a t-shirt, jeans and boxer shorts.

Adult Female Gamer (Version 1): At first glance, very few would guess that you were a pretty hardcore nerd at heart. You aren’t super thin, however neither are you big enough to be called chunky. The best word to describe you would be "curvaceous." The bit of extra meat on your bones has done quite a few positive things with your ample bosom and ass. Your hair is a deep, rich red and it goes well with your striking green eyes.
You are Wearing: A stylish jacket, boots, thigh-high stockings, a nice blouse, a skirt, a black lace bra and black lace panties.

Adult Female Gamer (Version 2): You are rather thin and small. You tend to wear your black hair up and you wear rimmed glasses which cover up, somewhat, your hazel eyes. You are very clearly Asian and your skin is a light brown. Your chest is small but not non-existent. You tend to hide most of your feminine features with nondescript clothing.
You Are Wearing: A zip-up hoodie, sneakers, socks, a humorous t-shirt, jeans, a plain cotton gray bra and plain cotton gray panties.

Adolescent Female Gamer: You look as though you are just about to or just have hit puberty. You are somewhere between 11 and 13 years of age. You wear your dark blonde hair in a ponytail. Your eyes are a dark blue. Your body is still childlike in many ways, but you are starting to develop your more feminine features, if only just.
You are Wearing: A white button-up blouse, pink sneakers, pink socks, a blue shirt, a black skirt, a short and small white tank top and white cotton panties.
1.title: You've Got a Golden Ticket

11.content:
The car ride takes considerably less time that you thought it would. In what feels like no time at all the car has stopped and you’re ready to exit. You take one last look at the invitation, confirming which table you’ll be playing at tonight.

Shooter Table: This table contains four women from various games that have a strong reliance on gunplay.
This Table Features:
-Elizabeth (from Bioshock)
-Lilith (from Borderlands)
-Zoey (from Left 4 Dead)
-Lara Croft (From Tomb Raider)

Fighter Table: This table contains four women from various games where they beat other people up.
This Table Features:
-Kasumi (from Dead or Alive)
-Cassandra Alexandria (From Soul Calibur)
-Chun Li (from Street Fighter)
-Morrigan (from Darkstalkers)

WRPG Table: This table contains four women from role playing games made by western developers, which is to say not from Japan.
This Table Features:
-Liara T’Soni (from Mass Effect)
-Jeanette Voerman (from Vampire The Masquerade)
-Sis (from Alpha Protocol)
-Triss Merigold (from The Witcher)

JRPG Table: This table contains four women from role playing games made by Japanese developers.
This Table Features:
-Elizabeth (from Persona 3)
-Jessica Albert (from Dragon Quest VIII)
-Tifa Lockhart (from Final Fantasy VII)
-Aika (from Skies of Arcadia)
11.title: Adult Male Gamer

choices: Keep the diamonds and try for a flush.
111.content:
Ah, that's right. The Shooter Table. Without further adieu you step out of the car and towards the nondescript building in which The Inventory is housed. A bouncer, who may or may not have been Dudley from Street Fighter, opens the door for you as you show him your invitation. You step inside and inhale the musty smells of smoke and alcohol. You make your way through the semi-crowded room, noticing a few familiar faces as you head towards the back. You're pretty sure you saw Solid Snake sharing a a beer with Gordon Freeman, but you didn't get a good enough look. No one seems to pay much attention to you as you cross the room. Finally, you reach the entrance to the VIP area. You show your invitation to the bouncer up front (some Half Life Civil Protection goon by the look of him), and he lets you in.

         You step inside the room and you see your four fellow players already at the table: Elizabeth (http://tinyurl.com/lt49zm5), Lilith (http://tinyurl.com/mvtxhub) Zoey (http://i.imgur.com/mzlywnj.jpg) and Lara Croft (http://i.imgur.com/wogG6Ve.png). You also note another woman is sitting at a booth nearby, seemingly spectating. On closer inspection she appears to be Samantha Nishimura (http://i.imgur.com/GphLqyk.png), Lara's friend. Maybe she got to come as Lara's guest, perhaps?

         "Ah, it seems our final player has arrived," Elizabeth says brightly.

         "Not very big on punctuality is he?" Lilith comments.

         "Meh, who needs to be on time? And hey, it's a guy!" Zoey pipes up.

         "My, my. Someone just lit up like a Christmas Tree," Lara interjects.

         "What? I came here to relax! If this game is going to involve people taking their clothes off, I definitely would want a guy here. And this here dude...is a guy." Zoey replies. "Aren't you?"

         "Uh...yeah, I guess." You reply, awkwardly.

         "You see! Isn't that better? Wouldn't you rather there be a guy here, Lara?" Zoey asks. Lara rubs the back of her neck and avoids eye contact.

         "Offff course I would. Heh heh. Yeah. The more guys the merrier!" She replies nervously. You can see Sam rolling her eyes from her seat. You notice one of her drink glasses is empty and she's already working on another.

         "Anyway," Lilith interjects. "We're all here, so let's go over the rules. We're playing basic five card draw so this doesn't take all night. At the beginning of each hand we all get five cards. After we have those, each of us can turn in any of those, up to all five, for replacements. Once we've done that, everyone puts down their hands and the loser has to take something off. Once a person gets bare-assed all of us here at the table get to decide what that person has to do as punishment. The last person left with anything on is the winner."

         "And that winner is going to be Lara!" Sam says, slurring a bit.

         "Sam! Pipe down, we haven't even started yet," Lara responds.

         "You sure about that, girlie? Wanna make a bet?" Lilith asks.

         "Hell yes!" Sam says enthusiastically. "Lara rescued me single-handedly from a cult, so I'm pretty sure she can do this. As a show of solidarity, every time she takes something off, I will too."

         "You don't have to do this, Sam..." Lara says, slightly worried.

         "I say let her make her own mistakes," Zoey says with a smirk.

         "It's not like I could stop her, anyway," Lara says, resigned.

         "Besides, it won't even matter because you are going to rock it!" Sam says.

         "Is everyone ready then?" Elizabeth interrupts, bemused at the entire spectacle before her. After a bit of a double-take, everyone nods in agreement. The cards are passed out and you look at your hand.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------

You Have: Q(C), 10(S), 8(D), 7(D), 4(D)

Clothing Count:

Player: Zip-up hoody, sneakers, socks, button-up shirt, humorous t-shirt, jeans, boxer shorts.
Elizabeth: Petticoat, boots, skirt, slip, stockings, corset, panties.
Lilith: Vest, boots, chaps, zip-up shirt, shorts, pink halter top, panties.
Zoey: Zip-up hoody, shoes, socks, jeans, white shirt, bra, panties.
Lara: Boots, socks, outer tank top, pants, inner tank top, sports bra, panties.
         (Sam: Jacket, boots, socks, shirt, pants, bra, panties.)
111.title: Shooter Table

1111.content:
You're not thrilled to be drawing four cards, but even if you lose the hand there will be plenty of time to recover. You're rewarded with a Jack, Ten, Nine... and another Nine.

Staying cool, you table your hand quickly since the ladies made it clear they didn't want anyone slow-rolling and you knew these were not women you want angry with you.

"I'm already wishing this was for cash," Lilith laments. She has made a Jack high hearts flush and starts to look around. You guess she's searching for someone with drinks.

"Indeed. I would be hurting from this hand," Zoey comments. She had a 8 high straight and was smiling about the game's format.

"I can afford to lose the money; my and Sam's egos are glad to keep the clothes, though," Lara added. She only had pair of Jacks, but it was enough to beat you.

You sigh and move to take off your sneakers when you're interrupted. "Down, boy! You're not the biggest loser," Lilith notes and head gestured to Elizabeth. She only had a pair of Fives, and was already working on her boots.

"So... tight" she said as she struggled with her left boot until it finally came off. She set them under her chair.

"You've got lovely feet, Elizabeth," Sam compliments as the cards are dealt.

"Thank you. Better than my hands, anyway," she answers and partly covers her right hand with her left.

You still feel embarrassed for not noting Elizabeth's hand and zip down your hoody a bit just before you check your new hand.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------

You Have: A(H), 7(C), 2(S), 7(H), J(C)

Clothing Count:

Player: Zip-up hoody, sneakers, socks, button-up shirt, humorous t-shirt, jeans, boxer shorts.
Elizabeth: Petticoat, boots, skirt, slip, stockings, corset, panties.
Lilith: Vest, boots, chaps, zip-up shirt, shorts, pink halter top, panties.
Zoey: Zip-up hoody, shoes, socks, jeans, white shirt, bra, panties.
Lara: Boots, socks, outer tank top, pants, inner tank top, sports bra, panties.
         (Sam: Jacket, boots, socks, shirt, pants, bra, panties.)
1111.title: Drop everything but the queen.

choices: A round of drinks for the whole table.
11111.content:
You take a moment and discard the 2 and the Jack. Of course you're keeping the pair, but you decide the Ace is valuable enough to hang onto. You're met with a King and a 10. Your mouth forms a tight line; if your hands keep getting worse like this, you're not long for this table. Nevertheless, you're happy to find that, once again, your own bad luck has been negated by someone else having it worse.

Lilith sneers at her cards, laying down a pair of 3's on the table. "Still wish this was for money?" Lara asks, showing her own pair of 9's.

"Honestly? Yes," Lilith responds, "Pandora's inflation rates are pretty high, considering any given person, animal, or pile of garbage can serve as a pinata for loot. Maybe the $10,000 this place usually charges seems like a fortune to you guys, but on my worst day I could just burn through the stuff like... well, paper."

"Miss?" A waiter draws Lilith's attention.

"Speaking of burning through money..." the siren mutters, as she launches into a drink order. You catch her mentioning something called "rakk ale" and you decide you're better off not knowing.

Zoey, with a smirk, shows her cards: One pair of seven's to match your own, and another pair of two's, marking her as this rounds winner. "Still going strong," she says, kicking back in her chair.

Finally, all eyes turn to Elizabeth, who hasn't taken her eyes off of her own hand. Cringing, she places her cards on the table; a meager pair of two's.

"Tough break, kid," Lilith says, the waiter departing.

"After that hand, they can't get any worse, right?" Sam offers weakly, still working away at her own drink.

"I mean, they totally can," Zoey says quietly, wincing when Lara elbows her.

With a sigh, Elizabeth stands up and shrugs off her petticoat, her slender arms shedding the blue material before setting it on the back of her chair. With a smile, she sits back down. "Here's hoping the rest of the game goes better for me."

"Alright!" Zoey says as the cards are dealt, "two hands in and we're already seeing some skin!" You can't help but chuckle and nod in agreement. It's already shaping up to be a fun evening; you just hope your luck starts shaping up, or it might not be so enjoyable after all.

The cards are dealt, but before you get a chance to take a look, the waiter returns with a tray carrying...

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------

Clothing Count:

Player: Zip-up hoody, sneakers, socks, button-up shirt, humorous t-shirt, jeans, boxer shorts.
Elizabeth: Petticoat, boots, skirt, slip, stockings, corset, panties.
Lilith: Vest, boots, chaps, zip-up shirt, shorts, pink halter top, panties.
Zoey: Zip-up hoody, shoes, socks, jeans, white shirt, bra, panties.
Lara: Boots, socks, outer tank top, pants, inner tank top, sports bra, panties.
         (Sam: Jacket, boots, socks, shirt, pants, bra, panties.)
11111.title: Keep 7s and Ace

111111.content:
"Umm... Lilith. What is that?" Elizabeth asks. She quickly tables her red pocket rockets with confidence.

Lilith grins. "A special Moxx-tail I asked for earlier. It's like a gargle blaster and squill syrup mix that may or may not having a speck of Eridium." Lilith tips the waiter, whom looks like Jacob Taylor now that you think about it.

"Well, that sounds... super lethal," Sam says. Lara nods and reveals a pair of Queens.

Zoey, who had been ogling the waiter as he left, softly chuckles. "I'm sure for a badass Siren, a glass is 10% less than a lethal dose." Zoey shows a busted 10 high straight flush draw.

The chuckling infects Lilith after her sip. "Oh oh! This is my fourth glass." Like Lara, she has a pair of Queens.

Realizing you hadn't checked yet, you flip over your hand self-consciously. Luckily you have a King high heart flush. "Does the drink have an effect?" you wonder out loud.

Lilith takes another sip. "What most drinks do--make me and everyone else cleverer, better-looking, better at singing. It allegedly increases luck too, but I think Moxxi was fracking with me about that."

"Man, I miss Farscape," Zoey says. She had taken off the hoody quickly enough that you hadn't noticed.

"The series, not the game, right?" Lara asks as the cards are dealt.

"Lara, when you assume you--hell, yes, I don't mean the game!" Zooey replies.

You try to think of good license games as you get your hand.

-------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------------------------------------


Your Hand: 3 (S), 7 (S), 8 (C), 10 (H), 3 (H)

Clothing Count:

Player: Zip-up hoody, sneakers, socks, button-up shirt, humorous t-shirt, jeans, boxer shorts.
Elizabeth: Petticoat, boots, skirt, slip, stockings, corset, panties.
Lilith: Vest, boots, chaps, zip-up shirt, shorts, pink halter top, panties.
Zoey: Zip-up hoody, shoes, socks, jeans, white shirt, bra, panties.
Lara: Boots, socks, outer tank top, pants, inner tank top, sports bra, panties.
(Sam: Jacket, boots, socks, shirt, pants, bra, panties.)
111111.title: Lilith's drink.

111112.content:
"Oh, I didn't order any-" Lara starts explaining as the waiter places a small glass next to her, but stops when she sees that everyone else is receiving one too. You fix Lilith with a questioning look.

"What?" She asks, "Like I said, I have plenty of cash to burn. A night like this is more fun with a bit of a buzz anyway." You back down a little, but are still hesitant to take a sip, as are the other girls. Lilith rolls her eyes, "Hey, you'll be thanking me for this when you're sitting there in your boxers. A little alcohol ought to loosen you up a bit, take the edge off an what'll be an otherwise crushing defeat."

It's your turn to roll your eyes, but you take a sip nonetheless. It seems to be whiskey: a little strong, but a glass won't kill you. Lara and Elizabeth also sip theirs (Sam looks to be halfway through her glass), but Zoey is still hesitant. "What's the problem?" Lilith asks, "don't like whiskey?"

"It's not that," Zoey says, "its... why is yours green?" Zoey points to the Siren's glass and, yep, the liquid inside does appear to be a sickly greenish-color.

"Oh, this?" Lilith says, holding up her drink, "This is rakk ale. If you're not used to it, it'll knock you on your ass, but I'll be just fine." To illustrate, Lilith takes a decent-sized swig. "I figured I'd go easy on you guys though."

You're still skeptical, but you're not going to turn down one drink. As Lara chides her friend ("I want some of the green stuff!" "Sam, no,"), you take a look at your cards.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------

You Have: 7(S), 4(S), J(C), Q(H), K(S)

Clothing Count:

Player: Zip-up hoody, sneakers, socks, button-up shirt, humorous t-shirt, jeans, boxer shorts.
Elizabeth: Petticoat, boots, skirt, slip, stockings, corset, panties.
Lilith: Vest, boots, chaps, zip-up shirt, shorts, pink halter top, panties.
Zoey: Zip-up hoody, shoes, socks, jeans, white shirt, bra, panties.
Lara: Boots, socks, outer tank top, pants, inner tank top, sports bra, panties.
         (Sam: Jacket, boots, socks, shirt, pants, bra, panties.)
111112.title: A round of drinks for the whole table.

1111122.content:
You think the hand has potential as you discard the two low cards. You shrug as you look at a jack and deuce of spades, giving you a semi-strong pair. You then suppress a curse as you reveal your cards since you realize you could have made a flush.

Lilith notices it and giggles. "I don't think you'll offend anyone with adult language, Daddy Mack. I dare say we've all dealt with worse." She gladly flipped over a set of fours.

"Of course, you don't have to fracking curse if don't frelling want to," Zoey adds and checks the up cards, since she only had a pair of sixes.

Lilith smiles at Zoey as well as the fact Elizabeth had a busted Ace high flush draw. "A geek after my own heart, Zoey. Maybe we won't need forfeits at all." She ends the comment by touching Zoey's hand.

Zoey responds by rubbing the Siren's hand before pulling away. "Easy, tiger. You'll need to get a bit more rakk ale in me first."

"Here, here!" Sam calls in agreement. The countess face palms with her right hand as she shows a pair of sevens with her left.

"Blazes!" Elizabeth says and sighs. She stands up irritated and unceremoniously strips off her skirt. While the brainy brunette is certainly attractive, her poor run of luck makes you sympathetic. Especially since she probably had a better understanding of the probability and strategy of five-card draw than any of the other young women.

"Elizabeth, it's okay if it's harder for you regarding modesty," Lara says in a half-comforting and half-academic tone. "You're from a different time."

You suppress a chuckle as you wonder if Lara knows how apt she is. The cards have been dealt, and you see a hand that maintains your mood.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------

You Have: 4(D), 9(H), 4(S), J(H), 4(C)

Clothing Count:

Player: Zip-up hoody, sneakers, socks, button-up shirt, humorous t-shirt, jeans, boxer shorts.
Elizabeth: Petticoat, boots, skirt, slip, stockings, corset, panties.
Lilith: Vest, boots, chaps, zip-up shirt, shorts, pink halter top, panties.
Zoey: Zip-up hoody, shoes, socks, jeans, white shirt, bra, panties.

(Sam: Jacket, boots, socks, shirt, pants, bra, panties.)
1111122.title: Discard the 7 and 4.

choices: Just keep the King and Queen
Discard the 8 for a Straight Draw
11111222.content:
"Yes!" you exclaim as you pick up the 4 of hearts and don't bother checking the other draw as you revealed the "Yacht Club."

"You took all my 4s and then some, Daddy Mack. But the devil-may-care," the Siren said and appropriately showed a set of 6s.

"No, why should anyone care? We all know whose going to lose," a vexed Elizabeth said and showed a pair of 3s.

Lara looked like she was going to say something to Elizabeth, but thought better of it and showed a pair of 7s without a word. Sam nodded with approval and took a small sip.

Zoey gave a weak smile. "I think she's just luring us into a false sense of security. She'll probably hustle us on the forfeits at the end," she said and turned over a pair of Jacks.

Elizabeth stood and started messing with the strings to her corset. The laces were behind her and since she was flustered it was slow going.

Lilith looked to you as the cards were shuffled and head gestured to Elizabeth. "Well, help the poor lady. You got the best hand, after all."

You looked at Elizabeth whom gave a curt nod. Standing behind her, you undid the laces and trying not to think about your half-dressed opponent's lovely build or enticing perfume. As the corset fell away, it revealed that Elizabeth already had a flat, firm stomach.

"Thank you," she said, her face reddening as she took her seat; you replied with an indecisive nod and sat down too. The cards were dealt again.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------

You Have: 8(S), 9(C), T(D), Q(C), K(D)

Clothing Count:

Player: Zip-up hoody, sneakers, socks, button-up shirt, humorous t-shirt, jeans, boxer shorts.
Elizabeth: Petticoat, boots, skirt, slip, stockings, corset, panties.
Lilith: Vest, boots, chaps, zip-up shirt, shorts, pink halter top, panties.
Zoey: Zip-up hoody, shoes, socks, jeans, white shirt, bra, panties.
Lara: Boots, socks, outer tank top, pants, inner tank top, sports bra, panties.
(Sam: Jacket, boots, socks, shirt, pants, bra, panties.)
11111222.title: Discard the 9 and J

111112222.content:
You half-smiled at having picked up the 9 of Diamonds, since it should be enough.

Lilith gave out a low chuckle as she revealed a 7 high hearts flush. "I'm really good at this!" she boasted and took another swig of her drink.

To your surprise, Elizabeth's big eyes had lite up as she showed her hand. "Deux rois," she declared as she pushed the two black kings forward.

"Iway avehay quatsay," Zoey quipped and turned over Ace Queen high.

The Tomb Raider shrugged and showed the last king as her high card. Stoically, she head gestured for Sam to lose an item.

The two adventuresses both decided to lose their boots. Lara took hers off quickly in her chair to get back to the game, but Sam either consciously or not untied them and took them off by bending over in a way that emphasized the twenty-two years old tight butt.

You kept your ogling subtle enough to not be called out on as the next hand was dealt.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------

You Have: 3(D), 7(D), 9(H), J(D), K(D)

Clothing Count:

Player: Zip-up hoody, sneakers, socks, button-up shirt, humorous t-shirt, jeans, boxer shorts.
Elizabeth: Petticoat, boots, skirt, slip, stockings, corset, panties.
Lilith: Vest, boots, chaps, zip-up shirt, shorts, pink halter top, panties.
Zoey: Zip-up hoody, shoes, socks, jeans, white shirt, bra, panties.
Lara: Boots, socks, outer tank top, pants, inner tank top, sports bra, panties.
(Sam: Jacket, boots, socks, shirt, pants, bra, panties.)
111112222.title: Discard the 8 for a Straight Draw

1111122221.content:
You chuckle as 9 (H) was traded for a 9 (C). "Nada mucho," you call and turn over your hand.

Elizabeth smile from the last hand only grew. "Un brelan, she declares and shows three 6s.

Sam snickers. "Well, ain't that ominous." She takes another sip of her drink and looks to the other players' hands, since Lara had already shown King Jack Ten high; she knew Lara had a better kicker than you.

"Argh!" Zoey interjects. "Point one--the number of the beast is actually 616."

"χιϛ from Papyrus 115," Lara is unable to resist adding.

Zoey pauses. "Yeah, that Greek thingy. Which leads me to point two--I like the whole multiculturally kajigger of this place, but let's all speak American."

Lilith rolls her golden eyes and pushes her two aces forward. "I have bullets, just to r"emind everyone." She looks directly at Zoey, "I don't have time to just sit here."

"Mea culpa," Zoey said playfully and shows a pair of 4s.

"What do you think I should lose?" you ask Elizabeth, whom blushes slightly.

"Your hoody, I suppose."

You nod and start unzipping, but Lilith snorts. "A hoody? I'd have you out of those pants in a heartbeat, chicken."

"Cheep, cheep, cheep," Zoey teases, but you simply finish taking off the hoody and check your cards.

-------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------


You Have: 6 (S), 10 (D), J (C), Q (S), 2 (H)

Player: Zip-up hoody, sneakers, socks, button-up shirt, humorous t-shirt, jeans, boxer shorts.

1111122221.title: Go for the Diamond Flush

choices: Keep the diamonds, and try for another flush.
1112.content:
You decide to take a risk, hoping for a flush... and, to your surprise, are met with a lovely couple: the King and Queen of Diamonds! You smile at the strong start, though somewhere in the back of your mind you hope you aren't blowing your luck too early. You also take a moment to appreciate that there isn't any folding in strip poker, or else the entire table would have dropped out of the round upon seeing your eyes light up.

"Man," Zoey chuckled, "if you ever come here to play a real game, you have got to watch those tells." You smile and chuckle yourself, before laying down your cards. "...But I guess here, it doesn't matter so much," Zoey adds upon seeing your hand, laying her own flat on the table.

You win the hand easily, and the rest of the girls each have a pair; except for Elizabeth, left with an Ace High.

"Oh, well," Elizabeth shrugs, carefully removing her boots, placing them to her side, on the table. "Plenty of time to make that up."

She's right, the night is still young; your paranoia is telling you your luck won't hold out, but you came here to win, so you ignore that nagging feeling at the back of your neck as the cards get shuffled and dealt.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------

You Have: 3(D), 7(D), 2(H), K(C), 7(S)

Player: Zip-up hoody, sneakers, socks, button-up shirt, humorous t-shirt, jeans, boxer shorts.
Elizabeth: Petticoat, boots, skirt, slip, stockings, corset, panties.
Lilith: Vest, boots, chaps, zip-up shirt, shorts, pink halter top, panties.
Zoey: Zip-up hoody, shoes, socks, jeans, white shirt, bra, panties.

(Sam: Jacket, boots, socks, shirt, pants, bra, panties.)
1112.title: Keep the diamonds and try for a flush.

choices: Keep your pair, toss the rest.
Take a risk: lose the 5 and one of the kings.
11121.content:
Keeping the sevens, you send three cards back to the dealer, and receive a 9 of Clubs, Queen of Hearts, and King of Spades in return. Not any better than before, but you've still got your pair. As the girls lay down their cards, you note that you ended up safely in the middle; you were beaten by Zoey's and Elizabeth's pair of Jacks and 10s, respectively, but you didn't do nearly as bad as Lilith, whose King high was just beaten by Lara's Ace.

With a shrug, Lilith stands up, bending over for a moment to unfasten her chaps. As she leans forward, you get a good view down her halter top. While you didn't think you were staring, a cough and a knowing smirk from Zoey turns you bright red. Thankfully, no one else seemed no notice, as Lilith simply places the garment down on the table.

"You know, win or lose, I'm just happy to hear the word 'strip' in this context." Lillith says. At the confused glances of her fellow players, she added, "It's just that on Pandora, when you hear the word 'strip', it's usually followed by 'the flesh'." Elizabeth nods in understanding, before pausing.

"Well, I suppose in a way the same can be said here. We'll certainly be seeing plenty of flesh later in the evening."

"Yeah," Lilith laughs, "I guess so. Hopefully we won't get to the 'salt the wound' part."

"Wait 'til we get to the forfeits..." Zoey mutters, and you and the girls can't help but laugh, albeit a bit nervously.

While that conversation was going, the dealer had passed out the cards. With a smile, you glance down at what you received.

choices: Lose the king and the eight.
111212.content:
Taking a deep breath, you decide to turn in two cards and go for a straight. Risky, yes, but you'd rather take risks now than later on. Miraculously, you don't completely screw yourself over; you pull a 5 of hearts and a Jack of diamonds. Your pair may have been demoted, but you don't complain: with what you just tried, that was probably one of the better outcomes.

Elizabeth easily takes the round with 3 9's. You and Zoey are each safe with a pair. Lilith, with a roll of her eyes, lays down an Ace high hand, and starts to stand up... until Lara lays down her cards to reveal a high 10. She and Sam share a glance, before they both remove their heavy, jungle-fairing boots. For a moment you see Sam hesitate; whether she was reconsidering her wager or considering what to take off, you don't know, but in a second she has her boots off, the same as her friend.

Elizabeth takes a moment to look at you, and then Zoey. "What will happen first, you think? One of us loses a second item, or one of you two gets a bad hand?"

You share a look with Zoey: at her grin, you return it, and you both simply shrug at Elizabeth, before gathering up the cards that you have been dealt.

choices: Drop the Queen and 5, go for a flush.
Go for a straight, get rid of the 3 and the 5.
1112121.content:
Tossing in three cards yields nothing but another King, a 3, and a 5. Still, a pair is a pair, you think... only to remember very quickly that just a pair isn't always enough, when the girls lay down pairs of 7s, 9s, and Jacks, with Lilith taking the round with 3 Aces. You sigh, and after a moment fumbling with the laces, your sneakers join the other footwear already on the table.

"Pretty even game so far," you remark. You say it out loud more to yourself than the others; though you haven't lost any more than most of them, the draft your feet are now feeling is reminding you of how much you stand to lose. Or gain, you tell yourself, I need to focus on that part.

The rest of the table mumbles various statements of agreement, as they each pick up their new cards. "The night's still young," Lilith reminds you with a smile, before turning back to her cards. You give a weak smile in return, before doing the same.

1112121.title: Keep just the pair.

11121211.content:
Of course as soon as you remark at how even the game is, you pull in zilch. Your attempt at a flush just brings in a 7 of Spades and an 8 of Hearts- nothing about either of them useful enough to get you more than a Jack High.

Looking around, you see that you managed to get the lowest of a low hand- Elizabeth and Lara only just above you with an Ace and King High, respectively, and a Pair of 2s from Lilith. Glancing around at the other hands, Zoey grins wide, before spreading out her hand- Three Aces staring back up at the table.

"Read 'em and weep!" she shouts.

"Damn! Looks like you used up all the luck that round, huh?" Lilith asks.

"Don't know why you're complaining," Lara says, "you managed to come up second. The rest of us couldn't manage a pair."

Lilith shrugs. "Hey, don't get mad at me. That's how this happens- sometimes you and your friends get together to take down a boss and all you get is crappy guns you already have better versions of. Sometimes, one of you gets to walk away with something nice and Pearlescent."

"...Do you ever get to all get something good?" you ask.

Lilith snorts. "Not as often as you'd like. Be happy we're not fighting for cards."

"Anyway," Zoey says, snapping her fingers at you, "stop stalling and make with the stripping! Before one of us does have to fight you out of them."

"Yeah, yeah..." you pull down the zipper on your hoodie. It's good timing, anyway; something about the idea of one of your table mates ripping the clothes off of you was starting to make you uncomfortably hot under the collar.

"Let's see if we can't make this a streak..." Zoey says as cards are dealt. You aren't sure whether she means her winning, your own losing, or what she might have in mind for your forfeit, but either way you gulp and take a look at your cards.

11121211.title: Drop the Queen and 5, go for a flush.

choices: Keep the Ace, King, and Jack.
111212111.content:
You take the best option of the pair. After losing one round, it doesn't feel like you want to try showing off with anything fancy, and of course that sort of thing is going to fly less and less as you get further into the game. And as you get your cards back, this turns out to be the best option- you could do just as much with a Queen, an 8, and a 9 as you could with your hand before. You calmly hand in your pair and leave it at that.

To your left, Elizabeth frowns as she puts down a Jack High, you can both see why she'd be upset- Lilith and Zoey are both looking at Pairs, and Lara just beats her with a King High.

Elizabeth sighs, and slowly begins to shed her petticoat. You know that it's still early in the game, and she's still as many items as you do, but it's definitely the most covering item that anyone's taken off yet, and its a lot of skin to see at once. Not to mention, it's easier to realize now that all she has left up top is her corset. Elizabeth glances around the table, seeing everyone staring at her, before looking down and rubbing an arm hesitantly.

Zoey lets out a low whistle, cracking her knuckles before picking up her cards. "I thought we'd have to get further in before we saw anything that big come off! Let's keep this going!"

"Don't get so cocky," Elizabeth fires back, somewhat quietly but with a playful edge to it. "We're not far into the night, and just because you haven't lost a hand yet doesn't mean you won't soon."

You nod and smirk while Zoey just shrugs, and you all take a second to look down at your hands.

111212111.title: Keep the 7s.

choices: Your socks. Keep the game going as it is.
Your button up shirt. Not a terrible loss, but maybe enough to pick things up.
Your jeans. Too much, or will it encourage others to start taking more off too?
1112121112.content:
Your heart sinks. The Club flush didn't work out for you so well, getting two cards back that don't do anything for you. [7(H), 6(S)] Looking to your right, Lara seems to have had a better time with a flush than you did, a full hand of Diamonds greeting you as she smirks to meet your gaze. Elizabeth manages a low Pair of 5s, while Lilith throws in a Pair of Kings, and Zoey keeps going strong with a Pair of Aces, leaving you with a measly Ace High.

"Aw, really?" Zoey asks, seeing you go for your socks. "Not going to go for anything bigger than that?"

You crack a small smile. "Yeah, sorry. Don't want to take off too much too fast, y'know?"

"C'mooon," Lilith chides you, "can't we make it worth your while to start getting a little more daring?" She's leaning over the table now, one hand propping up her chin. "What's your shirt worth? Pandoran money should be good in your time, and I've chest-loads of that."

Zoey starts nodding enthusiastically. "Oo, yeah! I've got connections around here, what if I sweeten the deal? There's tons of sweet gear I could talk the TF2 guys out of giving up. Or your own Gravity Gun!"

"Me and Lara'll take our pants off next time we lose if you lose yours now!" Sam shouts.

"Wh- No I won't"

"Tickets to see Jimmy Gibbs Jr.!"

"Moxxi's number! If you lose the pants I'll even throw in a good word for you!"

"Girls, enough!"

In the midst of an overwhelming storm of shouting, wagers, and the occasional whistle, Elizabeth slams her hands down on the table. The others (minus Lara, who didn't get into it to begin with) don't lose their smiles, and Lilith has even pulled out a stack of bills, but they settle down enough to let you breathe.

"Calm yourselves, everyone," Elizabeth starts, "don't start acting like wild animals." She pauses for a moment, before rolling her eyes. "Not this early in the game, at least."

"Fiiiiiine," Zoey says, "we'll keep waiting through all the boring small stuff."

"If that's what he chooses to go with, anyway. Offers still stand." Elizabeth shoots Lilith a look, and Lilith raises her hands in mock defense. "Hey, I'm just saying, he hasn't actually taken anything off yet."

Elizabeth looks back to you, and realizes that you actually haven't yet. She sits down next to you, and, crossing her arms, speaks gently to you. "Don't feel pressured here. Do what you will, but don't feel bad if you want to be smart about this."

As it turns out, you still feel kind of pressured. That being said, if you went for something bigger, maybe you could loosen people up without really losing anything too bad. As for your jeans.... that was probably a bit too far, but at least one other person had promised to match you. It sounds greedy, but there's something appealing about jumping right to the good stuff, even if you have to get there first.

A cough reminds you that you will need to choose quickly so, without further ado, you remove...
1112121112.title: Keep the Clubs.

11121211122.content:
"Okay. I'll listen to the Siren's call," you say and stand. There's some golf clapping as you unbutton your shirt.

Lilith smiles mischievously. "Well, I didn't mean I have the cash on me person. I can grab some at break." She glances to Zoey. "You'll need time to hook him up too, right?"

Zoey nods without looking away from your arms. "Hmm... oh, yeah. Unless you'll settle for a Bile bomb."

You shake your head, trying to act cool. "No hurry. I'm a patient man."

Elizabeth was straining from her seat as you took off the button-up. "What does your shirt say?"

Sam, who had been distracted from the table by Dante from DMC walking by, said "Probably 'Liquor in the front, poker in the rear.'"

There were a couple of groans before Lara read the faded print out loud: "I was playing poker with tarot cards the other night. I got a full house and four people died."

You shrugged as you sat down. "When you're Wright, you're right." You got a good chuckle from Zoey for that and checked your cards. You had a 8-high clubs flush.

"No draw for me." You put your hands behind your head and mused about who you wanted to lose this one. Before you decided, Zoey was shown to be the lowest with a busted A-high club flush draw.

"Nicely played, sir," Zoey said and stood. To your surprise, she unbuttoned her jeans.

Sam gave a quiet cheer. "That's the spirit, baby." Lilith smiled while the two bookworms blushed a little that jeans were coming off already.

"Hey," Zoey said turning her head back to look at you. "Would you help me with the zipper, please?"

You reflexively moved to her aid as the others mostly snickered. "Survives a zombie apocalypse, but needs a man to undo her zipper," Lilith quipped.

You grabbed the zipper, "Sometimes its easier to bring it back up before it can go back down." It took a couple of tries, but then it worked.

"Up and down, up and down, got it. Thanks a bunch," Zoey replied and turned back to the table. She pulled down the jeans slowly, like she was doing a private striptease. Her firm butt stuck out like you and her were about to freak dance.

"So tight," Zoey said as she finished taking them off and moved to sit down.

"Indeed," you said and sat down too.

"Lucky in cards, unlucky in love, her ass," Lilith joked as the cards were dealt, which finally made Zoey blush over her exhibition.

You swallowed. A lot of clothes to go, but that probably wasn't the reason you felt hot. Zoey smiled at you as you checked your new hand.

11121211122.title: Your button up shirt. Not a terrible loss, but ...

choices: Keep the King, drop the rest
Drop 6 and 3, hope for a Straight
111212111221.content:
A pair of threes wasn't a very strong hand, and even after ditching the rest of your hand, it wasn't going to look any stronger - a five of spades, six of diamonds and seven of spades. If you only had a four instead of a pair of threes, you'd actually have something here, as it was though, a pair of threes wasn't going to lose to a whole lot... hopefully one of these girls had a high card or a pair of twos.

As Lilith casually tossed a card and slipped a new one into her hand, a sly smirk grew on her face, "You know, thinking about it girls, we're winning. He's down three, and the rest of us are down one... well, except Elizabeth."

Elizabeth discarded three - you had to hope she was only holding a pair of twos now - and took a moment to consider the Siren's words, "Perhaps, but it isn't like the game is simply over if he loses. And that could change very quickly, none of us have a very strong lead."

"The game'll be over for poor old him though if he ends up naked! His manhood won't stand being beaten like that I bet!" commented Sam with a goofy grin still on her face.

"Erm, Sam we aren't going to beat him or anything, uhm, not like that..." sighed Lara, discarding three cards as well.

The drunken friend giggle and nudged Lara playfully, "I dunno about that, he might be beaten in more ways then one..."

Zoey couldn't help but laugh at the comment, "Well, I haven't even thought about the kind of punishment I could give him. I mean, he's been such a nice, accommodating gentleman so far, I don't wanna pick something too bad..."

"It isn't like I've lost yet..." you sighed with a small smile, "Don't go plotting right in front of me yet, alright?"

Still, as the cards were laid down, perhaps them plotting in front of you wasn't such a premature idea... as expected, a pair of threes was little match against them all. There was a bit of irony in the fact Elizabeth had a three of a kid with twos - if she had a pair earlier... ah well, no use dwelling on it now, the cards were down, and the clothing had to go.

The thought of going for your socks this time was a strong argument, but after Zoey's brash display it felt you had to keep the trend going or you'd lose face in front of the girls. Steeling yourself, you stood up in front of all the women and reached for your waist, a bit nervous as you fiddled with your jeans.

"Maybe your zipper should get stuck, I mean, they get stuck so easily, right?" teased Zoey with a wink, leaning forward slyly

Lilith grinned as she copied your pose from the last hand, "Now the game is really heating up. Now if you only took those off earlier, I'd let Moxxi know aaaalll about this little game..."

"Ah, no thats okay I've got this Zoey, but ah, thanks." you replied casually, finally managing to get a good enough grip to pull your zipper down and pull down your jeans.

You could suddenly feel five pairs of eyes all locked onto you, with varying degrees of intensity, as you sheepishly sat down. It wouldn't take a genius to guess at what they were trying to see... you didn't want to think about it too much, but this whole situation was probably more then... adequate.

"Hey, hey Lara. He better lose again and take his boxers off. I didn't get a good enough look." asked Sam flatly to her friend, who merely groaned.

"W-well, I'm sure if such a situation arises, we mi-might have such a chance." replied Elizabeth nervously, taking ownership of the cards and dealing them out.

111212111221.title: Keep Only the Pair

choices: Keep the 10 and the Ace, try for a Spade Flush.
1112121112211.content:
A rising sensation in one area is accompanied by a sinking feeling in another, as you throw away everything but your King and are met with an Ace, a Queen, a 5 and a 4, meaning an Ace High, even lower than last round. You see the others each throw away 4 as well, except for Elizabeth who seems to be holding onto at least a pair. Zoey and Elizabeth grimace, same as you probably did, and for a split second you spot Lilith furrowing her brow. She catches your gaze, and her eyes narrow before she starts to smirk.

"So," she says as she waits for everyone to get their cards back, "I've been thinking about what forfeit we should have you do."

"Hey now," you start, "what happened to me not being beaten yet?"

"That was before you lost those jeans," Zoey pointed out, and try as you might you can't really argue.

"See, I was thinking that once you're totally stripped, we can have you go back and forth the rest of the night and get us drinks." Lilith smiles at you, winking. "How's being our own naked waiter sound?"

Sam giggles. "Aw man, what if we made him where the little bow-tie collar and everything?" She seems amused at the idea, as does the rest of the table; Lilith is grinning wider, Zoey is snickering, Elizabeth and Lara are blushing...

"I was just gonna have him streak the bar, but I like that idea a lot," Zoey says.

"No reason we can't compromise," Lilith continues, "once we've got a round of drinks, maybe we can loan him to the main room. If I remember right, the Ladies' Night special starts soon..."

"Aw, man, that's perfect!"

You cough into your hand. "Y-Yeah, well... that's assuming I lose. You didn't look to happy with your hand either," you shoot back. Lilith's expression falls a little, before she rolls her eyes and shrugs, laying her cards on the table and the rest of you do the same. Sure enough, at the bottom of a low round, she's the loser, her King High falling under your and Lara's Aces, Zoey's Pair of 2's and far under Elizabeth's pair of 9's.

"Well, whatever," she says, "I'm still doing pretty good compared to some people. Anyway, I want to try something I think you'll all get a kick out of..." The Siren leans back in her chair, slowly closing her eyes and taking a deep breath. As she raises her arms, you can feel a static-cling sort of sensation across your skin and her Siren markings light up, filling the room with purple as she opens her eyes to reveal more of the same light pouring out. The table is rattling, the light is growing blinding, there's a wave of heat that flashes across your skin and--

"Ta-da!" Lilith says. You blink until you're able to see again, and when your vision returns you see her happily holding something up in her hands- her pink panties, stretched between her fingers before she tosses them into the center of the table.

"W-Woo!" Sam whistles, Elizabeth and Lara are blushing, but Elizabeth seems to be smiling at least.

"Well, I can't say I would have gone that far but, it was certainly an impressive demonstration nonetheless. How exactly do you... um...d-do you..."

"Oh I've pretty much always been awesome at using my powers. Took a little getting used to after they spiked kind of recently but... what?" Talking for a few moments, Lilith only just noticed Elizabeth looking away, blushing and not meeting her eyes.

"Uh, Lil?" Zoey said, sitting on Lilith's other side. "I think you might've done a little more than you wanted to." And as Lilith shot her a confused look, Zoey pointed down to Lilith's bottom half, hidden by the table. The Siren's eyes followed and then went wide before her hands shot South to cover herself.

"Oh shit," she said, "Gimmie a sec." There was another charged feeling in the air, a flash of purple, and an exhale from Lilith as she stood up slightly to reveal her returned shorts. "Think I'm good now," she said, patting herself down, smiling giddily in spite of the blush on her cheeks. Against your conscience, part of you wishes you'd thought to look under the table. Another part of you is happy they don't do the same to see that part. The six of you murmur and laugh as the cards are handed out again.

choices: Keep the queen and 4 of hearts
11121211122111.content:
Having your bad luck not hit you once but twice in a row you decide to play this round safe and keep you pair of tens while discarding the rest. The girls however seem to discard most their hand with only Elizabeth holding onto three cards, you could not help but look around the expressions of worry on their face as their new cards came to them.

As for your hand it wasn't not anything special and so you show the table your pair of tens making the face of Lara cringe as the other girls laid out their hands with Elizabeth holding three kings, Lilith a pair of sevens, Zoey a pair of fives, Sam a pair of six while poor Lara produced a hand of junk.

"Ok I guess I can take off my." However before Lara can decide what to remove Lilith speak up suggesting the tomb raider takes off her outer tank top making the whole table look at her with interest.

"Oh please like your all heard not interested in seeing Lara's body. I mean for her naked cheat blew her up into pieces so now let's take the kid gloves off huh ladies and of course gentleman." She said making the table nod in agreement. Seeing as Lara had no choice she removes her outer tank top giving you and the table quite a eye full.

"Nice!" Lilith teases the raider seeing at the outline of Lara's rather large bust through her tight light blue tank top. At that a moment you watch all of the women look down at their chests before looking at back the raider's female assists. The moment not matter how awkward it felt certainly got you looking at Lara's chest before catching her looking at back you with an angry look.

"I think we should all return to the game now." Lara remarks in an angry British tone of voice making everyone quickly return to their eyes to their cards as the game continues.

11121211122111.title: Keep the Pair of 10s.

111212111221111.content:
"Woah, wait a second," Zoey interjects, "Aren't we forgetting something?" She turns, and the rest of the table follows her gaze, to Sam, who is only just getting to her feet after Lara's loss.

"Yeah, yeah," Sam says, "gimmie a minute, I wasn't paying attention..."

"Might want to slow down with the drinks, sport," Lilith tells her, sipping her own beverage.

"Yeah, yeah," Sam says, rolling her eyes, "I'm fine. Just wasn't paying attention." She huffs, and then looks around the table, grinning. Turning away from the table, her hands start fiddling with the front of her pants, getting a murmur out of the group as she sways from side to side, slowly inching the waistband down.

"Look who's having fun with it!" Zoey laughs. You chuckle a little as well, but mostly you're just transfixed as Sam slowly drags her pants down her backside, dragging her underwear with them ever so slightly, letting her round ass come into view, more and more....

"Nope!"

Sam shuffles her pants back up, and starts undoing her jacket.

"You tease!" Lilith remarks, grinning.

"If you guys wanted those off so soon than somebody," and Sam waggles her finger at you," should have lost his jeans when me and Lara--"

"I didn't make any--!"

"When me and Lara made that offer!" And she punctuates her speech by tossing her jacket off at you with a giggle. You roll your eyes a bit, before getting back to your cards.

"There's still plenty of game left," you shoot back.

"Yeah," Zoey says, "but for some of us more than others."

You frown a little bit at not being able to show anything more than the Pair of 5's that you started with, especially when Lara puts down a Pair of Jacks, and Elizabeth follows it up with 2 Pair, 9 and 6. "Maybe you've seen a King lose to a Queen," Lilith starts, "but your King definitely isn't going to beat an Ace." Lara's frown turns into a scowl for a moment, and you offer an apologetic smile over just barely edging her into last place. Luckily, you didn't have to weather her frown for too long; as Sam tosses off her jacket (nearly blinding a passing City 17 citizen turned waiter), Lara gets stuck apologizing and scolding her friend, before she loses her socks.

"Still anyone's game," Zoey points out, as the cards get reshuffled and dealt.

Hoping to break the tension, you clear your throat and try fielding a question. "So," you say, "have any of you done this sort of thing before?" Your heart sinks as you're met with an awkward silence, a few heads shaking no, before Zoey starts up.

"Well, I haven't done anything quite like this, but you'd be surprised what sort of mods people make." Zoey pauses for a second, and snickers. "Maybe not that surprised."

"Mods?"

"Oh sure! People change up the game all sorts of ways! Makes sense that a few pervs would get in on the act too." Zoey starts counting on her fingers as cards are dealt in front of her. "Lessee, there's the 'Naked Zoey' mod- not fun when a Boomer or a Spitter shows up-, there's the mod that tears my outfit in a few 'convenient' places... A few mods that make a Smoker's tongue come out of some less-than-pleasant places on it's model..."

Zoey grins while Lilith and Sara chuckle. Lara and Elizabeth seem more subdued, blushing, but they nod in agreement. "Used to be that people would hunt for some code to get me in the altogether. Now you can just download some file and..." Lara makea a motion to her top " Bam!" She grins slightly despite her blush, loosening up.

"And now people make all sorts of pictures with the, oh, what is it again?" Elizabeth says, "'Source Filmmaker?'"

The girls murmur in assent, everyone smiling at least a little bit at this point. You're happy to see people loosening up a bit, and laugh a little yourself, and your smile doesn't leave as you glance down at a decent hand.

112.content:
Ah, that's right. The Fighter Table. Without further adieu you step out of the car and towards the nondescript building in which The Inventory is housed. A bouncer, who may or may not have been Dudley from Street Fighter, opens the door for you as you show him your invitation. You step inside and inhale the musty smells of smoke and alcohol. You make your way through the semi-crowded room, noticing a few familiar faces as you head towards the back. You're pretty sure you saw Solid Snake sharing a a beer with Gordon Freeman, but you didn't get a good enough look. No one seems to pay much attention to you as you cross the room. Finally, you reach the entrance to the VIP area. You show your invitation to the bouncer up front (some Half Life Civil Protection goon by the look of him), and he lets you in.

         You step inside the room and you see your four fellow players already at the table: Kasumi (http://i.imgur.com/eRU0hj2.jpg), Cassandra (http://i.imgur.com/1TAVwEY.jpg), Chun Li (http://i.imgur.com/TcE56U4.jpg) and Morrigan (http://i.imgur.com/HIPFdSh.jpg).

         "Well, well, well...look who just walked in." Morrigan says with a sultry grin.

         "Finally! We were about to start without you." Cassandra says. "At least this isn't going to be a total girl-fest. No offense, buddy, but I'm going to be rooting against you in this."

         "Aww, girl-fests aren't so bad, blond one. I know from experience," Morrigan says with a wink. "Still, this one's not so bad. Maybe if you're lucky, stud, I'll let you join my collection." Her grin turns predatory as bats suddenly flutter around her. "I'll have you know they rather enjoy their lives," she adds as she gestures to them. "They live in a constant state of ecstasy, forever satisfying me and being satisfied by me. The perks of being a succubus."

         "Umm...I don't..." you begin, flustered.

         "She's just being dramatic," Chun Li cuts in, rolling her eyes. "The one thing she actually craves most in the world is attention."

         "Don't sound so dismissive," Morrigan purrs. "I haven't given up on your either, Legs."

         "If we may continue then," Kasumi interjects. "We're all here, so let's go over the rules. We're playing basic five card draw so this doesn't take all night. At the beginning of each hand we all get five cards. After we have those, each of us can turn in any of those, up to all five, for replacements. Once we've done that, everyone puts down their hands and the loser has to take something off. Once a person is rendered naked all of us here at the table get to decide what that person has to do as punishment. The last person left with anything on is the winner."

         "I can hardly wait. Winning or losing doesn't matter. I win regardless," Morrigan says.

         "Well if you are offering to take it all off now and make things a little easier on us, be my guest," Cassandra says.

         "Oh no, I couldn't do that. It's the risk and anticipation that's most of the fun. Besides, I wouldn't deprive myself of the chance to best all of you and claim you as my own."

         "I...don't think that's in the rules..." Kasumi says with a blush.

         "We'll see..." Morrigan responds.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------

113.content:
Ah, that's right. WRPG Table. Without further adieu you step out of the car and towards the nondescript building in which The Inventory is housed. A bouncer, who may or may not have been Dudley from Street Fighter, opens the door for you as you show him your invitation. You step inside and inhale the musty smells of smoke and alcohol. You make your way through the semi-crowded room, noticing a few familiar faces as you head towards the back. You're pretty sure you saw Solid Snake sharing a a beer with Gordon Freeman, but you didn't get a good enough look. No one seems to pay much attention to you as you cross the room. Finally, you reach the entrance to the VIP area. You show your invitation to the bouncer up front (some Half Life Civil Protection goon by the look of him), and he lets you in.

         You step inside the room and you see your four fellow players already at the table: Liara (http://i.imgur.com/7UFd8A2.jpg), Jeanette (http://i.imgur.com/WzyYeDz.jpg), Sis (http://i.imgur.com/nGTuVFM.jpg) and Triss (http://i.imgur.com/USt1eUm.jpg).

         "Ah, it would seem that we are all here now," Liara says as she spots you enter.

         "Yes it would," Jeanette agrees with a seductive smile. "And here I thought the spread was already so excellent. You seem so...ordinary compared to the others here, little boy. Don't worry, I mean that as a compliment. It makes you...unique. Not to mention you're a man, so you'll at least offer some variety to the collection of skin. Assuming you don't win, that is, which I might add is something I hope doesn't happen. I bet you'd look absolutely adorable taking it all off."

         "Little boy?" You say, bemused.

         "Relatively speaking, I suppose. Immortality tends to frame mortal lifespans in a different light," she answers.

         "Well, I'm 108," Liara says.

         "Oh? Well, you're not exactly human are you, blue girl? Then again, neither am I," Jeanette comments.

         "I'm also over 100. I don't like giving exacts. It tends to depress me," Triss says slyly. "One of the perks of magic," she adds.

         "Well, I guess we're all a little older than we look here," Jeanette says. "What about you, quiet one? Are you hiding secret powers as well?" Jeanette looks at Sis. Sis rolls her eyes and sighs, pauses for a few seconds and holds up all ten of her fingers twice. "Is that supposed to mean 20? Is there any reason you couldn't just tell us?"

         Sis gives Jeanette a withering sardonic look, grabs a pen and writes on a pad of paper next to her. She holds up the pad and the message reads: "I'm mute."

         "Ooooooh," Jeanette says.

         Sis turns to the next page on the pad which reads: "Dumb bitch."

         "Well now, she's feisty. I like her. This is going to be fun," Jeanette says.

         "If we may continue then," Liara interjects. "We're all here, so let's go over the rules. We're playing basic five card draw for the sake of brevity, so no betting. At the beginning of each hand we all get five cards. After we have those, each of us can turn in any of those, up to all five, for replacements. Once we've done that, everyone puts down their hands and the loser has to take something off. Once a person is rendered naked all of us here at the table get to decide what that person has to do as punishment. The last person left with anything on is the winner."

         "Well, I'm certainly not shy, but I've seen me naked before. All of you on the other hand..." Jeanette says.

         "Aren't you laying on the seductive vampire thing a little thick?" Triss asks.

         "Well, Daddy always said to do what you love. I wonder if I'll grow to love any of you?" Jeanette giggles and you can see her fangs.

         "I guess I shouldn't have asked..." Triss says dully.

113.title: WRPG Table

114.content:
Ah, that's right. JRPG Table. Without further adieu you step out of the car and towards the nondescript building in which The Inventory is housed. A bouncer, who may or may not have been Dudley from Street Fighter, opens the door for you as you show him your invitation. You step inside and inhale the musty smells of smoke and alcohol. You make your way through the semi-crowded room, noticing a few familiar faces as you head towards the back. You're pretty sure you saw Solid Snake sharing a a beer with Gordon Freeman, but you didn't get a good enough look. No one seems to pay much attention to you as you cross the room. Finally, you reach the entrance to the VIP area. You show your invitation to the bouncer up front (some Half Life Civil Protection goon by the look of him), and he lets you in.

         You step inside the room and you see your four fellow players already at the table: Elizabeth (http://i.imgur.com/7LrQ9kQ.png), Jessica (http://i.imgur.com/fy2cyrb.jpg), Tifa (http://i.imgur.com/InOydrF.png) and Aika (http://i.imgur.com/u0uu8YS.jpg).

         "Oh! It seems our last guest has arrived!" Elizabeth pipes up as you enter. "It's very nice to meet you! My name is Elizabeth."

         "I have a feeling he knows that..." Jessica says.

         "Oh, I'm sorry. I'm just rather excited to be here. I have a strong suspicion that this is going to be a very memorable experience. After all, there are so many unique faces here. I look forward to seeing all of your true selves laid bare," Elizabeth says.

         "I guess that's one way of putting it," Tifa reasons.

         "I suspect you might be the most unique of all of us, though, young man. You are the only male here, of course. I wonder how that will affect the dynamics," Elizabeth says, her bright yellow eyes on you.

         "Well..." you begin. "I guess it might mean you're all gunning for me."

         "If the rules allowed for that perhaps we would be," Jessica says. "Alas, it's mostly luck."

         "And I'm very lucky!" Aika pips up.

         "Now, just so I'm clear, we are playing strip poker, yes? The daring game in which one wagers their modesty instead of monetary wealth? I have very much wanted to try it. I have no shortage of funds, but the thrill of losing here is much more substantial. I can see why you humans would find it exhilarating," Elizabeth says.

         "Wait...we're not...playing for treasure?" Aika says.

         "How could you not know that?" Jessica says.

         "I just thought it was regular poker. Are you saying I don't stand to win any treasure here?" Aika asks, her voice nearly whiny.

         "We signed papers...how could you have not known?" Tifa says.

         "I guess I didn't look close enough..." Aika says in a small voice.

         "Well, do not feel too alarmed. You said yourself that you are very lucky, correct? If this is true, you have nothing to worry about. Besides, not all treasures are measured in physical wealth. Many come from far less tangible places, like the bonds you create with others. I wonder if will be creating special bonds with any of you..." Elizabeth says, her usual mystical airy tone now colored with the slightest suggestive undertone.

         "Man, where did they find this girl?" Jessica asks.

         "If you would all be so kind as to listen to the rules then," Elizabeth interjects. "We're playing basic five card draw for the sake of brevity, so that means no betting of any kind. At the beginning of each hand we all receive five cards. After we have those, each of us can turn in any of those, up to all five, for replacements. Once we've done that, everyone puts down their hands and the loser has to remove an article of clothing. Once a person is rendered naked all of us here at the table get to decide what that person has to do as punishment. The last person left with anything on is the winner. Is that clear to everyone?"

         Everyone at the table nods in affirmation and the cards are dealt out.

114.title: JRPG Table

1141.content:
A king and nine of spades slightly improved your hand, if only bumping up your next highest card to a king instead of a jack, still at least your hand wasn't any worse off.

"A trio of queens, it almost reflects our table right now, does it not?" says Elizabeth, giggling softly as she reveals her cards.

Jessica frowns as she lays down her cards, only a meager pair of fives, "Close, but not quite. You've set the bar pretty high, and I'm feeling I might come up short this round."

"A pair of fives isn't the best starting hand, but hey on the other hand, the night has just begun. Losing a round right now isn't going to mean too much." replies the black-haired fighter laying down a pair of kings.

Aika has a happy grin on her face, showing off her pair of nines, "Don't feel too down Jessica, I mean someone has to lose every round, and you can't have [i]my[/i] luck! And hey, who knows, he might have something worse then a pair of fives."

Jessica glances towards you for confirmation, and you respond with a casual shrug and innocent smile, showing off your pair of sevens. The orange-haired girl returns the innocent smile, reaching under the table, "Oh well, like I said, its mostly luck in this set-up."

It doesn't take long for Jessica to procure her nice pair of boots, raising them up for show, before setting them aside. Looking down at the table, you notice someone has already gone and dealt out new cards, you spare a glance at them before returning your attention to the ladies.

"Probably for the best, I think if we had betting going on, Elizabeth would probably have an undefeatable poker face."

The mysterious girl slightly tilts her head to the side, "Is that so? I have heard of this 'poker face' before, but I confess to not understanding the thought behind it. Still, if it would've given me an advantage, it would make for a interesting night for me. I hope you will all soon be completely bare for me."

"I know you had the highest hand for the opening round, but don't get too cocky about it alright? I'd much rather keep my clothes on for the night..." replies Tifa with a slight shake of her head.

"Yeah me too! Hey, can I keep the clothes if I win? I'd rather prefer some kind of physical treasure, so maybe I can keep your clothes! And if you want them back, maybe you can try to haggle for it. Memories are nice and all, but actual goods tend to be more useful."

"You know, I'm not really sure if that's how the rules work. Was there anything in the fine print on if we actually don't get our clothes back after the forfeit? I guess its a little early to be worried about that. Not like my boots are anything special."

1152.content:
Ah, that's right. The Junior League. Without further adieu you step out of the car and towards the nondescript building in which The Inventory is housed. A bouncer, who may or may not have been Dudley from Street Fighter, opens the door for you as you show him your invitation. You step inside and inhale the musty smells of smoke and alcohol. You make your way through the semi-crowded room, noticing a few familiar faces as you head towards the back. You're pretty sure you saw Solid Snake sharing a a beer with Gordon Freeman, but you didn't get a good enough look. No one seems to pay much attention to you as you cross the room. Finally, you reach the entrance to the VIP area. You show your invitation to the bouncer up front (some Half Life Civil Protection goon by the look of him), and he lets you in.

         You step inside the room and you see your four fellow players already at the table: Ellie (http://i.imgur.com/Z62s3Vm.jpg), Clementine (http://i.imgur.com/Yiarblj.png), Sunny (http://i.imgur.com/6TZLWBX.jpg) and Serena (http://i.imgur.com/gPLQxtw.png).

         "Oh, hey, it looks like the last player is here," Ellie says, looking at you as you enter.

         "It's...it's a man," Sunny says, slightly off guard. She looks a bit nervous.

         "Yeah, that's kind of weird," Clementine says, eying you suspiciously.

         "What gives, dude?" Ellie asks. "Is there some reason you wanted to play strip poker against a bunch of little girls?"

         "I'm not that little," Clem says, slightly annoyed.

         "Well yeah, neither am I. I just mean...ya know...in comparison."

         "Uh...I didn't pick the game. This is just what it said on the invite," You say.

         "But you still came here anyway knowing who you'd play against..." Sunny replies.

         "Well...yeah, but...this is the Inventory. How else am I gonna get in here? Did you know I saw Solid Snake out there?" You say back. Ellie cocks an eyebrow and smirks.

         "Do you want us to invite him in here instead?" She offers sarcastically.

         "Eep, please don't!" Sunny pipes up. "He doesn't know I'm here! I would be in so much trouble. The same goes for anyone else in here..."

         "Good point," Clem says.

         "I am not sure how you all feel about it," Serena interjects. You notice she has a French accent. Or well...the whatever the Pokemon world calls France. Kalos, pretty sure. "But I do not mind this man playing with us. In fact, I think it could be quite fun."

         "Of course you do," Ellie says, rolling her eyes.

         "Besides, we are the majority here. All forfeits are decided by consensus, no? That would make it doubly bad for him if he loses," Serena adds with a note of mischief. "Besides, we outnumber him and security is right out the door, as well as Blondie's guardian. I do not think we have anything to fear from this man. And even if he did decide to get colorful, I have a few friends here that would simply love to make his acquaintance." Serena gestures over to her bag beside her, inside of which are several multicolored balls.

         "Okay, damn, guys, I just came here for cards..." You say.

         "Not exactly the normal kind," Clem says.

         "I know, I know. Just...treat me like you would any other player. I'm on your guy's turf. You make the rules," You say.

         "Well fine then. Speaking of rules," Ellie says. "We're playing basic five card draw so the game doesn't take all night, so that means no betting. At the beginning of each hand we'll all get five cards. After we have those, each of us can turn in any of those, up to all five, for new ones. Once we've done that, everyone puts down their hands and the loser has to strip. Once a person is bare-assed all of us here at the table get to decide what that person has to do as punishment. The last person left with anything on wins. Everyone got that?"

         "I think so. I've never played poker before, though. I just know how it works," Clem says.

         "Ah, you'll do fine," Ellie answers.

         "What about you? We...uh...kind of both didn't exactly have normal childhoods..."

         "Yeah, sure. I played loads of times with my friend Riley."

         "Strip poker, though?"

         "A...few times, yeah. She had terrible luck, though." Ellie grins. "You actually kind of remind me of her."

         "Gee, thanks."

         "No, not the luck part. Just in the general attitude. Ya know, the whole confident, survivor badass kind of deal. It was always kinda hot." Clem raises an eyebrow. "I mean she was! Not that you aren't, though, or well I'm...ya know...not trying to...you get what I'm trying to say."

         "Not really..."

         "She was saying that she was attracted to another girl who was like you in many ways, and thus likely finds those qualities in you attractive as well, though she does not want to come out and say that," Serena says, smirking.

         "Thanks for the input, Frenchie," Ellie says, rolling her eyes.

         "I do not know this French, but I do know what you are feeling. I personally had a very similar experience with my friend Shauna. We played a game similar to this. Only instead of cards, we battled our Pokemon. She was never that adept at it, though, so she never saw much. I certainly did not mind the view on my end, of course," Serena reminisces.

         "Let's...just play cards..." Clem says.

         "Yeah..." Sunny agrees.

         Damn, what have you gotten yourself in to?

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------

1153.content:
Ah, that's right. The Zombie Hunter Table. Without further adieu you step out of the car and towards the nondescript building in which The Inventory is housed. A bouncer, who may or may not have been Dudley from Street Fighter, opens the door for you as you show him your invitation. You step inside and inhale the musty smells of smoke and alcohol. You make your way through the semi-crowded room, noticing a few familiar faces as you head towards the back. You're pretty sure you saw Solid Snake sharing a a beer with Gordon Freeman, but you didn't get a good enough look. No one seems to pay much attention to you as you cross the room. Finally, you reach the entrance to the VIP area. You show your invitation to the bouncer up front (some Half Life Civil Protection goon by the look of him), and he lets you in.

         You step inside the room and you see your four fellow players already at the table: Jill (http://i.imgur.com/wTWduhA.jpg), Juliet (http://i.imgur.com/mxRXLgy.jpg), Clarie (http://i.imgur.com/gGPcoa9.jpg) and Annie (http://i.imgur.com/Y0sxHKN.png).

         "It looks like we've got our last player now," Claire says as you come in.

         "That we do. C'mon, pull up a chair. We're just about to start," Jill says.

         "He seems kinda hot," Juliet says, smirking.

         "I guess..." Annie responds.

         "I'm just saying...it's good to have a guy in the game."

         "Uh...thanks, I guess?" You say.

         "Don't mention it. Anyway, it's nice to see you, Claire. I heard Zoe supposed to be at this table, though?" Juliet asks.

         "Yeah, but someone dropped out of the shooter table at the last minute, so they asked her to take over since her game is all about guns," Jill says. "So I called Claire on short notice and she said 'yes.'"

         "Well, it's just nice to be doing something for a change," Claire sighs.

         "Aw, chin up. You'll get cycled back in eventually," Jill says kindly.

         "Says the girl who's been in two of the last three," Claire fires back, amused.

         "Heh, good point," Jill says. "Anyway, I guess we should go on with this, so let's get to the rules. We're playing basic five card draw so the game is faster, so that means no betting of any kind. At the beginning of each hand we all receive five cards. After we have those, each of us can turn in any of those, up to all five, for replacements. Once we've done that, everyone puts down their hands and the loser has to remove an article of clothing. Once a person is naked all of us here at the table get to decide what that person has to do as punishment. The last person left with anything on is the winner. Is that clear to everyone?"

         Everyone at the table nods in affirmation and the cards are dealt out.
