12.title: Adolescent Male Gamer

choices: Ditch everything and hope for soem face cards.
121.content:
Ah, that's right. The Shooter Table. Without further adieu you step out of the car and towards the nondescript building in which The Inventory is housed. A bouncer, who may or may not have been Dudley from Street Fighter, opens the door for you as you show him your invitation. You step inside and inhale the musty smells of smoke and alcohol. You make your way through the semi-crowded room, noticing a few familiar faces as you head towards the back. You're pretty sure you saw Solid Snake sharing a a beer with Gordon Freeman, but you didn't get a good enough look. No one seems to pay much attention to you as you cross the room. Finally, you reach the entrance to the VIP area. You show your invitation to the bouncer up front (some Half Life Civil Protection goon by the look of him), and he lets you in.

         You step inside the room and you see your four fellow players already at the table: Elizabeth (http://tinyurl.com/lt49zm5), Lilith (http://tinyurl.com/mvtxhub) Zoey (http://i.imgur.com/mzlywnj.jpg) and Lara Croft (http://i.imgur.com/wogG6Ve.png). You also note another woman is sitting at a booth nearby, seemingly spectating. On closer inspection she appears to be Samantha Nishimura (http://i.imgur.com/GphLqyk.png), Lara's friend. Maybe she got to come as Lara's guest, perhaps?

         "Ah, it seems our final player has arrived," Elizabeth says brightly.

         "Not very big on punctuality is he?" Lilith comments.

         "Meh, who needs to be on time? And hey...it's...kind of a young kid. Wow." Zoey pipes up.

         "Can't say I was expecting that," Lara interjects.

         "Well, it may not be my first choice, but when life gives you lemons, right? At least we finally have someone male here," Zoey says. "You're male, right?"

         "Uh...yeah, I guess." You reply, awkwardly.

         "You see! Isn't that better? Wouldn't you rather there be a guy here, Lara?" Zoey asks. Lara rubs the back of her neck and avoids eye contact.

         "Offff course I would. Heh heh. Yeah. The more guys the merrier!" She replies nervously. You can see Sam rolling her eyes from her seat. You notice one of her drink glasses is empty and she's already working on another.

         "Anyway," Lilith interjects. "We're all here, so let's go over the rules. We're playing basic five card draw so this doesn't take all night. At the beginning of each hand we all get five cards. After we have those, each of us can turn in any of those, up to all five, for replacements. Once we've done that, everyone puts down their hands and the loser has to take something off. Once a person gets bare-assed all of us here at the table get to decide what that person has to do as punishment. The last person left with anything on is the winner."

         "And that winner is going to be Lara!" Sam says, slurring a bit.

         "Sam! Pipe down, we haven't even started yet," Lara responds.

         "You sure about that, girlie? Wanna make a bet?" Lilith asks.

         "Hell yes!" Sam says enthusiastically. "Lara rescued me single-handedly from a cult, so I'm pretty sure she can do this. As a show of solidarity, every time she takes something off, I will too."

         "You don't have to do this, Sam..." Lara says, slightly worried.

         "I say let her make her own mistakes," Zoey says with a smirk.

         "It's not like I could stop her, anyway," Lara says, resigned.

         "Besides, it won't even matter because you are going to rock it!" Sam says.

         "Is everyone ready then?" Elizabeth interrupts, bemused at the entire spectacle before her. After a bit of a double-take, everyone nods in agreement. The cards are passed out and you look at your hand.

choices: The King and the Pair of Threes
1211.content:
It's not a great hand, you tell yourself, but it's not the worst hand either. And you don't have to have the best hand, you remind yourself. You just have to stay off the bottom.

The three new cards you draw are the Six of Spades, the Jack of Diamonds, and the Four of Clubs.

The third six makes you smile. If you were home and online, you'd be pushing the betting up.

As it happens, you're hand wasn't the high one in the round, but it wasn't the lower either. That honor goes to Elizabeth. On one hand, your kind of glad the low hand wasn't Lilith or Lara. The way Lilith and Sam had been antagonizing each other, you're not sure what kind of rackus would have ensued if one or the other had had to remove an article of clothing. But you actually feel a little sorry for Elizabeth. I mean, yes, if you had the chance, you'd want to see Elizabeth nude, but on the other hand, Elizabeth was just sitting over there, being nice, when Sam and Lilith were haranguing each other,

As if reading your mind, Elizabeth gives you a bright "no need to worry" look, as she bends over and removes first one boot, then the other. Then the next five cards are dealt out.

12111.content:
The pair of threes ain't much, but it's better than nothing. So you keep the pair of threes, and the King for the kicker, and ask for two cards.

You get the King of Clubs and the Seven of Diamonds. Two pair! You are definitely not complaining!

As it turns out, Zooey has the lowest hand, with an Ace high nothing. It's actually kind of anticlimactic too. Zoe just smiles, removes her hoodie, then undoes her ponytail and shakes it out.

You have to admit. as much as you'd like to see Lara, Lilith and Sam naked (both singularly and collectively), you're not looking forward to the first time Lara or Lilith loses a hand. After Sam's and Lilith's heated exchange, you aren't looking forward to that at all.

Just concentrate on not losing, you tell yourself, as you take the cards for your next hand:

12111.title: The King and the Pair of Threes

12112.content:
Pair of threes. Not the worst hand you've ever had, but you don't think it's going to be good enough to keep you from having the worst hand. So with a wish and a hope, you discard everything but your pair.

You end up drawing the Ace of Spades, the Ace of Hearts and the Four of Clubs.

Lucky draw, but you're not complaining!

Lara ends up having the lowest hand, and Sam gives you a sullen glare, as if she blames you personally for the great Lara Croft losing a hand of poker.

"It's just one hand," you manage to mumble, and Lara intervenes.

"Of course it is," she says, then gives Sam a pointed look. "And we take our losses with our wins." With that, Lara takes off one of her tank tops, then looks over at Sam. Sam looks down at the table for a few seconds and then, in a huff, takes off her jacket.

Maybe things will get better, now that the first loss is out of the way, you think. And Lilith and Zoey kept quiet, so maybe that will calm Sam down.

Hoping, but not really believing, that Sam's mood won't spoil the evening, you take your next five cards.

12112.title: The pair of threes

choices: The King and the pair of sixes
12113.content:
It's kind of weird, the strategy you're having to play. Normally, you'd be playing (when you play online, or with your family), to optimize your hand. There'd be a little bluffing and, if necessary, some folding. But here, you can't fold and cut your losses. You have to stay throughout the hand. So your strategy is not to have the lowest hand.

This is going to take a little time to get used to, you tell yourself. You just hope you can adapt before you lose everything!

You discard everything but the king and the ten, and draw the Ten of Hearts, the Ten of Spades, and the Nine of Diamonds.

Well, that was much better than you were expecting!

When all the other hands are displayed, Lara ends up having the lowest hand, with a pair of sixes. Zoey starts whooping it up and drumming on the table as she looks stra8ght at Sam, who is pointedly not returning her look. Lara slides off her outer tank top and, after a few seconds of silence, Sam follows suit by removing her jacket. She sits at her booth sullenly after she does.

Hoping that somehow Sam's mood will change, but not really sure how to make thatT change happen, you take your five cards for the next round.

12113.title: The King and the Ten

12114.content:
You're sitting there, thinking about which cards to discard, and which ones to keep, when the door bangs open.

"What the hell?" all five ladies say as they turn their attention to the new arrival, a nondescript male character in a suit. Personally, you would have knocked first, before entering the room. Entering the room full of the four most notorious shooters in gaming doesn't seem to be the healthiest decision one can make.

"We got a situation," the new arrival explains. "One that needs your attention. One that can't be explained to an outsider," he adds, looking directly at you.

All four ladies get up and, after Lara makes arrangements for Sam, everyone disappears but you and the messenger.

"Just sit tight, kid, we'll get some substitutes in here for you shortly," the messenger says before disappearing, leaving you wait.

12114.title: The game is interrupted

121141.content:
Even though your parents think you're at a baseball camp, and won't be looking to see you for three days, doesn't mean you want to spend all night to get a game started. You were already excited when Elizabeth had to remove her boots, and were hoping to see more.

Fortunately, you don't have to wait long. The guy who took Elizabeth and all the other shooters away comes back in.

"Normally, we try to group these things along a theme," the guy explains. "That's at the girls' request. They feel more comfortable, and enjoy the conversation, even if their worlds don't have anything in common." The guy shrugs. "I don't understand, but then I'm just a background character. Sometimes we have a waiting list, though, of a girl who wants to get in on a game. So tonight, we asked the girls on the waiting list if they would mind jumping genres if it meant they could get in a game. Nobody minded. So they should be here shortly."

You thank him and go back to waiting.

Pretty soon, you hear laughter and conversation coming toward the door.

When the door opens, the first two women to walk in are Tifa Lockhart (https://banner2.kisspng.com/20180526/izk...) and Cassie Cage (https://static1.thegamerimages.com/wordp...).

You're kind of surprised to see Tifa there, but then you think, maybe she's trying to cheer somebody up.

Tifa is laughing at something that Cassie has said. When Cassie catches you looking at them, she laughs and says, "Don't worry about how I'm dressed, kid. They caught me before I started my workout. So I'm still fresh as an Irish Spring."

That got another laugh from Tifa as the two headed toward the table.

The next two women who entered the room were Nadine Ross and Chloe Frazer (https://i.ytimg.com/vi/_AGCX_dV_v8/maxre...), who were in a deep conversation. They looked up and nodded at you before taking their seats.

Nadine took a seat by Cassie. As soon as she did, Cassie stood up and asked, "Tifa, would you mind changing seats with me?"

"What is your problem?" Nadine said, coming to her feet.

"My problem is that I don't sit next to mercenaries." Cassie responded, and you're wondering if there's going to be a fight. If there is, the only thing you'll be able to do is find a place to hide and hope you don't get hurt.

"Hey, she doesn't do that any more," Chloe interjects, also coming to her feet. "And anyway, it's not like there's ever going to be a crossover between our worlds."

"Friends, friends," Tifa interjects. "We're not being very nice to our guest," she says with a smile to you. "Cassie, switch places with me, and everybody, apologize to our guest."

In your humble opinion, Tifa could probably kick everybody's ass in the room, all without breaking a sweat. But she is probably also the one person who want everyone to get along too.

Everybody nods and says "sorry, kid" to you as Cassie and Tifa switch places. Then Tifa says, "And I think, as a gesture of camaraderie, which should all let our hair be loose." With that, Tifa undoes her braid and shakes her hair loose. The other women shrug and follow suit.

"Okay, if we're done with the camaraderie phase," Nadia interjects, "How about we play some cards?" This got a laugh from everyone in the room, and you feel the tension go down several notches in the room as the cards are dealt out.

Everybody nods, and your heart beats at the thoughts of the possible forfeits.

"How about, whoever has the highest hand when somebody loses is the one who gets to suggest the forfeit, and the rest of us get to say Yea or Nay?" Cassie suggests.

Everyone agrees, and you're wondering what kind of forfeits you might suggest. You've never been with a girl your own age before---not that way, anyway---and now you might have a chance to do something with one or more of the women you're playing cards with.

"Okay, now that we've got that settled," Cassie continues, "Let's show our hands."

You don't have the winning hand, but you don't have the losing hand either. Tifa would have won the hand with her Queen High Straight, and Cassie loses it with a pair of eights.

"I'm like Nadine," Cassie said, taking off her socks. "I was happier when I thought you were trying to lose." Cassie says it with a laugh and a wink to Tifa, to let her know she's just kidding.

You're pretty happy too. You've been able to keep your clothes on, the women are definitely in a good mood and, well, everything is fun. You're probably beaming as you take your next five cards.

1211413122241.content:
It's such a no brainer, you don't even think as you discard everything but the Queens.

You are in your own little world for a moment, because Cassie has asked you a question, and you didn't hear it.

"I asked you," she repeats with a smile, "What do you do for fun when you're not trying to win the clothes of four grown women?"

This gets a laugh from everybody else, though Tifa gives you a little smile as if to tell you that she is just teasing you because she likes you.

Blushing, you reply, "Well, I play a lot of baseball. And I'm really good. I was on the statewide All-Star team both for junior high and eight grade. My coach says if I continue training and practicing hard, I should skip junior varsity when I go to high school. In fact, that's where my parents think I am right now, a three day baseball camp. The Inventory set it all up."

"Yeah, they're good at that sort of thing," Cassie said. "So you're covered for three whole days now. I've got an idea."

Chloe shook her head. "How come everytime I hear someone use those four words, it means something will get blown up from underneath me in the near future?"

This gets a laugh from everyone, and Cassie continues, "I promise, Chloe, no plastic explosives will be utilized in this bet. But since the kid is covered for three days, I say we add one more rule, to give him some extra incentive."

"Seeing us naked isn't incentive enough?" Nadine chuckles, sending you another wink.

"Good point, but let's put our little baseball player into extra innings," Cassie says. "If the kid here is the last person with clothes on, we have to do an unlimited number of forfeits for him until his three day weekend is up. Since there's a giant pull out bed in one of the walls of this room, that door leads to a private set of showers and baths," Cassie says, pointing to a door besides the one you entered the room through, "And the drink and food service in here is automated, we'll be uninterrupted for the three days. And if he does well enough, we'll get the Inventory to convince his parents that the baseball camp was for a week."

The other women laugh about Cassie's joke about holding you over for a week, but you're not really listening. The only thing you're hearing is Cassie saying that, if you're the last person with their clothes on, the women will basically be your sex slaves for the weekend!

This is not the sort of thing that happens to thirteen year old virgins, but you're not complaining.

"Just a few rules, though," Cassie says, "No anal or pain or nasty stuff, and we still might veto, though not often," she says with a wink to you. You're really not sure what she means by all those conditions, but you're okay with them. You're pretty sure that they're going to have to tell you what to tell them to do, but you're okay with that as well.

"But that only happens if you're the last one with clothes on," Cassie concludes. "Anybody have a problem with my idea?"

Everyone shakes their head, and now you're really excited, and very determined to play the best poker you've ever played in your life.

"Okay," Cassie says,
1211413122241.title: Both Queens

You get your three new cards: the Ace of Spades, the Seven of Clubs, and the Seven of Hearts.

Two pairs!

And better news, Tifa loses again!

"I think,"she says with an embarrassed giggle, as she removes her suspenders, then ensures her belt it tight enough, "That we are about to get into interesting territory."

Very interesting territory indeed, you think to yourself, trying not to stare too hard. After all, you've got to focus. With the new "Sex Slave" clause, you have got to win this game. You have got to!

With a sense of determination, you take the five cards for you new hand.

"One more idea," Chloe repeats, laughing. "And thus are great disasters born, with such meager words."

"We do have a hand to finish," Nadine said pointedly. You notice, though, Nadine is relaxed in her tone. Whatever bad blood was between her and Cassie at the beginning has disappeared.

"Let's just call this a null hand," Cassie said. "I've got a couple of interesting side games we can play while we wait."

"While we wait for what?" Tifa asks.

"Well, we're serving the kid up an ethnically diverse buffet," Cassie observes, which gets a big laugh out of Nadine, "I think we should bring a Latina player into the mix."

"Can you find someone?" Tifa asked.

Cassie nodded. "If no ones has any objections, I already have someone in mind."

Everyone shakes their head, including you. You have to admit you're kind of curious who Cassie has in mind.

Cassie went to one wall with a phone hanging on it and, after pushing a few buttons, got who she was referring to. After a few hushed words, Cassie hangs up the phone and grins. "She's on her way. She should be here in about..."

"Yeah, that caught me off guard too," Cassie responds. "It seems she was at the bar, just down the hall. So we won't have to wait at all. Too bad," she says with a wink to you. "I had some interesting side games planned while we waited."

Now you're very curious about those side games Cassie had planned. Maybe you'll get a chance to learn about them later on in the game.

Your thoughts are interrupted by a knock on the door. When Cassie tells the knocker to come in, Christie Monteiro (https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/ori...) enters the room. She looks hot, but you're a little disappointed she's not wearing one of her fighting costumes.

Cassie introduces her to everyone in the room, and Christie greets everyone enthusiastically. She even gives you a little hug.

1212.content:
"So, can I turn in all my cards?" you ask.

"Nope," Sam says. "One, two or three cards. Four cards if you have an Ace. But that's it."

"Excuse me, but are you playing?" Lilith asks.

"No, but---" Sam replies, but Lilith cuts her off.

"Then you don't get a say," Lilith says, maybe a little too nastily, at least in your opinion.

Lara looks like she wants to intervene, but doesn't know how. Once again, it's up to Elizabeth to play diplomat. Which kind of surprises you. I mean, yes, she can put her emotions aside when she wants to, and she's got that reserved, pseudo English woman thing going, but on the other hand, you've seen her tell someone what a dumbass they were...in that witty reserved pseudo English woman way.

"Perhaps it would be best if we see if there is a consensus among the players to allow this," Elizabeth began. "We are, after all, not playing a conventional game. Here, the objective is not to have the highest hand, but to avoid the lowest. Given that, I would say that a few deviations from the regular rules should be allowed."

"Yeah, I'm all for that," Lilith chimes in. "How about you, Zoey?"

"I'm good with that. Lara?" All the women are looking at Lara, who must be torn right now, you think.

Finally, Lara says, "Yeah, okay," This gets a look of betrayal from Sam, and a snicker from Lilith.

You were tempted to take back your request when the argument began, but when Lilith made such a strong stand, you didn't really want to get involved in the argument that looked like was going to get explosive. You turn in all five of your cards and get:

The Ace of Diamonds, the King of Clubs, the Ten of Spades, the Six of Hearts and the Three of Hearts.

Crap!

When everyone shows their hand, you end up having the worst. With a sigh, you take off your baseball cap.

"Awww, don't sweat it kid," Lilith laughs, as she leans over to tousle your hair. "You got good looking hair anyway." You blush and duck your head, which makes Lilith laugh even harder. You're just happy to get a new hand dealt to you.

----------

12123.content:
You're sitting there, wondering which cards to discard, when there's a knock on the door. One of the nondescript male characters, like the one who checked you out when you entered the Inventory, enters the room when Elizabeth tells him to.

"Miss Elizabeth?" the man says diffidently. "I know tonight is your night off. But we have a situation."

"Isn't...?" she responds.

"Not available at the moment," the man responds.

"What about...?" Elizabeth asks.

"On a mission," the man answers.

"Well, give me a moment to get my boots on. I'm assuming the situation isn't imminent, urgent, or critical," she asked, pulling on her left boot.

"No, just developing," the man answered.

"Ah," Elizabeth answered, tugging on her other boot. "I don't suppose...?"

"Indisposed," the man answered.

"Well, I must make my apologies to my companions," Elizabeth says. "Wait outside, will you? This will only take a few minutes And you will be able to secure a replacement for me?"

"Miss Elizabeth, we really should get going..." the man began to argue, but Elizabeth cut him off

"You said the situation was developing, nothing worse. So you can spare a few minutes. And you will be able to secure a replacement for me, within the hour." The last is more like a command than a question, and the man takes it that way. It makes you wonder about the power structure at the Inventory and how everything is connected.

As soon as the guy leaves, Elizabeth turns around to face you all. "My sincerest apologies. I've been looking forward to this evening. I was especially looking forward to it when I saw you," Elizabeth tells you with a grin. "My only companion when I was your age was a flying, artificial construct. So I never got to play doctor or such when I was entering adolescence. I was looking forward to perhaps doing so with you. Maybe we'll get to do so sometime in the future." You blush, but your heart starts racing at the idea of not only getting to playing doctor with Elizabeth, but also about getting to come back to the inventory.

Lara, Lilith and Zoey reassure Elizabeth that they understand perfectly and, if she ever has the opportunity, they'd be more than happy to have a game with her.

At that moment, Sam decided to insert her drunken opinion.

"You're just too scared of Lara kicking your ass," Sam slurs.

The room goes deathly quiet at that moment. Some line has been crossed and, even if you don't know what it is, everyone else in the room does. Even Sam realizes she's fucked up. She starts to blubber an apology, but Lara cuts her off.

"I apologize for my friend, Elizabeth," Lara begins. "Next time I'll leave her at the manor. And the time after that. And the time after that."

Sam is really blubbering now. Lilith can see you're confused, and begins whispering in your ear.

"Places like this, the Inventory," she begins, "And other places, can only exist because of people like Elizabeth and their abilities. Elizabeth is actually pretty nice about it, and doesn't expect anybody to kiss her ass, though I wouldn't say no if she asked me to," Lilith said with a wink. "But you try not to be an asshole to people like her either."

You turn your attention to the blubbering Sam, who is literally at Elizabeth's feet, begging forgiveness. You realize that Elizabeth literally has the power to keep Sam from ever leaving her own world again,

"Really, it's not worth all this hullabaloo," Elizabeth, clearly embarrassed, told Sam. "But if you really want to make amends, I have an idea."

"Anything," Sam says, nodding emphatically.

"One, when the game starts with the new player, our young man gets to start with his cap. If that's all right with the rest of you," Elizabeth asks, turning to the rest of the women. They all nod in agreement, and you're glad that you're getting a do over.

"Second, you'll keep your side bet. When Lara loses a piece of clothing, you lose a piece of clothing," Elizabeth says.

Again, Sam nods, though perhaps not so emphatically. Realizing that she had come pretty close to losing her multiverse travel pass has sobered her up. But Sam must realize she has no room to back out now.

"And here's the final condition. Whenever you and Lara have to take off an article of clothing, the kid gets to take it off of you, and then have a little playtime with you. Not only that, if Lara has to perform a forfeit, you do to. But the kid gets to determine the forfeit. And no rough stuff," Elizabeth tells you, shaking a finger at you. You nod, your mind reeling at what Elizabeth is setting up for you.

Sam has turned white as a sheet. She starts with a "But---", but Elizabeth cuts her off.

"As I said, Sam, none of this is necessary," Elizabeth said. "But you're the one who wanted to make amends. Do you still want to make amends?" Sam nodded emphatically. "Good then," Elizabeth continued. "Well, get yourself cleaned up."

As Sam did so, Elizabeth went around and gave all the women a hug goodbye. When she got to you, you're surprised that you can look her in the eye. Yes, you grew about six inches last summer, but this is Elizabeth from Bioshock. And not only that, but apparently among other video game characters, she's a force to be reckoned with. For some reason, you feel she should be towering over you.

Elizabeth smiles and takes your hands in hers. And then she puts them on her breasts.

You almost faint from shock.

Elizabeth begins manipulating your hands so that you're softly kneading her breasts. Eventually, you take control of your own hands and continue massaging her breasts. They're the softest things you've ever handled.

"Very nice," Elizabeth tells you. "Just remember, as a rule, the more violent an adventuress's life is, the more she appreciates a gentle hand. Are mine the first ones you've ever touched?" she asks.

You nod, your eyes watching your hands, as if they're someone else's. Finally Elizabeth removes your hands from her chest.

"As pleasant as that was, I do have a situation to tend to. Have fun, and we'll do this again," Elizabeth says as she left the room. The other women are just staring at you. Lilith suddenly laughs, then puts your cap back on your head for you. "Welcome back to the game, kid."

You, Lilith and Zoey are having a conversation about different aspects of their game world, and occasionally Lara participates. Sam just sits sullenly by herself, occasionally giving you a "fuck off and die" glare. Lilith tells you not to worry about it. Any problems Sam has, she brought on herself.

Lilith also tells you an interesting story about how Sirens get their tattoos. You're about to ask something about the other Sirens when there's a knock on the door, and Elizabeth's replacement comes in.

It/s Helena Douglas ( https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/dead...), and you find your eyes following the movement of her legs in the long slit of her dress.

Helena heads straight to Lilith The two of them obviously know each other well, which makes you wonder how this whole crossing into different game worlds works. Lilith introduces her to Zoey first, and then to Lara. There seems to be a little reluctance on Lilith's part to introduce her to Sam, but Sam seems to have sobered up, and Helena is being gracious to her, so it all seems to be going well. Lilith explains that Sam is there as a guest of Lara's but there's a little side bet going on. When Helena asks about the nature of the side bed, Lilith just winks at her and says, "You'll see."

Finally Lilith introduces Helena to you. Helena oohs and aahs over you, and says you are just the cutest thing, making Lilith and Zoey laugh, and you blush. Finally everyone takes a seat, Lilith reviews the rules, and the cards are dealt out.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

122.content:
Ah, that's right. The Fighter Table. Without further adieu you step out of the car and towards the nondescript building in which The Inventory is housed. A bouncer, who may or may not have been Dudley from Street Fighter, opens the door for you as you show him your invitation. You step inside and inhale the musty smells of smoke and alcohol. You make your way through the semi-crowded room, noticing a few familiar faces as you head towards the back. You're pretty sure you saw Solid Snake sharing a a beer with Gordon Freeman, but you didn't get a good enough look. No one seems to pay much attention to you as you cross the room. Finally, you reach the entrance to the VIP area. You show your invitation to the bouncer up front (some Half Life Civil Protection goon by the look of him), and he lets you in.

         You step inside the room and you see your four fellow players already at the table: Kasumi (http://i.imgur.com/eRU0hj2.jpg), Cassandra (http://i.imgur.com/1TAVwEY.jpg), Chun Li (http://i.imgur.com/TcE56U4.jpg) and Morrigan (http://i.imgur.com/HIPFdSh.jpg).

         "Well, well, well...look who just walked in." Morrigan says with a sultry grin.

         "Finally! We were about to start without you." Cassandra says. "Oh...uh...are you lost, little guy? I don't think you're supposed to be in this room."

         "Unless you think this strapping young lad beat up our security, I'd guess he has an invitation. Don't you hon?" Morrigan says with a wink. You feel your face grow hot. "He he. They're always so cute when they're young. Maybe if you're lucky, little boy, I'll let you join my collection." Her grin turns predatory as bats suddenly flutter around her. "I'll have you know they rather enjoy their lives," she adds as she gestures to them. "They live in a constant state of ecstasy, forever satisfying me and being satisfied by me. The perks of being a succubus."

         "Umm...I don't..." you begin, flustered. Despite this, in your youthful inexperience you can't help staring at her chest. Morrigan giggles and thrusts her breasts forward.

         "I'd take good care of you."

         "She's just being dramatic," Chun Li cuts in, rolling her eyes. "The one thing she actually craves most in the world is attention."

         "Don't sound so dismissive," Morrigan purrs. "I haven't given up on your either, Legs."

         "If we may continue then," Kasumi interjects. "We're all here, so let's go over the rules. We're playing basic five card draw so this doesn't take all night. At the beginning of each hand we all get five cards. After we have those, each of us can turn in any of those, up to all five, for replacements. Once we've done that, everyone puts down their hands and the loser has to take something off. Once a person is rendered naked all of us here at the table get to decide what that person has to do as punishment. The last person left with anything on is the winner."

         "I can hardly wait. Winning or losing doesn't matter. I win regardless," Morrigan says.

         "Well if you are offering to take it all off now and make things a little easier on us, be my guest," Cassandra says.

         "Oh no, I couldn't do that. It's the risk and anticipation that's most of the fun. Besides, I wouldn't deprive myself of the chance to best all of you and claim you as my own."

         "I...don't think that's in the rules..." Kasumi says with a blush.

         "We'll see..." Morrigan responds.

12222.content:
You're about to tell the women that you're going to stand pat on your cards when you're interrupted by a knock on the door. Morrigan, who's been fun and flirty and seductive up to this point, suddenly becomes very serious.

"It had better be important," she shouts at the door. "I'm enjoying my free time."

In through the door comes one of those nondescript male gaming characters, like the one who checked your invitation. He bows apologetically and heads to Morrigan, talking to her in a low tone you can't overhear. Her frown deepens until she waves her hand and shouts, "Enough!"

She stands, and the whimsical succubus who was ready to strip and own all of you earlier is gone. "My apologies," she begins, "But unfortunately, the Inventory has business that requires my personal attention. Even though someone else was supposed to be on duty tonight." The last is said directly at the messenger, who cowers in fear at her reaction.

"Do you need any help?" Cassandra asks, all previous rivalry gone.

"I should be able to handle this on my own," Morrigan assures her. "No need to ruin anyone else's weekend. I'm sure they'll find a replacement for my spot shortly. Please, enjoy the game, and try to think of deliciously naughty things to do when you reach the forfeits."

"Actually, Miss Morrigan, you might want to take two companions with you," the messenger said. He then ducked when Morrigan gave him a baleful stare.

"Fine," she huffs. "Chun Li, Cassandra, I hate to impose on you, but..."

"Don't give it a second thought," Cassandra replied, and Chun Li nodded.

"Kasumi, you know the rules," Morrigan tells the woman who will be staying behind. "Keep the new players in line when they get here."

"Of course," Kasumi replies. "And thank you."

Morrigan shrugs, then moves to you. "I was so looking forward to putting my 'Property Of' on you." She then gives you a hug, and presses those nearly bare breasts of hers into your body. Then, without warning, she reaches down and grabs your crotch.

"My, my," Morrigan says, as she steps away, laughing. "You may be a thirteen year old boy, but that is a defiitely a man-sized package you are carrying. Now I'm really pissed that I have to go. But go I must."

And with that, Morrigan, Cassandra and Chun Li make their exit.

Your penis still feels the warm imprint of the only other hand to handle it besides your own, even if it was through two layers of clothing.

Feeling both excited and scared by being left alone with just Kasumi, you try to make conversation with her.

"So, why did Morrigan have to leave?" you ask.

"It's a bit complicated," she tells you. "But places like the Inventory can only be created and maintained by people like Morrigan. I don't quite understand the physics and stuff, but she's necessary. She's especially necessary when it comes to dealing with the occasoinal --- interference that shows up from time to time. Otherwise, none of us could cross into each other's worlds, or into yours. It's something that we don't discuss with outsiders." she adds.

You nod, wishing you could learn more, but realizing that Kasumi has said everything she wants to say on the matter.

You talk to each other for another five more minutes, trying not to feel too uncomfortable, when there's another knock on the door. It's one of those nondescript characters, who's there to tell you that...

122222.content:
Almost as soon as the messenger leaves, the replacements arrive.

The first person to arrive is Selvaria Bles (http://img4.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20130...), looking both regal and beautiful. But her appearance blows your mind. You don't have a detailed knowledge of her world, but you're pretty sure she sacrificed her life at the orders of the man she loved (but did not love her in return). Does death work differently in her world?

Actually, you've been thinking about how you can interact at all with video game characters, or how they can interact with each other. Kusami told you Morrigan and "others like her," are very important to this whole thing, which is how places like the Inventory are possible in the first place. But Kusami also said they don't talk about it with outsiders, which is presumably non video game characters like you. So how does that work?

You put that and a thousand other questions that are bubbling over in your mind to the back of your head as Selvaria heads straight to Kasumi. The two women exchange a hug and a few words before Selvaria comes over to meet you. One of the things that has surprised you tonight is the fact that you can actually talk to a lot of the women you have met eye to eye. Granted, you did have a big growth spurt this summer, several inches in fact, and you are one of the tallest kids in eighth grade, but still, these women are legends. You feel that they should be towering over you.

Selvaria is actually quite pleasant when she talks with you, and even takes off your baseball cap to tousle your hair. You're not quite sure why some women seem compelled to do that to you, but you don't mind someone as hot as Selvaria doing it.

The next person to walk in is Taki (https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/soul...) who immediately grabs Kusami and Selvaria in a hug and...giggles! Seriously, she acts like, well, like one of the girls at your school when meeting friends they haven't seen all summer. And certainly not behavior you'd expect from one of the badassest fighters in video gaming.

But of course, none of these three women are the kind you would ever expect to find at a strip poker game. Especially Selvaria.

A whole lot of questions in your head. A whole lot of questions.

The last player to arrive is Tala (https://static.tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pub/i...). You immediately become rigid, and not just because her jacket is wide open and revealing quite a bit of delicious flesh. It's because Tala is an unapologetic villainess. Selvaria did what she did because she was serving someone who had rescued her and whom she loved, even if he was an assole to her at the end. Tala, on the other hand, wanted to bring her world crashing down around her just to watch it burn. It was like that old Western movie, where one of the villains wants revenge on the world for having been born.

Tala, though, breezes in and heads directly toward Selvaria, and the two exchange an intense hug and a tearful hello.

Now you're really confused.

Kasumi slides up to you and whispers, "They think of themselves as kindred spirits. Their...well, they didn't die, but their transformations, released them from a lot of burdens they had to bear. Tala is no longer a vampire, for instance."

You nod, pretending to understand, even though you don't. An odd question pops up in your head and you ask, "Hey, do the characters who started off a comic book characters ever come to these? You know, the Avengers or the Justice Leaguers or..."

Kasumi stiffens up as soon as the word Comic Book comes out of your mouth, and cuts you off before you can add any other superhero groups to your litany.

"We don't ever speak of them," she says stiffly. "Ever."

"Sorry," you quickly apologize. She relaxes and gives you a quick hug around the shoulders. "It's okay. You didn't know any better. But it's best never to bring the subject up again. Not everyone is as tolerant as I am on the subject."

You decide then and there just to focus on the game, and let the women voluntarily share information about their world with you.

Tala comes over to you and introduces herself, and she's actually nice. She smiles a lot, tells you how cute you are (which makes you blush), and then asks Kasumi to review the rules with them. Kasumi does, and everyone takes a seat around the table.

"I think," Taki suggests to Kasumi, "We should be ponytail free like Tala and Selvaria." Kasumi nods, and the two free their hair, shaking it loose. This produces giggles from Selvaria and Tala, which astounds you, and then all the women are giggling.

Everyone at the table seems to be in good spirits, and there doesn't seem to be the underlying tension that there was in the room before. You feel both relaxed and excited as five cards are dealt out to each player.

1222221.content:
As you keep your tens and toss in three cards, little do you realize you're about to have the weirdest hand in your life. And you've seen some pretty weird hands when you've played online poker.

For one thing, all four women's eyes light up as they get their cards. Well, not Tala's so much, but she's from an OId West World, so you figure she's played more than her fair share of poker and knows how to keep a poker face.

All of the women but Tala ask for one card each, which makes you think that they've got two pairs, or they're working on straights or flushes. And all of them immediately look crestfallen when they receive their card.

If you were playing regular poker with them, you'd be cleaning them out. On the other hand, if you were playing regular poker, you wouldn't have the possibility of getting to see some or all of them naked either.

Tala actually pauses before deciding how many cards to take. She must be like you, having to adjust from thinking about trying to get the best hand, to just avoiding the worst one. Finally, she signals she'll take one card. And you can tell that, as soon as she gets her new card, she regrets her decision.

You feel a little better when you ask for your three cards, especially when you get the other two tens.

But then the weird part starts, when everybody reveals their hands.

The women all reveal that they're holding the Ace, King, Queen, Jack of one suit, and the two of another suit. You realize every woman at this table was trying to draw to a royal flush. You remember reading the odds of getting a Royal Flush in Five Card Draw were like one in half a million or something. The odds are different in Hold'em or Stud or the like, but you know they are pretty high. But what are the odds of having four hands that were good enough that you would try to draw the remaining card, rather than try for something else?

Tala must have realized the odds, and the fact that she wasn't trying to get the winning hand, but just avoiding the lowest hand. That was why she had hesitated before just asking for one card. But who could resist trying to get a royal flush?

But now they all had four Ace High nothings hands that were identical.

You knew that if there is an exact tie, certain suits outrank other suits, but you can't remember which ones. If you were online, you could just check the rules. Or the computer would automatically decide. But you don't have that option either rightnw.

Tala shrugs when she's asked who's the lowest hand. "To be honest," she said, "This would be the point where a fight broke out."

Everyone laughs and then Taki suggests, "What if all the women take off one article of clothing? If our male participant does not mind, that is?"

Selvaria observes, "I'm sure he won't have any objections whatsoever." This got a laugh from all the women as each one removed an article of clothing. As the next round of cards is dealt out, you can't help but reflect what a weird hand that was, but you hope they all are that good kind of weird. With that happy thought, you take your next five cards.

You toss in everything but the Ace and King, and for your troubles, you get the eight of clubs, the four of diamonds and three of clubs. Crap!

Fortunately for you, Tala only gets a Queen High nothing.

It's kind of funny, you think, that the only two people who play poker at the table on a regular basis got the two worst hands this time around. But since you beat out Tala, you're not complaining.

Tala reaches to her throat, takes off her choker, and tosses it to you. "I don't have to wear that anymore, anyway, unless I'm making a First Appearance. The next time we meet, you may not ever recognize me, kid. So keep that as a memento of our first meeting."

Two things you pick up on immediately are Tala's emphasis on the words 'First Appearance' and the fact that she thinks you two will meet again after this game. You wonder what a First Appearance is. You assume it means the first time she appears to a non video game character like you, but you're a little scared to ask for clarification. You guess it must be one of those laws governing interactions between humans and video game characters.

More importantly, though, Tala thinks you'll be back, and none of the other women say anything to the contrary. That makes you very happy indeed.

Tala then bends over to undo and remove her boots, then stops. She looks at you, and a playful smile comes to her lips. "I could remove the jacket instead, and let you play with them, if you'll lose the cap."

There's no ambiguity at all about what the 'them' is. Her incredibly large breasts are mostly exposed by her jacket being as open as it is, anyway, and to see them completely exposed, and getting to touch them, would be worth any price

A bouncer, who may or may not have been Dudley from Street Fighter, opens the door for you as you show him your invitation. You step inside and inhale the musty smells of smoke and alcohol. You make your way through the semi-crowded room, noticing a few familiar faces as you head towards the back. You're pretty sure you saw Solid Snake sharing a a beer with Gordon Freeman, but you didn't get a good enough look. No one seems to pay much attention to you as you cross the room. Finally, you reach the entrance to the VIP area. You show your invitation to the bouncer up front (some Half Life Civil Protection goon by the look of him), and he lets you in.

         You step inside the room and you see your four fellow players already at the table: Liara (http://i.imgur.com/7UFd8A2.jpg), Jeanette (http://i.imgur.com/WzyYeDz.jpg), Sis (http://i.imgur.com/nGTuVFM.jpg) and Triss (http://i.imgur.com/USt1eUm.jpg).

         "Ah, it would seem that we are all here now," Liara says as she spots you enter.

         "Yes it would," Jeanette agrees with a seductive smile. "And here I thought the spread was already so excellent. You seem so...ordinary compared to the others here, little boy. Don't worry, I mean that as a compliment. It makes you...unique. Not to mention you're a man...well, at least in terms of your body, so you'll at least offer some variety to the collection of skin. Assuming you don't win, that is, which I might add is something I hope doesn't happen. I bet you'd look absolutely adorable taking it all off."

         "I'm not that young..." You say, more sulky than you meant to.

         "Relatively speaking, I suppose. Immortality tends to frame mortal lifespans in a different light," she answers.

         "Well, I'm 108," Liara says.

         "Oh? Well, you're not exactly human are you, blue girl? Then again, neither am I," Jeanette comments.

         "I'm also over 100. I don't like giving exacts. It tends to depress me," Triss says slyly. "One of the perks of magic," she adds.

         "Well, I guess we're all a little older than we look here," Jeanette says. "What about you, quiet one? Are you hiding secret powers as well?" Jeanette looks at Sis. Sis rolls her eyes and sighs, pauses for a few seconds and holds up all ten of her fingers twice. "Is that supposed to mean 20? Is there any reason you couldn't just tell us?"

         Sis gives Jeanette a withering sardonic look, grabs a pen and writes on a pad of paper next to her. She holds up the pad and the message reads: "I'm mute."

         "Ooooooh," Jeanette says.

         Sis turns to the next page on the pad which reads: "Dumb bitch."

         "Well now, she's feisty. I like her. This is going to be fun," Jeanette says.

         "If we may continue then," Liara interjects. "We're all here, so let's go over the rules. We're playing basic five card draw for the sake of brevity, so no betting. At the beginning of each hand we all get five cards. After we have those, each of us can turn in any of those, up to all five, for replacements. Once we've done that, everyone puts down their hands and the loser has to take something off. Once a person is rendered naked all of us here at the table get to decide what that person has to do as punishment. The last person left with anything on is the winner."

         "Well, I'm certainly not shy, but I've seen me naked before. All of you on the other hand..." Jeanette says.

         "Aren't you laying on the seductive vampire thing a little thick?" Triss asks.

         "Well, Daddy always said to do what you love. I wonder if I'll grow to love any of you?" Jeanette giggles and you can see her fangs.

         "I guess I shouldn't have asked..." Triss says dully.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------

You Have: 6(H), 6(C), 10(S), 8(D), 2(S)

Liara: White jacket, upper armor, lower armor, black unitard, black tanktop, black bra, black panties.
Jeanette: Choker, boots, blouse, skirt, fishnets and garter, red bra, red thong.
Sis: Coat, sneakers, socks, jeans, shirt, bra, panties.
Triss: Belt, boots, socks, top, pants, bra, panties.

124.content:
Ah, that's right. JRPG Table. Without further adieu you step out of the car and towards the nondescript building in which The Inventory is housed. A bouncer, who may or may not have been Dudley from Street Fighter, opens the door for you as you show him your invitation. You step inside and inhale the musty smells of smoke and alcohol. You make your way through the semi-crowded room, noticing a few familiar faces as you head towards the back. You're pretty sure you saw Solid Snake sharing a a beer with Gordon Freeman, but you didn't get a good enough look. No one seems to pay much attention to you as you cross the room. Finally, you reach the entrance to the VIP area. You show your invitation to the bouncer up front (some Half Life Civil Protection goon by the look of him), and he lets you in.

         You step inside the room and you see your four fellow players already at the table: Elizabeth (http://i.imgur.com/7LrQ9kQ.png), Jessica (http://i.imgur.com/fy2cyrb.jpg), Tifa (http://i.imgur.com/InOydrF.png) and Aika (http://i.imgur.com/u0uu8YS.jpg).

         "Oh! It seems our last guest has arrived!" Elizabeth pipes up as you enter. "It's very nice to meet you! My name is Elizabeth."

         "I have a feeling he knows that..." Jessica says.

         "Oh, I'm sorry. I'm just rather excited to be here. I have a strong suspicion that this is going to be a very memorable experience. After all, there are so many unique faces here. I look forward to seeing all of your true selves laid bare," Elizabeth says.

         "I guess that's one way of putting it," Tifa reasons.

         "I suspect you might be the most unique of all of us, though, little boy. You are the only male here, of course, and also rather younger than the rest of us. I wonder how that will affect the dynamics," Elizabeth says, her bright yellow eyes on you.

         "Well..." you begin. "I guess it might mean you all want me to lose."

         "I've never liked people who pick on kids," Jessica says. "Besides, it's mostly luck."

         "And I'm very lucky!" Aika pips up.

         "Now, just so I'm clear, we are playing strip poker, yes? The daring game in which one wagers their modesty instead of monetary wealth? I have very much wanted to try it. I have no shortage of funds, but the thrill of losing here is much more substantial. I can see why you humans would find it exhilarating," Elizabeth says.

         "Wait...we're not...playing for treasure?" Aika says.

         "How could you not know that?" Jessica says.

         "I just thought it was regular poker. Are you saying I don't stand to win any treasure here?" Aika asks, her voice nearly whiny.

         "We signed papers...how could you have not known?" Tifa says.

         "I guess I didn't look close enough..." Aika says in a small voice.

         "Well, do not feel too alarmed. You said yourself that you are very lucky, correct? If this is true, you have nothing to worry about. Besides, not all treasures are measured in physical wealth. Many come from far less tangible places, like the bonds you create with others. I wonder if will be creating special bonds with any of you..." Elizabeth says, her usual mystical airy tone now colored with the slightest suggestive undertone.

         "Man, where did they find this girl?" Jessica asks.

         "If you would all be so kind as to listen to the rules then," Elizabeth interjects. "We're playing basic five card draw for the sake of brevity, so that means no betting of any kind. At the beginning of each hand we all receive five cards. After we have those, each of us can turn in any of those, up to all five, for replacements. Once we've done that, everyone puts down their hands and the loser has to remove an article of clothing. Once a person is rendered naked all of us here at the table get to decide what that person has to do as punishment. The last person left with anything on is the winner. Is that clear to everyone?"

         Everyone at the table nods in affirmation and the cards are dealt out.

124.title: JRPG Table

1241.content:
You are about to to ask for two new cards when the door you walked in explodes, sending splinters everywhere. You duck under the table while the other players rush out the room, presumably to confront whatever is causing the explosions outside.

For what seems like forever, you hear explosions and crashes happening in the distance. The cower down lower when they seem to get closer, but they never seem to get to close.

Then suddenly silence.

A few minutes after the silence, a voice shouts in the room, "Anyone in here?"

You stand up timidly and meekly answer, "M---me."

The owner of the voice is a nondescript henchman from a game you don't recognize. He looks you up and down and says, "Sorry, kid, but..."
1241.title: Keep the spades.

12411.content:
"A new table?" you ask.

The nondescript character nods as he leads you out of the devastated room you were hiding in.

"You see, kid, the Inventory was set up as a place where video characters could interface, not only with each other, but with your world as well. On a very limited basis, of course, but still. But there's always been a sort of, well, bad feeling between what you could call classic characters from video games, and characters who originated in other mediums and then became video game characters. And when the Inventory was made, the other kind of characters weren't invited."

"Well, they took offense to that, and decided tonight they were going to change that," the character said as he led you to a new undamaged door. "Well, there was a big battle, and finally they called a truce. The new class of video game characters are going to get to stay, but on a condition. Their female characters are going to have to sit in on the games like yours. Now, some of them aren't too thrilled about the whole stripping of their clothes and doing forfeit things, but what are they going to do? You know? So their cohorts told them they're going to have to play."

"So you're telling me that some of the women at the table I'm going to may not want to play strip poker," you begin, "But they're having to anyway, as a condition of this truce?"

"That's right," he answers, and then opens the door. "So enjoy."

You look inside the room, and waiting for you at the table are four female characters from the Video Game
12411.title: you're going to have to play a new table

12412.content: The character escorts you out a door and you find yourself in an empty parking lot, with no sign of the Inventory. You search all your life, but you never find the Inventory again.
12412.title: you're going to have to go home

You're about to ask for three cards when the door bangs open and a rather large, furry male from a game you almost, but can't quite recognize, enters the room.

"I believe," he says, each word distinct and deliberate, "That you're sitting in my seat."

"Well, this is more like it," Amy says happily.

"I was, that is...I was just leaving." The male furry merely grunts as you get out of your chair and scurry toward the door.

As soon as you step out of the door, you find yourself in an empty parking lot.

For years, you spend all your free time and money searching for the Inventory, but never find it again.

choices: a large room full of new furry characters
125122.content:
Everything happens so fast, you don't have time to move. You just sit there, wondering what's going to happen next.

A few minutes later, the nondescript background character returns to the room to find you're still there.

"Hey, pal, this is the furry room, right? You still up for a game?" he asks.

"Yeah, sure," you reply, feeling a little unsure.

"Follow me," he tells you. As you get up and follow him, you find the hall you came in has disappeared, and has been replaced by a earthen tunnel lit by eerie bioluminescent mold.

"Hey, what was that raid all about?" you ask the guy.

"What raid?" the guy asks. "Hey, what's that hole behind you?"

"What hole?" you ask, turning around. Sure enough, a hole has appeared in the side of the tunnel. Before you can turn around and ask where the hole has come from, you feel a boot on your backside and find yourself falling through the air.

You fall down the hole for what seems forever and find yourself in
125122.title: Keep your seat

Your fall comes to a sudden stop, as you find your landing cushioned by a nice, soft, deep carpet. You find yourself in a room with a large table in the center, a bar and buffet table nearby, doors leading to other rooms, and looking up at four new furries, sitting at a round table, with an empty seat. All the furries are looking down at you expectantly.

You immediately recognize all the players.

There's Felicia from Dalkstalker (https://badspot.us/img/felicia.jpg),

Makoto Nanaya from BlazBlue (https://cdna.artstation.com/p/assets/ima...),

Fran from Final Fantasy (https://static1.thegamerimages.com/wordp...)

And Vika from Fire Emblem (https://www.fireemblemwod.com/gallery/al...}

The girls stare at you and you stare at them for what seems the longest amount of time before Fran points at the empty chair and says, "We'll introduce ourselves when the game starts. For now, pick up your cards and start playing."

Not sure what's happening, you scramble to your feet and take the empty seat, seeing five cards, face down, already dealt out.

12512211.content:
You hang on to your Aces and ask for three cards.

"Sorry if I was so abrupt kid," Fran says, as she takes two cards, "But it's been a crazy week here. Someone let loose a virus that's been disrupting everything. Not everyone is a fan of people mixing from different games, or letting non-gamers interact with us. What's your name, anyway?"

Before you can answer, or even take your new cards, one of the doors to the room opens and non-descript male character sticks his head in and yells, "Raid!"

Not again you think to yourself as the other players dive for cover. You're planning to just hold your ground when the door opens again. This time, a glowing sphere spewing rainbow colors flies through the air and lands in the middle of the table.

You...
12512211.title: both Aces

125122111.content:
The next thing you know, you find yourself in an open parking lot, with the Inventory nowhere in sight.

You spend the rest of your life looking for the inventory, but to no avail.
125122111.title: run for one of the doors

choices: We thought we would play a little game, Fran answers
You'll find out, Fran says mysteriously
125122112.content:
For reasons you'll never understand, you leap on top of the glowing ball, not sure what's going to happen next, but fairly sure that it's not going to be good. Suddenly, you find yourself surrounded by a rainbow of colors that grow brighter and brighter until you pass out.

When you wake up, you find yourself looking up at a circle of four beautiful faces looking down at you. And all four faces look relieved to see you waking up.

"I can't believe you did that,"Felicia says, as all four help you up off the floor and seat you back into your chair. "But I'm glad you did." Without warning, Felicia clutches your head to her breasts. You're finding it difficult to think with all that soft, smooth flesh smothering you, though you're definitely not telling her to stop.

When Felicia finally breaks her embrace, she cradles your face in her hands and smiles.

"We're all impressed with what you did, kid," Fran adds, a look of amusement on her face at Felicia's fawning over you.

"What...what did I do?" you ask, bemused by the women's reaction, but very happy about it too.

"You took out the virus that was threatening our ability to get together outside our individual worlds," Vika said, her wings stretching outward as she spoke.

"And you also prevented any kind of virus being able to affect us now and in the future," Makota chittered happily. "And now you can come back anytime you want, stay as long as you want, because the virus merged with you and you made the permanent evolving anti-virus, which was really impressive because -"

"Because," Fran said, interrupting the hyperactive Makota, "It just took a lot of courage to do what you did. So you deserve a reward."

"What kind of reward?" you blurt out, which gets a giggle from the girls.
125122112.title: leap on top of the glowing ball

1251221121.content:
"A little game?" you ask, both excited and nervous.

"Mmmmm hmmmm," Fran says with a grin. "Here's how it's going to work. Before we start the regular game back up, you're going to play a one-on-hand with each one of us. if you lose, you take of one piece of clothing. If one of us loses, we have to take off a piece of clothing."

"And you get to choose the piece of clothing we remove," Makota chimed in as she gave you a saucy wink.

"And get to play with anything that get's exposed. Doesn't that sound like fun?" Felicia said excitedly.

It certainly sounded exciting to you. You wanted to say something, but found you couldn't get your mouth to working. Instead, you just nodded, hoping you didn't look too goofy. The girls just laughed, but it was a good-natured laugh.

"I'll go first," Vika said, blushing a little at her boldness. You nod, then force yourself to concentrate.

1252.content:
Ah, that's right. The Junior League. Without further adieu you step out of the car and towards the nondescript building in which The Inventory is housed. A bouncer, who may or may not have been Dudley from Street Fighter, opens the door for you as you show him your invitation. You step inside and inhale the musty smells of smoke and alcohol. You make your way through the semi-crowded room, noticing a few familiar faces as you head towards the back. You're pretty sure you saw Solid Snake sharing a a beer with Gordon Freeman, but you didn't get a good enough look. No one seems to pay much attention to you as you cross the room. Finally, you reach the entrance to the VIP area. You show your invitation to the bouncer up front (some Half Life Civil Protection goon by the look of him), and he lets you in.

         You step inside the room and you see your four fellow players already at the table: Ellie (http://i.imgur.com/Z62s3Vm.jpg), Clementine (http://i.imgur.com/Yiarblj.png), Sunny (http://i.imgur.com/6TZLWBX.jpg) and Serena (http://i.imgur.com/gPLQxtw.png).

         "Oh, hey, it looks like the last player is here. 'Sup, dude?" Ellie says, looking at you as you enter.

         "Oh...it's a boy!" Sunny says, her voice going higher pitched on the last word. Her cheeks go red and she seems a bit flustered.

         "Uh oh, I think someone's getting excited over there," Ellie says, amused.

         "N-no I'm not!" Sunny says, still blushing. "I'm just happy everyone is here now. That's all."

         "Uh huh," Ellie says skeptically.

         "At least he's our age," Clementine offers. "I was worried they were going to send someone older."

         "You would not want to see an older man naked? Where is your sense of adventure?" Serena asks. You notice her accent sounds French. Well, Pokemon French. Kalos, you think.

         "I think you have too much of a sense of adventure," Clem fires back.

         "Well, at least he's cute," Serena says, winking at you. You feel your face flush.

         "Uh oh, you've got competition, Sunny," Ellie smirks

         "Shut up!" Sunny whines, going even redder than before.

         "Heh, so why so quiet, dude?" Ellie asks.

         "I don't know," you say. "I didn't want to interrupt you guys, I guess."

         "Please do, seriously. Most of the time we could use it," Sunny says, exasperated.

         "Well if you guys don't mind then," Ellie pipes up. "It's time to go over the all-important rules. We're playing basic five card draw so the game doesn't take all night, so that means no betting. At the beginning of each hand we'll all get five cards. After we have those, each of us can turn in any of those, up to all five, for new ones. Once we've done that, everyone puts down their hands and the loser has to strip. Once a person is bare-assed all of us here at the table get to decide what that person has to do as punishment. The last person left with anything on wins. Everyone got that?"

         "I think so. I've never played poker before, though. I just know how it works," Clem says.

         "Ah, you'll do fine," Ellie answers.

         "What about you? We...uh...kind of both didn't exactly have normal childhoods..."

         "Yeah, sure. I played loads of times with my friend Riley."

         "Strip poker, though?"

         "A...few times, yeah. She had terrible luck, though." Ellie grins. "You actually kind of remind me of her."

         "Gee, thanks."

         "No, not the luck part. Just in the general attitude. Ya know, the whole confident, survivor badass kind of deal. It was always kinda hot." Clem raises an eyebrow. "I mean she was! Not that you aren't, though, or well I'm...ya know...not trying to...you get what I'm trying to say."

         "Not really..."

         "She was saying that she was attracted to another girl who was like you in many ways, and thus likely finds those qualities in you attractive as well, though she does not want to come out and say that," Serena says, smirking.

         "Thanks for the input, Frenchie," Ellie says, rolling her eyes.

Only instead of cards, we battled our Pokemon. She was never that adept at it, though, so she never saw much. I certainly did not mind the view on my end, of course," Serena reminisces.

         "Let's...just play cards..." Clem says.

         So it's about to start. You hope this game doesn't go too bad for you. Damn...why do they all have to be so cute?

12521.title: Keep the jack, 9 and 8 and hope for a straight.

12522.content:
You discard everything but the jack. Feeling a bit more confident, you pick up four new cards from the top of the deck and you observe your new current hand.

Your recent additions turn out to be two queens (heart and clover), one spade of nines and one spade of sevens. You cautiously flash a nervous smile, as you flip your hand over to the other four girls, revealing your weak one pair hand. However, even though you only managed to score one pair, you still hold a small glimmer of hope in your mind that one of the others had drawn a weaker hand than you.

One by one, each of the girls table their cards while carefully eyeing their opponent's hand as well. Unsurprisingly, your hand wasn't the strongest after all, as Sunny's deck had managed to score two pairs of twos and threes. Fortunately for you, Serena had the worst luck of the draw, nowhere near close to a single pair. In fact, out of the five cards she picked, it looked like the jack of hearts was her highest card which still wasn't that impressive since everyone else had a single pair. It wasn't necessarily a strong round for anyone but most of you were happy they got through.

"Well," Sunny boasted, suddenly raising her voice. She was holding up her two pairs up for everyone to see and causing Serena to slightly frown, "Would you look at that! "

"Geez," you say, letting out a little laugh in the process, "You don't have to show off Sunny!"

"Sorry. I got a little carried away," Sunny apologized.

Over on the other side of the table, you watch as Serena takes off her hat, placing them neatly onto the table. Ellie notices as well, taking a good look at the straw hat.

"I wish I brought a hat with me," Ellie grumbled to no-one in particular, now looking at Sunny's gloved hands, "Or gloves. It feels unfair."

"Didn't you tell us earlier that you were wearing a shirt underneath your sweater?"

Ellie blushed in embarrassment, "I must've forgotten about that Clem. Ignore my previous statement."

After a brief moment of gathering everyone's cards, you and every other girl around the table are immediately given a new hand to work with. Will your luck change this round?

1253.content:
Ah, that's right. The Zombie Hunter Table. Without further adieu you step out of the car and towards the nondescript building in which The Inventory is housed. A bouncer, who may or may not have been Dudley from Street Fighter, opens the door for you as you show him your invitation. You step inside and inhale the musty smells of smoke and alcohol. You make your way through the semi-crowded room, noticing a few familiar faces as you head towards the back. You're pretty sure you saw Solid Snake sharing a a beer with Gordon Freeman, but you didn't get a good enough look. No one seems to pay much attention to you as you cross the room. Finally, you reach the entrance to the VIP area. You show your invitation to the bouncer up front (some Half Life Civil Protection goon by the look of him), and he lets you in.

         You step inside the room and you see your four fellow players already at the table: Jill (http://i.imgur.com/wTWduhA.jpg), Juliet (http://i.imgur.com/mxRXLgy.jpg), Clarie (http://i.imgur.com/gGPcoa9.jpg) and Annie (http://i.imgur.com/Y0sxHKN.png).

         "It looks like we've got our last player now," Claire says as you come in.

         "That we do. C'mon, pull up a chair. We're just about to start," Jill says.

         "He seems kinda young," Juliet says. "He reminds me of some of the kids I used to babysit."

         "You babysat?" Annie asks, amused.

         "Yeah...it didn't end well."

         "Uh...what do you mean?" You ask, nervous.

         "Oh...nothing, like, bad or anything. At least not bad by my standards, with zombies and everything. It was just a regular person's kind of bad," she answers.

         "I guess if he's here that means he got an invite, though," Claire says. "If the club cleared him I guess it's okay with us."

         "Yeah, I guess. Anyway, it's nice to see you, Claire. I heard Zoe supposed to be at this table, though?" Juliet asks.

         "Yeah, but someone dropped out of the shooter table at the last minute, so they asked her to take over since her game is all about guns," Jill says. "So I called Claire on short notice and she said 'yes.'"

         "Well, it's just nice to be doing something for a change," Claire sighs.

         "Aw, chin up. You'll get cycled back in eventually," Jill says kindly.

         "Says the girl who's been in two of the last three," Claire fires back, amused.

         "Heh, good point," Jill says. "Anyway, I guess we should go on with this, so let's get to the rules. We're playing basic five card draw so the game is faster, so that means no betting of any kind. At the beginning of each hand we all receive five cards. After we have those, each of us can turn in any of those, up to all five, for replacements. Once we've done that, everyone puts down their hands and the loser has to remove an article of clothing. Once a person is naked all of us here at the table get to decide what that person has to do as punishment. The last person left with anything on is the winner. Is that clear to everyone?"

         Everyone at the table nods in affirmation and the cards are dealt out.

12531.content:
"I'll take three," you say nervously. On one hand, you're pretty confident. You've been playing poker for longer than you can read. Seriously. There are pictures of you holding playing cards from when you were barely six months old. Okay, so your Dad is in the picture propping up the cards, but still...

And you're good with numbers. Okay, not really so good at elementary algebra, which your parents made sure you were enrolled in when you started the eighth grade. But you're good at counting cards and figuring odds and everything. And you've got millions of dollars in your online poker account. Granted, those online dollars don't translate into real dollars, but still...

On the other hand, this isn't family game night, or online fantasy. This is an actual poker game with four beautiful, badass women. And it's just possible that you might get to see one or all of these women naked. And then there's the forfeit. You might be able to get one of the women to do something while they were naked.

It was like Claire read your mind. "Hey, kid, are you still a virgin?"

You blush and Jill comes to your defense. Sort of.

"Of course he's still a virgin," Jill retorts. "He's all of twelve---"

"Thirteen," you blurt out before you can stop yourself.

"---thirteen," Jill continues. "So don't pick on him about it."

"Well, if he plays his cards right, after tonight, maybe he won't be," Claire says with a laugh. "Get it, plays his cards right?"

The other women groan and the cards get dealt out. You get a Queen of Diamonds, a Six of Hearts and a Three of Hearts. Almost a flush. You would have liked to have had a flush, but you don't need to get the highest hand. You just need not to get the lowest. Which you're sure two queens will keep you from having.

And you guess right. The lowest hand is Jill's, who has a Jack high nothing hand.

"Well I guess I pop my cherry first," Jill laughs. You blush, which makes all the other women laugh.

"So does each shoe count as a single article of clothing?" Jill asks.

"Shoes and socks count as one article of clothing all together," Juliet answers.

Jill nods and begins taking off her shoes. When she takes off her first sock, Claire shouts, "Who let the zombies in?" This gets a good laugh from everyone before the next round of cards gets dealt out.

125311.content:
You keep the Ace and King, and ask for three cards, feeling pretty good. For one thing, you didn't lose the first hand, which you think might give you some standing with the women around the table. Okay, maybe standing isn't the right word. These are all badass women who could probably kick your ass while having a casual conversation on their smartphones. But you feel at least that they won't treat you like a placeholder. You know, someone who they have to get out of the game before they can get serious.

Before you get dealt your hand, Carrie says, "I've got a question and an idea."

Annie rolls her eyes. "Carrie has an idea. We should all be afraid. We should all be very afraid."

All the women laugh, before Jill settles the group down.

"What's your question, Carrie?" Jill asks.

"Can we do side bets?" she asks.

"I'd say as long as they don't run counter to the main game's rules, side bets are fine," Juliet offers. "But as a sort of safety switch, all side bets have to be approved by the group as a whole."

The rest of you agree on this, although you're curious what kind of side bets Carrie has in mind.

"Now my idea depends on whether the kid answers a question honestly or not," Carrie said, a wicked grin appearing on her face. This piques the interest of everyone around the table, including you, but you're also more than a little worried that Carrie is going to have fun at your expense.

"I'd like to add the rule," Carrie began, "That everytime one of us loses a hand, and the kid has the high hand that round, he gets to play with the loser's boobs."

Your jaw drops at what Carrie suggests. You were hoping to see at least one of these women nude, and maybe get to win one of their forfeits, but that was all nebulous. But this is real. Carrie wants to set a rule that if you win a hand---not just not lose it, but win it---you get to play with boobs!

You're all in favor of this new rule, but don't want to blurt it out. The erection growing in your pants, though, it trying to raise its hand in favor of the motion.

"And I assume this question of yours would be a condition of whether we make this rule change, assuming everyone is in favor of it?" Annie asks.

You were so excited about the prospect of playing with their breasts (and, as the game progresses, bare breasts!!!) you forgot about the question.

"So what's the question?" Jill asks, and you're wondering the same thing.

Carrie grins at you. "The kid just has to tell us, and be honest, whether he's a virgin or not."

Juliet has a thoughtful look on her face. "I'll buy off on that."

To your surprise and delight and dread, the other two women acquiesce to Carrie's rule addition as well.

Part of you is obviously delighted. But to get to the delight part, you're going to have to admit that you're a virgin. And no guy wants to admit that. Particularly at a table of hot, adult women.

"Well, kid, what'll be?" Carrie grins.
