"I'm---I'm a virgin," you admit. Although you ought to feel elated, because now you have a chance of fondling one or more pairs of breasts, all you really feel is embarrassed.

"It's okay," Juliet tells you. "I am, too."

"I thought you and Nick," Annie begins, then cuts herself off. Juliet shook her head.

"Me and Nick were saving ourselves for each other," she begins, "But one night, when I was ready, I took my top off for the first time. It kind of compresses stuff and squeezes things down," Juliet continues, giving her breasts a squeeze through her top, "Kind of necessary, cuz too much movement up here interferes with chainsawing and cheerleading and stuff. Anyway, when I took my top off for him for the first and last time, he might have got confused or something. He called them big fat titties. They are not fat!" Juliet said emphatically. "They're just firm and large."

You think to yourself that, if you get a chance to see Juliet's chest, the word fat won't even enter your brain, much less exit your mouth.

"I'm a virgin, too," Annie admitted.

"I thought you and Nick---your Nick," Juliet clarified, "Well, there was that kiss..."

"And that kiss was all there ever was," Annie said sadly. "He never followed up on it."

Attention turned to Claire, who shrugged, "I haven't been super, super active, but they won't be making a movie about me entitled the twenty-something year old virgin, either. Or in Jill's case, the thirty-something year old virgin."

Jill flips Claire off, which gets a lot of laughs, before she turns serious. "Listen, when it happens, it happens. Sex is a lot of fun. Just make sure the first time is with someone who will make it fun, and won't make you regret it, okay?" You, Juliet and Anna nod solemnly, and Jill adds, "Okay, let's play some cards."

You get the Ace of Diamonds, the Five of Hearts, and the Two of Hearts. Enough to keep you off the bottom, you're sure, but not enough to get you to the top.

As it happens, your assessment is right. Carrie gets the high hand this round, while Annie loses, and takes off her gloves. Then the next hand is dealt out.

I think he was surprised when I took my top off for him, because my top kind of suppresses them, so they don't get in the way when I'm cheerleading and chainsawing and stuff. But nobody uses that word with me."

That kind of surprises you, because you thought Juliet and Nick were inseparable. You guess a lot of stuff happens off screen. Like different video characters being able to get together and socialize, for instance. But that explains why Juliet is here. Her story must have changed after the last game with her. You remember Annie has her own Nick, and they had that passionate kiss. Maybe something happened between them, like it did between Juliet and Nick, and that's she's here too.

The Ace of Diamonds, the Nine of Hearts and the Six of Hearts.

And you don't let yourself think about the possibility of helping one of the women remove an article of clothing.

"So what's everyone doing here, tonight?" Carrie asks. "I know the kid is here to see some stuff," she laughs, which makes you blush, which gets everyone else laughing. "Juliet, I thought I'd you'd be spending all your free time hang out with Nick."

"Nick is a douchebag," Juliet said with a huff. This gets a look of surprise from everyone, as Juliet continues. "We were supposed to be saving ourselves for each other, but Nick decided to stop saving."

"So you're a virgin?" Annie blurts out, and then covers her mouth as soon as she says it. Juliet nods, obviously not offended by the question.

"I was ready to do everything," Juliet explained, "And took off my top for Nick for the first time, and he used the 'f' word."

This got a gasp from everyone at the table. You're wondering what the 'f' word.

"He said I had big fat titties," Juliet explained. "They're not fat. They're firm. Very firm. I keep them compressed all the time with my top, because otherwise they'd get in the way when I'm cheerleading and chainsawing and stuff."

You eye Juliet's chest, but not long enough for her to catch you. She's looks proportionate to you, but not overly proportionate. On the other hand, you don't know anything about the physics of sports bra, especially not the one from Juliet's world.

"I'm a virgin, too," Annie admits in a quiet tone. "Me and Nick...my Nick...never worked out."

"Why don't we show our hands before this turns into an episode of Oprah?" Carrie says, obviously feeling things were getting a little too serious.

When the hands get shown, you're shocked. It's not the fact that your pair of aces wasn't the winning hand that shocks you. It's the fact that it was the lowest hand that throws you for a loop. And Jill has the winning hand.

"So what are you wanting taken off?" Jill asks as she stands up.

"Um....m-my jacket," you tell her, as you stand up.

When you find yourself face to face with Jill, you're a little surprised that she's not towering over you. You're actually kind of seeing eye to eye. Well, you did grow a few inches over summer, but on the other hand, you always thought of Jill Valentine as larger than life.

She stands just an inch or two away from you, face to face, smiling, before walking behind you and tugging your jacket off and down. Then she puts her hands on your arms, running them up and down. You shiver as she places her chin on your shoulder and whispers, "Time for the next hand."

"I think the kid's an exhibitionist," Claire says, and that gets a round of laughter from all the women. When you take your sneakers off, Annie jokes, "Well, I kill animated decaying corpses, so I've smelled worse, but not by much." Again, all the women are laughing at you. You have got to do something to turn this losing streak around.

And when the new cards are dealt out, you smile.

"I think the kid's losing streak is over," Claire said. "Look at the shit eating grin."

You don't bother hiding your grin. After all, bluffing has nothing to do with this particular game of five card draw, so why bother? You're just happy that you won't be the one taking anything off next time around.

12532442.content:
You turn in the Ace of Hearts, hoping to get a full house, but happy with the two pair if you don't.

You end up drawing the three of clubs. Well, it could be worse, you tell yourself. You still got a solid pair. You smile as you reveal your hand to the women around the table.

Annie reveals her hand. She has three fours.

Claire reveals her hand. She got that full house you were looking for. Three sevens and a pair of eights.

Jill reveals her hand. She has a King high Flush.

Then Juliet reveals her hand.

Jack of Spades.

Jack of Hearts.

Ten of Hearts.

Ten of Spades.

And, with a dramatic flair, she reveals her last card.

Five of Diamonds.

FUCKFUCKFUCKFUCKFUCKFUCKFUCK!

"Tough break," Juliet tells you sympathetically. No one makes any witty jokes as you remove your socks. As the new round of cards get dealt out, you realize you are only three cards and a forfeit from being out of the game. You are more determined than ever to turn your luck around.

125324424.content:
You're feeling pretty smug with your hand and stand put, and as the rest of the women get their cards, you suddenly realize something.

SHIT!

For some reason, you thought you had five clubs. The fact that you had two sevens should have clued you in that your hand couldn't possibly be entirely clubs. But for some reason, this didn't click in your mind. And it's too late to ask for cards.

When all the hands are revealed, yours is the lowest again. Carrie asks in a quiet voice, "You do know how to play this game, don't you?"

You nod, embarrassed, as you remove your shirt. There's no joking around from the women. They try to talk among themselves, and act as if they are embarrassed that you are there. You hope against hope that the next hand is THE HAND.

1253244242.content:
Without thinking, you hang on to the pair of tens and turn in everything else.

Carrie says something in a whisper to Annie who laughs. When they see you looking their way, they just smile and take their own cards.

Your three new cards are the Jack of Clubs, the Nine of Diamonds, and the Two of Spades.

When all the hands are revealed, Juliet beats your pair of tens Jack high with a pair of tens Queen high.

No one looks down your way when you slide of your jeans. They seem more embarrassed then you are. All the joviality that was present at the beginning of the game has disappeared. You sit in your chair, just one piece of clothing away from being naked in front of four beautiful, but fully clothed women. This is not turning out to be the best night of your life after all.

12532442421.content:
Okay, you think, two pairs. Two pairs should be enough to keep you out of the low spot this round.

Without thinking twice, you throw away the three of spades.

And get the two of spades in return. And that makes you want to cry. But they already think you're just a kid who doesn't know how to play poker already. You comfort yourself, telling yourself that your two pairs is enough to keep you ought of the low spot.

Jill reveals a straight, jack high.

Carrie reveals a flush.

Juliet reveals three of a kind.

And Annie reveals two pairs: a pair of Aces and a pair of Queens.

Nobody looks or says anything when the hands are revealed. Taking a deep breath, you slide off your boxer shorts. Your "little guy" had actually been looking forward to being out in the open with four beautiful women, but not like this.

125324424212.content:
You toss in the six of spades, and it's replaced by...

The six of clubs.

Of course it is.

When the cards are all revealed, unsurprisingly, you have the lowest hand.

You really want to cry.

You don't know what to say, but Carrie saves you the trouble. Unfortunately, she's rather callous about it.

"Your forfeit is you have to go home now, dressed as you are," Carrie explains. "Or undressed."

Juliet snickers, but covers her mouth as soon as she does so.

You get up and walk out, your hands covering your penis as you do so. As soon as you leave the room and close the door, you hear laughter and then conversation start back up again.

Fortunately, you don't have to walk home. The Inventory is providing a car. Unfortunately, you fall asleep on the way home. When you wake up, you are in your own bed. But someone has shaved your hair and eyebrows off, and has put the words "ULTIMATE LOSER" in permaink on your forehead.

You want to stay home from school, but your parents are pissed that you were out all night, and they had no idea where you were, so they make you go to school as a "life lesson." Your cap you were wearing to cover the permaink gets stolen on the school bus, and so you have to walk around all day with those words visible to everyone. This leads to altercations during lunchtime and disruptions during class. You end up having to stay afterschool for detention.

You give up poker and video games.

131.content:
Ah, that's right. The Shooter Table. Without further adieu you step out of the car and towards the nondescript building in which The Inventory is housed. A bouncer, who may or may not have been Dudley from Street Fighter, opens the door for you as you show him your invitation. You step inside and inhale the musty smells of smoke and alcohol. You make your way through the semi-crowded room, noticing a few familiar faces as you head towards the back. You're pretty sure you saw Solid Snake sharing a a beer with Gordon Freeman, but you didn't get a good enough look. No one seems to pay much attention to you as you cross the room. Finally, you reach the entrance to the VIP area. You show your invitation to the bouncer up front (some Half Life Civil Protection goon by the look of him), and he lets you in.

         You step inside the room and you see your four fellow players already at the table: Elizabeth (http://tinyurl.com/lt49zm5), Lilith (http://tinyurl.com/mvtxhub) Zoey (http://i.imgur.com/mzlywnj.jpg) and Lara Croft (http://i.imgur.com/wogG6Ve.png). You also note another woman is sitting at a booth nearby, seemingly spectating. On closer inspection she appears to be Samantha Nishimura (http://i.imgur.com/GphLqyk.png), Lara's friend. Maybe she got to come as Lara's guest, perhaps?

         "Ah, it seems our final player has arrived," Elizabeth says brightly.

         "Not very big on punctuality is she?" Lilith comments.

         "Meh, who needs to be on time? And hey...it's...another girl. Shocker." Zoey says sarcastically.

         "Ah, well. No use messing with the classics," Lara interjects.

         "I dunno, would it have been so hard to send a guy in here?" Zoey says. "What about you, new girl, are you okay with an all ladies game?"

         "Eh...I can have a good time either way," you say with a bit of a smirk.

         "Yeesh, you'll fit right in if you keep talking like that. Still, wouldn't you prefer a guy or two here, Lara?" Zoey asks.

         "Offff course I would. Heh heh. Yeah. The more guys the merrier!" She replies nervously. You can see Sam rolling her eyes from her seat. You notice one of her drink glasses is empty and she's already working on another.

         "Maybe you came to the right game after all, Red," Zoey says with a mischievous grin.

         "Anyway," Lilith interjects. "We're all here, so let's go over the rules. We're playing basic five card draw so this doesn't take all night. At the beginning of each hand we all get five cards. After we have those, each of us can turn in any of those, up to all five, for replacements. Once we've done that, everyone puts down their hands and the loser has to take something off. Once a person gets bare-assed all of us here at the table get to decide what that person has to do as punishment. The last person left with anything on is the winner."

         "And that winner is going to be Lara!" Sam says, slurring a bit.

         "Sam! Pipe down, we haven't even started yet," Lara responds.

         "You sure about that, girlie? Wanna make a bet?" Lilith asks.

         "Hell yes!" Sam says enthusiastically. "Lara rescued me single-handedly from a cult, so I'm pretty sure she can do this. As a show of solidarity, every time she takes something off, I will too."

         "You don't have to do this, Sam..." Lara says, slightly worried.

         "I say let her make her own mistakes," Zoey says with a smirk.

         "It's not like I could stop her, anyway," Lara says, resigned.

         "Besides, it won't even matter because you are going to rock it!" Sam says.

         "Is everyone ready then?" Elizabeth interrupts, bemused at the entire spectacle before her. After a bit of a double-take, everyone nods in agreement. The cards are passed out and you look at your hand.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------

132.content:
Ah, that's right. The Fighter Table. Without further adieu you step out of the car and towards the nondescript building in which The Inventory is housed. A bouncer, who may or may not have been Dudley from Street Fighter, opens the door for you as you show him your invitation. You step inside and inhale the musty smells of smoke and alcohol. You make your way through the semi-crowded room, noticing a few familiar faces as you head towards the back. You're pretty sure you saw Solid Snake sharing a a beer with Gordon Freeman, but you didn't get a good enough look. No one seems to pay much attention to you as you cross the room. Finally, you reach the entrance to the VIP area. You show your invitation to the bouncer up front (some Half Life Civil Protection goon by the look of him), and he lets you in.

         You step inside the room and you see your four fellow players already at the table: Kasumi (http://i.imgur.com/eRU0hj2.jpg), Cassandra (http://i.imgur.com/1TAVwEY.jpg), Chun Li (http://i.imgur.com/TcE56U4.jpg) and Morrigan (http://i.imgur.com/HIPFdSh.jpg).

         "Well, well, well...look who just walked in." Morrigan says with a sultry grin.

         "Finally! We were about to start without you." Cassandra says. "Another girl, huh? Ah, well. At least you look good enough...I mean...you know what I mean."

         "Girls can be plenty of fun, blond one. You can trust me on that," Morrigan says with a wink. "Anyway, she definitely looks like fun to me. Maybe if you're lucky, Ms Scarlet, I'll let you join my collection." Her grin turns predatory as bats suddenly flutter around her. "I'll have you know they rather enjoy their lives," she adds as she gestures to them. "They live in a constant state of ecstasy, forever satisfying me and being satisfied by me. The perks of being a succubus."

         "Hmm...well that doesn't sound half bad. Do I have to be a bat?" You ask.

         "That's just how it looks for the outside. To you, it would be an infinite universe of unimaginable pleasure."

         "She's just being dramatic," Chun Li cuts in, rolling her eyes. "The one thing she actually craves most in the world is attention."

         "Don't sound so dismissive," Morrigan purrs. "I haven't given up on your either, Legs."

         "If we may continue then," Kasumi interjects. "We're all here, so let's go over the rules. We're playing basic five card draw so this doesn't take all night. At the beginning of each hand we all get five cards. After we have those, each of us can turn in any of those, up to all five, for replacements. Once we've done that, everyone puts down their hands and the loser has to take something off. Once a person is rendered naked all of us here at the table get to decide what that person has to do as punishment. The last person left with anything on is the winner."

         "I can hardly wait. Winning or losing doesn't matter. I win regardless," Morrigan says.

         "Well if you are offering to take it all off now and make things a little easier on us, be my guest," Cassandra says.

         "Oh no, I couldn't do that. It's the risk and anticipation that's most of the fun. Besides, I wouldn't deprive myself of the chance to best all of you and claim you as my own."

         "I...don't think that's in the rules..." Kasumi says with a blush.

         "We'll see..." Morrigan responds.

133.content:
Ah, that's right. WRPG Table. Without further adieu you step out of the car and towards the nondescript building in which The Inventory is housed. A bouncer, who may or may not have been Dudley from Street Fighter, opens the door for you as you show him your invitation. You step inside and inhale the musty smells of smoke and alcohol. You make your way through the semi-crowded room, noticing a few familiar faces as you head towards the back. You're pretty sure you saw Solid Snake sharing a a beer with Gordon Freeman, but you didn't get a good enough look. No one seems to pay much attention to you as you cross the room. Finally, you reach the entrance to the VIP area. You show your invitation to the bouncer up front (some Half Life Civil Protection goon by the look of him), and he lets you in.

         You step inside the room and you see your four fellow players already at the table: Liara (http://i.imgur.com/7UFd8A2.jpg), Jeanette (http://i.imgur.com/WzyYeDz.jpg), Sis (http://i.imgur.com/nGTuVFM.jpg) and Triss (http://i.imgur.com/USt1eUm.jpg).

         "Ah, it would seem that we are all here now," Liara says as she spots you enter.

         "Yes it would," Jeanette agrees with a seductive smile. "And here I thought the spread was already so excellent. You seem so...ordinary compared to the others here, little girl. Don't worry, I mean that as a compliment. It makes you...unique. I can't wait to unwrap you. Just like a Christmas present."

         "I'm not that little..." You say, dropping your gaze briefly to your chest and then back at Jeanette with a smirk.

         "Mmm, I think you and I are going to get along just fine. Anyway, I was talking about your relative age. Immortality tends to frame mortal lifespans in a different light," she answers.

         "Well, I'm 108," Liara says.

         "Oh? Well, you're not exactly human are you, blue girl? Then again, neither am I," Jeanette comments.

         "I'm also over 100. I don't like giving exacts. It tends to depress me," Triss says slyly. "One of the perks of magic," she adds.

         "Well, I guess we're all a little older than we look here," Jeanette says. "What about you, quiet one? Are you hiding secret powers as well?" Jeanette looks at Sis. Sis rolls her eyes and sighs, pauses for a few seconds and holds up all ten of her fingers twice. "Is that supposed to mean 20? Is there any reason you couldn't just tell us?"

         Sis gives Jeanette a withering sardonic look, grabs a pen and writes on a pad of paper next to her. She holds up the pad and the message reads: "I'm mute."

         "Ooooooh," Jeanette says.

         Sis turns to the next page on the pad which reads: "Dumb bitch."

         "Well now, she's feisty. I like her. This is going to be fun," Jeanette says.

         "If we may continue then," Liara interjects. "We're all here, so let's go over the rules. We're playing basic five card draw for the sake of brevity, so no betting. At the beginning of each hand we all get five cards. After we have those, each of us can turn in any of those, up to all five, for replacements. Once we've done that, everyone puts down their hands and the loser has to take something off. Once a person is rendered naked all of us here at the table get to decide what that person has to do as punishment. The last person left with anything on is the winner."

         "Well, I'm certainly not shy, but I've seen me naked before. All of you on the other hand..." Jeanette says.

         "Aren't you laying on the seductive vampire thing a little thick?" Triss asks.

         "Well, Daddy always said to do what you love. I wonder if I'll grow to love any of you?" Jeanette giggles and you can see her fangs.

         "I guess I shouldn't have asked..." Triss says dully.

134.content:
Ah, that's right. JRPG Table. Without further adieu you step out of the car and towards the nondescript building in which The Inventory is housed. A bouncer, who may or may not have been Dudley from Street Fighter, opens the door for you as you show him your invitation. You step inside and inhale the musty smells of smoke and alcohol. You make your way through the semi-crowded room, noticing a few familiar faces as you head towards the back. You're pretty sure you saw Solid Snake sharing a a beer with Gordon Freeman, but you didn't get a good enough look. No one seems to pay much attention to you as you cross the room. Finally, you reach the entrance to the VIP area. You show your invitation to the bouncer up front (some Half Life Civil Protection goon by the look of him), and he lets you in.

         You step inside the room and you see your four fellow players already at the table: Elizabeth (http://i.imgur.com/7LrQ9kQ.png), Jessica (http://i.imgur.com/fy2cyrb.jpg), Tifa (http://i.imgur.com/InOydrF.png) and Aika (http://i.imgur.com/u0uu8YS.jpg).

         "Oh! It seems our last guest has arrived!" Elizabeth pipes up as you enter. "It's very nice to meet you! My name is Elizabeth."

         "I have a feeling she knows that..." Jessica says.

         "Oh, I'm sorry. I'm just rather excited to be here. I have a strong suspicion that this is going to be a very memorable experience. After all, there are so many unique faces here. I look forward to seeing all of your true selves laid bare," Elizabeth says.

         "I guess that's one way of putting it," Tifa reasons.

         "I suspect you might be the most unique of all of us, though, young lady. You are the only one here from a specific sphere of existence, am I correct?" Elizabeth asks, her bright yellow eyes on you.

         "I suppose so," you say. "Does that mean you're all aiming to get me in my birthday suit first?" You ask, slyly.

         "Were it so easy," Jessica says. "Alas, it's mostly luck."

         "And I'm very lucky!" Aika pips up.

         "Now, just so I'm clear, we are playing strip poker, yes? The daring game in which one wagers their modesty instead of monetary wealth? I have very much wanted to try it. I have no shortage of funds, but the thrill of losing here is much more substantial. I can see why you humans would find it exhilarating," Elizabeth says.

         "Wait...we're not...playing for treasure?" Aika says.

         "How could you not know that?" Jessica says.

         "I just thought it was regular poker. Are you saying I don't stand to win any treasure here?" Aika asks, her voice nearly whiny.

         "We signed papers...how could you have not known?" Tifa says.

         "I guess I didn't look close enough..." Aika says in a small voice.

         "Well, do not feel too alarmed. You said yourself that you are very lucky, correct? If this is true, you have nothing to worry about. Besides, not all treasures are measured in physical wealth. Many come from far less tangible places, like the bonds you create with others. I wonder if will be creating special bonds with any of you..." Elizabeth says, her usual mystical airy tone now colored with the slightest suggestive undertone.

         "Man, where did they find this girl?" Jessica asks.

         "If you would all be so kind as to listen to the rules then," Elizabeth interjects. "We're playing basic five card draw for the sake of brevity, so that means no betting of any kind. At the beginning of each hand we all receive five cards. After we have those, each of us can turn in any of those, up to all five, for replacements. Once we've done that, everyone puts down their hands and the loser has to remove an article of clothing. Once a person is rendered naked all of us here at the table get to decide what that person has to do as punishment. The last person left with anything on is the winner. Is that clear to everyone?"

         Everyone at the table nods in affirmation and the cards are dealt out.

1351.content:
Ah, that's right. Furry Table. Without further adieu you step out of the car and towards the nondescript building in which The Inventory is housed. A bouncer, who may or may not have been Dudley from Street Fighter, opens the door for you as you show him your invitation. You step inside and inhale the musty smells of smoke and alcohol. You make your way through the semi-crowded room, noticing a few familiar faces as you head towards the back. You're pretty sure you saw Solid Snake sharing a a beer with Gordon Freeman, but you didn't get a good enough look. No one seems to pay much attention to you as you cross the room. Finally, you reach the entrance to the VIP area. You show your invitation to the bouncer up front (some Half Life Civil Protection goon by the look of him), and he lets you in.

         You step inside the room and you see your four fellow players already at the table: Amy (http://i.imgur.com/FenKxyX.jpg), Krystal (http://i.imgur.com/DattNnh.jpg), Rouge (http://i.imgur.com/nE1smvO.png) and Carmelita (http://i.imgur.com/7TRDwPO.jpg). This...this is going to be a weird game.

         "Well, it seems our final player is here," Rouge purrs.

         "She's...she's a human. I didn't expect that," Amy says.

         "That doesn't mean I don't know how to have fun..." you say.

         "I'm not sure why you're surprised, Amy. I was expecting something like this," Krystal says.

         "Well, as long as she plays by the rules I don't see why it should be a problem," Carmelita pipes up.

         "I think having a human might be fun..." Rouge says playfully.

         "Well speaking of rules," Krystal interjects. "We're playing basic five card draw so the game is faster, so that means no betting of any kind. At the beginning of each hand we all receive five cards. After we have those, each of us can turn in any of those, up to all five, for replacements. Once we've done that, everyone puts down their hands and the loser has to remove an article of clothing. Once a person is rendered naked all of us here at the table get to decide what that person has to do as punishment. The last person left with anything on is the winner. Is that clear to everyone?"

         Everyone at the table nods in affirmation and the cards are dealt out.

You keep the 8, 9, and 10 hoping for a straight however your hope turns to disappointment rather fast as you draw a 5 of hearts and 7 of spades. Your first hand of the game and it's worthless. 1352.content:
Ah, that's right. The Junior League. Without further adieu you step out of the car and towards the nondescript building in which The Inventory is housed. A bouncer, who may or may not have been Dudley from Street Fighter, opens the door for you as you show him your invitation. You step inside and inhale the musty smells of smoke and alcohol. You make your way through the semi-crowded room, noticing a few familiar faces as you head towards the back. You're pretty sure you saw Solid Snake sharing a a beer with Gordon Freeman, but you didn't get a good enough look. No one seems to pay much attention to you as you cross the room. Finally, you reach the entrance to the VIP area. You show your invitation to the bouncer up front (some Half Life Civil Protection goon by the look of him), and he lets you in.

         You step inside the room and you see your four fellow players already at the table: Ellie (http://i.imgur.com/Z62s3Vm.jpg), Clementine (http://i.imgur.com/Yiarblj.png), Sunny (http://i.imgur.com/6TZLWBX.jpg) and Serena (http://i.imgur.com/gPLQxtw.png).

         "Oh, hey, it looks like the last player is here. 'Sup?" Ellie says, looking at you as you enter.

         "Ah...I guess I was expecting someone younger," Sunny says, wide-eyed. She looks slightly intimidated as a fully-developed woman sits down at the table with her.

         "Yeah...I wish I had boobs too," Ellie says casually, though with a hint of sarcasm as she follows Sunny's gaze.

         "That's not- ugh, shut up, Ellie!" Sunny pouts. Ellie giggles.

         "Jeez," Clementine says as she rolls her eyes.

         "Aw, c'mon guys, there's no need to act like your teacher just walked in. Just treat me like your cool, older sister or something," you say.

         "I do not mind you being older than us," Serena pipes up. You notice she seems to have a French accent. You also seem to recall it's not called France where she's from. "With age comes more...experience. I think it could make the game more fun." You notice a definite tone of mischief there.

         "Well aren't you a cheeky one. I'll have to keep my eye on you," you say playfully.

         "Maybe you should. You might like what you see," Serena answers back.

         "Daaaaaaamn, someone's laying it on a little thick," Ellie pipes up. "Anyway, It's time to go over the all-important rules. We're playing basic five card draw so the game doesn't take all night, so that means no betting. At the beginning of each hand we'll all get five cards. After we have those, each of us can turn in any of those, up to all five, for new ones. Once we've done that, everyone puts down their hands and the loser has to strip. Once a person is bare-assed all of us here at the table get to decide what that person has to do as punishment. The last person left with anything on wins. Everyone got that?"

         "I think so. I've never played poker before, though. I just know how it works," Clem says.

         "Ah, you'll do fine," Ellie answers.

         "What about you? We...uh...kind of both didn't exactly have normal childhoods..."

         "Yeah, sure. I played loads of times with my friend Riley."

         "Strip poker, though?"

         "A...few times, yeah. She had terrible luck, though." Ellie grins. "You actually kind of remind me of her."

         "Gee, thanks."

         "No, not the luck part. Just in the general attitude. Ya know, the whole confident, survivor badass kind of deal. It was always kinda hot." Clem raises an eyebrow. "I mean she was! Not that you aren't, though, or well I'm...ya know...not trying to...you get what I'm trying to say."

         "Not really..."

         "She was saying that she was attracted to another girl who was like you in many ways, and thus likely finds those qualities in you attractive as well, though she does not want to come out and say that," Serena says, smirking.

         "Thanks for the input, Frenchie," Ellie says, rolling her eyes.

         "I do not know this French, but I do know what you are feeling. I personally had a very similar experience with my friend Shauna. We played a game similar to this. Only instead of cards, we battled our Pokemon. She was never that adept at it, though, so she never saw much. I certainly did not mind the view on my end, of course," Serena reminisces.

         "Let's...just play cards..." Clem says.

         "Yeah..." Sunny agrees.

         So it's about to start. You have a feeling this is going to be loads of fun. These girls are all major cuties.

141.content:
Ah, that's right. The Shooter Table. Without further adieu you step out of the car and towards the nondescript building in which The Inventory is housed. A bouncer, who may or may not have been Dudley from Street Fighter, opens the door for you as you show him your invitation. You step inside and inhale the musty smells of smoke and alcohol. You make your way through the semi-crowded room, noticing a few familiar faces as you head towards the back. You're pretty sure you saw Solid Snake sharing a a beer with Gordon Freeman, but you didn't get a good enough look. No one seems to pay much attention to you as you cross the room. Finally, you reach the entrance to the VIP area. You show your invitation to the bouncer up front (some Half Life Civil Protection goon by the look of him), and he lets you in.

         You step inside the room and you see your four fellow players already at the table: Elizabeth (http://tinyurl.com/lt49zm5), Lilith (http://tinyurl.com/mvtxhub) Zoey (http://i.imgur.com/mzlywnj.jpg) and Lara Croft (http://i.imgur.com/wogG6Ve.png). You also note another woman is sitting at a booth nearby, seemingly spectating. On closer inspection she appears to be Samantha Nishimura (http://i.imgur.com/GphLqyk.png), Lara's friend. Maybe she got to come as Lara's guest, perhaps?

         "Ah, it seems our final player has arrived," Elizabeth says brightly.

         "Not very big on punctuality is she?" Lilith comments.

         "Meh, who needs to be on time? And hey...it's...another girl. Shocker." Zoey says sarcastically.

         "Ah, well. No use messing with the classics," Lara interjects.

         "I dunno, would it have been so hard to send a guy in here?" Zoey says. "I mean...I at least dig her vibes. I'm sensing a kind of of kindred spirit thing here."

         "Your shared interests in hoodies points at a shared interest in slacking, at any rate," Lilith says.

         "Don't knock it until you tried it!" Zoey quips back. "Anyway, wouldn't you rather have a guy or two here, new chick?"

         "Well...I don't mind it being all girls..." You say shyly.

         "Yeesh, you'll fit right in if you keep talking like that. Still, wouldn't you prefer some y-chromosomes at the table, Lara?" Zoey asks.

         "Offff course I would. Heh heh. Yeah. The more guys the merrier!" She replies nervously. You can see Sam rolling her eyes from her seat. You notice one of her drink glasses is empty and she's already working on another.

         "Maybe you came to the right game after all, small one," Zoey says with a mischievous grin.

         "Anyway," Lilith interjects. "We're all here, so let's go over the rules. We're playing basic five card draw so this doesn't take all night. At the beginning of each hand we all get five cards. After we have those, each of us can turn in any of those, up to all five, for replacements. Once we've done that, everyone puts down their hands and the loser has to take something off. Once a person gets bare-assed all of us here at the table get to decide what that person has to do as punishment. The last person left with anything on is the winner."

         "And that winner is going to be Lara!" Sam says, slurring a bit.

         "Sam! Pipe down, we haven't even started yet," Lara responds.

         "You sure about that, girlie? Wanna make a bet?" Lilith asks.

         "Hell yes!" Sam says enthusiastically. "Lara rescued me single-handedly from a cult, so I'm pretty sure she can do this. As a show of solidarity, every time she takes something off, I will too."

         "You don't have to do this, Sam..." Lara says, slightly worried.

         "I say let her make her own mistakes," Zoey says with a smirk.

         "It's not like I could stop her, anyway," Lara says, resigned.

         "Besides, it won't even matter because you are going to rock it!" Sam says.

         "Is everyone ready then?" Elizabeth interrupts, bemused at the entire spectacle before her. After a bit of a double-take, everyone nods in agreement. The cards are passed out and you look at your hand.

Ah, that's right. The Fighter Table. Without further adieu you step out of the car and towards the nondescript building in which The Inventory is housed. A bouncer, who may or may not have been Dudley from Street Fighter, opens the door for you as you show him your invitation. You step inside and inhale the musty smells of smoke and alcohol. You make your way through the semi-crowded room, noticing a few familiar faces as you head towards the back. You're pretty sure you saw Solid Snake sharing a a beer with Gordon Freeman, but you didn't get a good enough look. No one seems to pay much attention to you as you cross the room. Finally, you reach the entrance to the VIP area. You show your invitation to the bouncer up front (some Half Life Civil Protection goon by the look of him), and he lets you in.

         You step inside the room and you see your four fellow players already at the table: Kasumi (http://i.imgur.com/eRU0hj2.jpg), Cassandra (http://i.imgur.com/1TAVwEY.jpg), Chun Li (http://i.imgur.com/TcE56U4.jpg) and Morrigan (http://i.imgur.com/HIPFdSh.jpg).

         "Well, well, well...look who just walked in." Morrigan says with a sultry grin.

         "Finally! We were about to start without you." Cassandra says. "Another girl, huh? I guess I should have read the fine print."

         "Girls can be plenty of fun, blond one. You can trust me on that," Morrigan says with a wink. "Anyway, this one intrigues me. She hides her sensual side well, but if you give me enough time with her I could make her purr like a kitten. Maybe if you're lucky, little kitten, I'll let you join my collection." Her grin turns predatory as bats suddenly flutter around her. "I'll have you know they rather enjoy their lives," she adds as she gestures to them. "They live in a constant state of ecstasy, forever satisfying me and being satisfied by me. The perks of being a succubus."

         "Yeah? What if they want a pizza or something?" You ask. You hear Chun Li giggle.

         "She's just being dramatic," Chun Li cuts in, rolling her eyes. "The one thing she actually craves most in the world is attention."

         "Don't sound so dismissive," Morrigan purrs. "I haven't given up on your either, Legs."

         "If we may continue then," Kasumi interjects. "We're all here, so let's go over the rules. We're playing basic five card draw so this doesn't take all night. At the beginning of each hand we all get five cards. After we have those, each of us can turn in any of those, up to all five, for replacements. Once we've done that, everyone puts down their hands and the loser has to take something off. Once a person is rendered naked all of us here at the table get to decide what that person has to do as punishment. The last person left with anything on is the winner."

         "I can hardly wait. Winning or losing doesn't matter. I win regardless," Morrigan says.

         "Well if you are offering to take it all off now and make things a little easier on us, be my guest," Cassandra says.

         "Oh no, I couldn't do that. It's the risk and anticipation that's most of the fun. Besides, I wouldn't deprive myself of the chance to best all of you and claim you as my own."

         "I...don't think that's in the rules..." Kasumi says with a blush.

         "We'll see..." Morrigan responds.

143.content:
Ah, that's right. WRPG Table. Without further adieu you step out of the car and towards the nondescript building in which The Inventory is housed. A bouncer, who may or may not have been Dudley from Street Fighter, opens the door for you as you show him your invitation. You step inside and inhale the musty smells of smoke and alcohol. You make your way through the semi-crowded room, noticing a few familiar faces as you head towards the back. You're pretty sure you saw Solid Snake sharing a a beer with Gordon Freeman, but you didn't get a good enough look. No one seems to pay much attention to you as you cross the room. Finally, you reach the entrance to the VIP area. You show your invitation to the bouncer up front (some Half Life Civil Protection goon by the look of him), and he lets you in.

         You step inside the room and you see your four fellow players already at the table: Liara (http://i.imgur.com/7UFd8A2.jpg), Jeanette (http://i.imgur.com/WzyYeDz.jpg), Sis (http://i.imgur.com/nGTuVFM.jpg) and Triss (http://i.imgur.com/USt1eUm.jpg).

         "Ah, it would seem that we are all here now," Liara says as she spots you enter.

         "Yes it would," Jeanette agrees with a seductive smile. "And here I thought the spread was already so excellent. You seem so...ordinary compared to the others here, little girl. Don't worry, I mean that as a compliment. It makes you...unique. I can't wait to unwrap you. Just like a Christmas present."

         "Little? Are you calling me short?" You say, frowning.

         "Not at all. I think you look cute just like you are. The more you cover up, the more I want to see everything. What I was talking about is our relative ages. I'm a vampire so...'old' to you doesn't mean the same thing as it does to me." she answers.

         "Well, I'm 108," Liara says.

         "Oh? Well, you're not exactly human are you, blue girl? Then again, neither am I," Jeanette comments.

         "I'm also over 100. I don't like giving exacts. It tends to depress me," Triss says slyly. "One of the perks of magic," she adds.

         "Well, I guess we're all a little older than we look here," Jeanette says. "What about you, quiet one? Are you hiding secret powers as well?" Jeanette looks at Sis. Sis rolls her eyes and sighs, pauses for a few seconds and holds up all ten of her fingers twice. "Is that supposed to mean 20? Is there any reason you couldn't just tell us?"

         Sis gives Jeanette a withering sardonic look, grabs a pen and writes on a pad of paper next to her. She holds up the pad and the message reads: "I'm mute."

         "Ooooooh," Jeanette says.

         Sis turns to the next page on the pad which reads: "Dumb bitch."

         "Well now, she's feisty. I like her. This is going to be fun," Jeanette says.

         "If we may continue then," Liara interjects. "We're all here, so let's go over the rules. We're playing basic five card draw for the sake of brevity, so no betting. At the beginning of each hand we all get five cards. After we have those, each of us can turn in any of those, up to all five, for replacements. Once we've done that, everyone puts down their hands and the loser has to take something off. Once a person is rendered naked all of us here at the table get to decide what that person has to do as punishment. The last person left with anything on is the winner."

         "Well, I'm certainly not shy, but I've seen me naked before. All of you on the other hand..." Jeanette says.

         "Aren't you laying on the seductive vampire thing a little thick?" Triss asks.

         "Well, Daddy always said to do what you love. I wonder if I'll grow to love any of you?" Jeanette giggles and you can see her fangs.

         "I guess I shouldn't have asked..." Triss says dully.

choices: Keep the three kings and the ace.
144.content:
Ah, that's right. JRPG Table. Without further adieu you step out of the car and towards the nondescript building in which The Inventory is housed. A bouncer, who may or may not have been Dudley from Street Fighter, opens the door for you as you show him your invitation. You step inside and inhale the musty smells of smoke and alcohol. You make your way through the semi-crowded room, noticing a few familiar faces as you head towards the back. You're pretty sure you saw Solid Snake sharing a a beer with Gordon Freeman, but you didn't get a good enough look. No one seems to pay much attention to you as you cross the room. Finally, you reach the entrance to the VIP area. You show your invitation to the bouncer up front (some Half Life Civil Protection goon by the look of him), and he lets you in.

         You step inside the room and you see your four fellow players already at the table: Elizabeth (http://i.imgur.com/7LrQ9kQ.png), Jessica (http://i.imgur.com/fy2cyrb.jpg), Tifa (http://i.imgur.com/InOydrF.png) and Aika (http://i.imgur.com/u0uu8YS.jpg).

         "Oh! It seems our last guest has arrived!" Elizabeth pipes up as you enter. "It's very nice to meet you! My name is Elizabeth."

         "I have a feeling she knows that..." Jessica says.

         "Oh, I'm sorry. I'm just rather excited to be here. I have a strong suspicion that this is going to be a very memorable experience. After all, there are so many unique faces here. I look forward to seeing all of your true selves laid bare," Elizabeth says.

         "I guess that's one way of putting it," Tifa reasons.

         "I suspect you might be the most unique of all of us, though, young lady. You are the only one here from a specific sphere of existence, am I correct?" Elizabeth asks, her bright yellow eyes on you.

         "Yep, 100% boring normal, right here," You say.

         "Oh, you aren't boring. I think there's more depth to you than you realize," Elizabeth says.

         "Well, if you can't believe a kooky elevator attendant in blue velvet who can you believe?" You ask. "I suppose you're all out to beat up on the normal girl first, right?"

         "Aw, we aren't that cruel," Jessica says. "Besides, it's mostly luck."

         "And I'm very lucky!" Aika pips up.

         "Now, just so I'm clear, we are playing strip poker, yes? The daring game in which one wagers their modesty instead of monetary wealth? I have very much wanted to try it. I have no shortage of funds, but the thrill of losing here is much more substantial. I can see why you humans would find it exhilarating," Elizabeth says.

         "Wait...we're not...playing for treasure?" Aika says.

         "How could you not know that?" Jessica says.

         "I just thought it was regular poker. Are you saying I don't stand to win any treasure here?" Aika asks, her voice nearly whiny.

         "We signed papers...how could you have not known?" Tifa says.

         "I guess I didn't look close enough..." Aika says in a small voice.

         "Well, do not feel too alarmed. You said yourself that you are very lucky, correct? If this is true, you have nothing to worry about. Besides, not all treasures are measured in physical wealth. Many come from far less tangible places, like the bonds you create with others. I wonder if will be creating special bonds with any of you..." Elizabeth says, her usual mystical airy tone now colored with the slightest suggestive undertone.

         "Man, where did they find this girl?" Jessica asks.

         "If you would all be so kind as to listen to the rules then," Elizabeth interjects. "We're playing basic five card draw for the sake of brevity, so that means no betting of any kind. At the beginning of each hand we all receive five cards. After we have those, each of us can turn in any of those, up to all five, for replacements. Once we've done that, everyone puts down their hands and the loser has to remove an article of clothing. Once a person is rendered naked all of us here at the table get to decide what that person has to do as punishment. The last person left with anything on is the winner. Is that clear to everyone?"

         Everyone at the table nods in affirmation and the cards are dealt out.

1452.content:
Ah, that's right. The Junior League. Without further adieu you step out of the car and towards the nondescript building in which The Inventory is housed. A bouncer, who may or may not have been Dudley from Street Fighter, opens the door for you as you show him your invitation. You step inside and inhale the musty smells of smoke and alcohol. You make your way through the semi-crowded room, noticing a few familiar faces as you head towards the back. You're pretty sure you saw Solid Snake sharing a a beer with Gordon Freeman, but you didn't get a good enough look. No one seems to pay much attention to you as you cross the room. Finally, you reach the entrance to the VIP area. You show your invitation to the bouncer up front (some Half Life Civil Protection goon by the look of him), and he lets you in.

         You step inside the room and you see your four fellow players already at the table: Ellie (http://i.imgur.com/Z62s3Vm.jpg), Clementine (http://i.imgur.com/Yiarblj.png), Sunny (http://i.imgur.com/6TZLWBX.jpg) and Serena (http://i.imgur.com/gPLQxtw.png).

         "Oh, hey, it looks like the last player is here. 'Sup?" Ellie says, looking at you as you enter.

         "Ah...I guess I was expecting someone younger," Sunny says, wide-eyed. She looks slightly intimidated as a fully-developed woman sits down at the table with her.

         "Yeah...I wish I had boobs too," Ellie says casually, though with a hint of sarcasm as she follows Sunny's gaze.

         "That's not- ugh, shut up, Ellie!" Sunny pouts. Ellie giggles.

         "Jeez," Clementine says as she rolls her eyes.

         "Damn, guys, I'm not that much older than you. Just think of me like a cool big sister," you say.

         "Cool, huh? Well if you're so cool, how much can you tell me about Savage Starlight?" Ellie asks

         "The better question would be how much can't I tell you about Savage Starlight," you reply.

         "Touche. Well, you have my seal of approval," Ellie responds.

         "I do not mind you being older than us," Serena pipes up. You notice she seems to have a French accent. You also recall it's not called France where she's from. They call it Kalos. "With age comes more...experience. I think it could make the game more fun." You notice a definite tone of mischief there.

         "If you say so. Not exactly sure what you're expecting from me there, though," you say.

         "Eh, you'll get used to her," Ellie pipes up. "Anyway, It's time to go over the all-important rules. We're playing basic five card draw so the game doesn't take all night, so that means no betting. At the beginning of each hand we'll all get five cards. After we have those, each of us can turn in any of those, up to all five, for new ones. Once we've done that, everyone puts down their hands and the loser has to strip. Once a person is bare-assed all of us here at the table get to decide what that person has to do as punishment. The last person left with anything on wins. Everyone got that?"

         "I think so. I've never played poker before, though. I just know how it works," Clem says.

         "Ah, you'll do fine," Ellie answers.

         "What about you? We...uh...kind of both didn't exactly have normal childhoods..."

         "Yeah, sure. I played loads of times with my friend Riley."

         "Strip poker, though?"

         "A...few times, yeah. She had terrible luck, though." Ellie grins. "You actually kind of remind me of her."

         "Gee, thanks."

         "No, not the luck part. Just in the general attitude. Ya know, the whole confident, survivor badass kind of deal. It was always kinda hot." Clem raises an eyebrow. "I mean she was! Not that you aren't, though, or well I'm...ya know...not trying to...you get what I'm trying to say."

         "Not really..."

         "She was saying that she was attracted to another girl who was like you in many ways, and thus likely finds those qualities in you attractive as well, though she does not want to come out and say that," Serena says, smirking.

         "Thanks for the input, Frenchie," Ellie says, rolling her eyes.

         "I do not know this French, but I do know what you are feeling. I personally had a very similar experience with my friend Shauna. We played a game similar to this. Only instead of cards, we battled our Pokemon. She was never that adept at it, though, so she never saw much. I certainly did not mind the view on my end, of course," Serena reminisces.

         "Let's...just play cards..." Clem says.

         "Yeah..." Sunny agrees.

         So it's about to start. You hope you don't make an ass of yourself. These girls seem cool, though.

151.content:
Ah, that's right. The Shooter Table. Without further adieu you step out of the car and towards the nondescript building in which The Inventory is housed. A bouncer, who may or may not have been Dudley from Street Fighter, opens the door for you as you show him your invitation. You step inside and inhale the musty smells of smoke and alcohol. You make your way through the semi-crowded room, noticing a few familiar faces as you head towards the back. You're pretty sure you saw Solid Snake sharing a a beer with Gordon Freeman, but you didn't get a good enough look. No one seems to pay much attention to you as you cross the room. Finally, you reach the entrance to the VIP area. You show your invitation to the bouncer up front (some Half Life Civil Protection goon by the look of him), and he lets you in.

         You step inside the room and you see your four fellow players already at the table: Elizabeth (http://tinyurl.com/lt49zm5), Lilith (http://tinyurl.com/mvtxhub) Zoey (http://i.imgur.com/mzlywnj.jpg) and Lara Croft (http://i.imgur.com/wogG6Ve.png). You also note another woman is sitting at a booth nearby, seemingly spectating. On closer inspection she appears to be Samantha Nishimura (http://i.imgur.com/GphLqyk.png), Lara's friend. Maybe she got to come as Lara's guest, perhaps?

         "Ah, it seems our final player has arrived," Elizabeth says brightly.

         "Not very big on punctuality is she?" Lilith comments.

         "Meh, who needs to be on time? And hey...it's...a little girl. That's different..." Zoey says bemused.

         "Aww, she's almost too adorable," Lara interjects.

         "I guess so, yeah, but would it have been so hard to send a guy in here?" Zoey says. "What about you, Squirt? Wouldn't you rather be playing this with some boys?"

         "Girls are fun to play with too..." you say, mostly innocently.

         "Yeesh, you'll fit right in if you keep talking like that. Still, wouldn't you prefer a guy or two here, Lara?" Zoey asks.

         "Offff course I would. Heh heh. Yeah. The more guys the merrier!" She replies nervously. You can see Sam rolling her eyes from her seat. You notice one of her drink glasses is empty and she's already working on another.

         "Anyway," Lilith interjects. "We're all here, so let's go over the rules. We're playing basic five card draw so this doesn't take all night. At the beginning of each hand we all get five cards. After we have those, each of us can turn in any of those, up to all five, for replacements. Once we've done that, everyone puts down their hands and the loser has to take something off. Once a person gets bare-assed all of us here at the table get to decide what that person has to do as punishment. The last person left with anything on is the winner."

         "And that winner is going to be Lara!" Sam says, slurring a bit.

         "Sam! Pipe down, we haven't even started yet," Lara responds.

         "You sure about that, girlie? Wanna make a bet?" Lilith asks.

         "Hell yes!" Sam says enthusiastically. "Lara rescued me single-handedly from a cult, so I'm pretty sure she can do this. As a show of solidarity, every time she takes something off, I will too."

         "You don't have to do this, Sam..." Lara says, slightly worried.

         "I say let her make her own mistakes," Zoey says with a smirk.

         "It's not like I could stop her, anyway," Lara says, resigned.

         "Besides, it won't even matter because you are going to rock it!" Sam says.

         "Is everyone ready then?" Elizabeth interrupts, bemused at the entire spectacle before her. After a bit of a double-take, everyone nods in agreement. The cards are passed out and you look at your hand.

         "Well, well, well...look who just walked in." Morrigan says with a sultry grin.

         "Finally! We were about to start without you." Cassandra says. "Oh...um...are you lost, little girl? This room is kind of...ya know...adult oriented...so..."

         "Unless this girl possesses powers we don't know about, I doubt she could get past our security. She must have been invited. And how adorable, too," Morrigan says with a wink. "I love the little ones, sometimes. So young and innocent. To see pleasure in their eyes for the first time is a nearly addictive experience. Maybe if you're lucky, little angel, I'll let you join my collection." Her grin turns predatory as bats suddenly flutter around her. "I'll have you know they rather enjoy their lives," she adds as she gestures to them. "They live in a constant state of ecstasy, forever satisfying me and being satisfied by me. The perks of being a succubus."

         "U-um...I..." you blush and look down, trying not to let the succubus' alluring form draw your gaze.

         "She's just being dramatic," Chun Li cuts in, rolling her eyes. "The one thing she actually craves most in the world is attention."

         "Don't sound so dismissive," Morrigan purrs. "I haven't given up on your either, Legs."

         "If we may continue then," Kasumi interjects. "We're all here, so let's go over the rules. We're playing basic five card draw so this doesn't take all night. At the beginning of each hand we all get five cards. After we have those, each of us can turn in any of those, up to all five, for replacements. Once we've done that, everyone puts down their hands and the loser has to take something off. Once a person is rendered naked all of us here at the table get to decide what that person has to do as punishment. The last person left with anything on is the winner."

         "I can hardly wait. Winning or losing doesn't matter. I win regardless," Morrigan says.

         "Well if you are offering to take it all off now and make things a little easier on us, be my guest," Cassandra says.

         "Oh no, I couldn't do that. It's the risk and anticipation that's most of the fun. Besides, I wouldn't deprive myself of the chance to best all of you and claim you as my own."

         "I...don't think that's in the rules..." Kasumi says with a blush.

         "We'll see..." Morrigan responds.

152.title: Fighter Table

153.content:
Ah, that's right. WRPG Table. Without further adieu you step out of the car and towards the nondescript building in which The Inventory is housed. A bouncer, who may or may not have been Dudley from Street Fighter, opens the door for you as you show him your invitation. You step inside and inhale the musty smells of smoke and alcohol. You make your way through the semi-crowded room, noticing a few familiar faces as you head towards the back. You're pretty sure you saw Solid Snake sharing a a beer with Gordon Freeman, but you didn't get a good enough look. No one seems to pay much attention to you as you cross the room. Finally, you reach the entrance to the VIP area. You show your invitation to the bouncer up front (some Half Life Civil Protection goon by the look of him), and he lets you in.

         You step inside the room and you see your four fellow players already at the table: Liara (http://i.imgur.com/7UFd8A2.jpg), Jeanette (http://i.imgur.com/WzyYeDz.jpg), Sis (http://i.imgur.com/nGTuVFM.jpg) and Triss (http://i.imgur.com/USt1eUm.jpg).

         "Ah, it would seem that we are all here now," Liara says as she spots you enter.

         "Yes it would," Jeanette agrees with a seductive smile. "And here I thought the spread was already so excellent. You seem so...ordinary compared to the others here, little girl. Don't worry, I mean that as a compliment. It makes you...unique. I can't wait to unwrap you. Just like a Christmas present. A small, adorable present."

         "I'm that that young..." you say, trying not to feel intimidated by the older women.

         "Relatively speaking, I suppose. Immortality tends to frame mortal lifespans in a different light," she answers.

         "Well, I'm 108," Liara says.

         "Oh? Well, you're not exactly human are you, blue girl? Then again, neither am I," Jeanette comments.

         "I'm also over 100. I don't like giving exacts. It tends to depress me," Triss says slyly. "One of the perks of magic," she adds.

         "Well, I guess we're all a little older than we look here," Jeanette says. "What about you, quiet one? Are you hiding secret powers as well?" Jeanette looks at Sis. Sis rolls her eyes and sighs, pauses for a few seconds and holds up all ten of her fingers twice. "Is that supposed to mean 20? Is there any reason you couldn't just tell us?"

         Sis gives Jeanette a withering sardonic look, grabs a pen and writes on a pad of paper next to her. She holds up the pad and the message reads: "I'm mute."

         "Ooooooh," Jeanette says.

         Sis turns to the next page on the pad which reads: "Dumb bitch."

         "Well now, she's feisty. I like her. This is going to be fun," Jeanette says.

         "If we may continue then," Liara interjects. "We're all here, so let's go over the rules. We're playing basic five card draw for the sake of brevity, so no betting. At the beginning of each hand we all get five cards. After we have those, each of us can turn in any of those, up to all five, for replacements. Once we've done that, everyone puts down their hands and the loser has to take something off. Once a person is rendered naked all of us here at the table get to decide what that person has to do as punishment. The last person left with anything on is the winner."

         "Well, I'm certainly not shy, but I've seen me naked before. All of you on the other hand..." Jeanette says.

         "Aren't you laying on the seductive vampire thing a little thick?" Triss asks.

         "Well, Daddy always said to do what you love. I wonder if I'll grow to love any of you?" Jeanette giggles and you can see her fangs.

         "I guess I shouldn't have asked..." Triss says dully.

153.title: WRPG Table

154.content:
Ah, that's right. JRPG Table. Without further adieu you step out of the car and towards the nondescript building in which The Inventory is housed. A bouncer, who may or may not have been Dudley from Street Fighter, opens the door for you as you show him your invitation. You step inside and inhale the musty smells of smoke and alcohol. You make your way through the semi-crowded room, noticing a few familiar faces as you head towards the back. You're pretty sure you saw Solid Snake sharing a a beer with Gordon Freeman, but you didn't get a good enough look. No one seems to pay much attention to you as you cross the room. Finally, you reach the entrance to the VIP area. You show your invitation to the bouncer up front (some Half Life Civil Protection goon by the look of him), and he lets you in.

         You step inside the room and you see your four fellow players already at the table: Elizabeth (http://i.imgur.com/7LrQ9kQ.png), Jessica (http://i.imgur.com/fy2cyrb.jpg), Tifa (http://i.imgur.com/InOydrF.png) and Aika (http://i.imgur.com/u0uu8YS.jpg).

         "Oh! It seems our last guest has arrived!" Elizabeth pipes up as you enter. "It's very nice to meet you! My name is Elizabeth."

         "I have a feeling she knows that..." Jessica says.

         "Oh, I'm sorry. I'm just rather excited to be here. I have a strong suspicion that this is going to be a very memorable experience. After all, there are so many unique faces here. I look forward to seeing all of your true selves laid bare," Elizabeth says.

         "I guess that's one way of putting it," Tifa reasons.

         "I suspect you might be the most unique of all of us, though, little girl. You are the only one here from a specific sphere of existence, I believe. Also you are rather younger than the rest of us. I wonder how that will affect the dynamics," Elizabeth says, her bright yellow eyes on you.

         "Maybe it makes me a target," you say.

         "Nah, we wouldn't gang up on a cute little thing like you," Jessica says. "Besides, it's mostly luck."

         "And I'm very lucky!" Aika pips up.

         "Now, just so I'm clear, we are playing strip poker, yes? The daring game in which one wagers their modesty instead of monetary wealth? I have very much wanted to try it. I have no shortage of funds, but the thrill of losing here is much more substantial. I can see why you humans would find it exhilarating," Elizabeth says.

         "Wait...we're not...playing for treasure?" Aika says.

         "How could you not know that?" Jessica says.

         "I just thought it was regular poker. Are you saying I don't stand to win any treasure here?" Aika asks, her voice nearly whiny.

         "We signed papers...how could you have not known?" Tifa says.

         "I guess I didn't look close enough..." Aika says in a small voice.

         "Well, do not feel too alarmed. You said yourself that you are very lucky, correct? If this is true, you have nothing to worry about. Besides, not all treasures are measured in physical wealth. Many come from far less tangible places, like the bonds you create with others. I wonder if will be creating special bonds with any of you..." Elizabeth says, her usual mystical airy tone now colored with the slightest suggestive undertone.

         "Man, where did they find this girl?" Jessica asks.

         "If you would all be so kind as to listen to the rules then," Elizabeth interjects. "We're playing basic five card draw for the sake of brevity, so that means no betting of any kind. At the beginning of each hand we all receive five cards. After we have those, each of us can turn in any of those, up to all five, for replacements. Once we've done that, everyone puts down their hands and the loser has to remove an article of clothing. Once a person is rendered naked all of us here at the table get to decide what that person has to do as punishment. The last person left with anything on is the winner. Is that clear to everyone?"

         Everyone at the table nods in affirmation and the cards are dealt out.

1552.content:
Ah, that's right. The Junior League. Without further adieu you step out of the car and towards the nondescript building in which The Inventory is housed. A bouncer, who may or may not have been Dudley from Street Fighter, opens the door for you as you show him your invitation. You step inside and inhale the musty smells of smoke and alcohol. You make your way through the semi-crowded room, noticing a few familiar faces as you head towards the back. You're pretty sure you saw Solid Snake sharing a a beer with Gordon Freeman, but you didn't get a good enough look. No one seems to pay much attention to you as you cross the room. Finally, you reach the entrance to the VIP area. You show your invitation to the bouncer up front (some Half Life Civil Protection goon by the look of him), and he lets you in.

         You step inside the room and you see your four fellow players already at the table: Ellie (http://i.imgur.com/Z62s3Vm.jpg), Clementine (http://i.imgur.com/Yiarblj.png), Sunny (http://i.imgur.com/6TZLWBX.jpg) and Serena (http://i.imgur.com/gPLQxtw.png).

         "Oh, hey, it looks like the last player is here. 'Sup?" Ellie says, looking at you as you enter.

         "Oh, hey...it's another girl," Sunny says, her smile faltering just slightly.

         "Uh oh! Someone was hoping for a boy," Ellie says.

         "N-no I wasn't!" Sunny replies, her cheeks flushing slightly.

         "Ah, don't bother denying it. Anyway, it's not so bad! Now it's just a bunch of us girls hanging out. It's kinda like a slumber party. You've done that, right?" Ellie asks

         "Um...no. I spent most of my time growing up alone with my guardians. There weren't any other kids around. Now I run a launch facility, so I guess I kind of skipped that phase of my life," Sunny answers.

         "Yeah, I haven't either," Clementine pipes up. "I was just about at slumber party age when...well, you know. Zombie apocalypse. There wasn't really time after that."

         "Yeah...I guess, I really haven't either," Ellie acquiesces. "I grew up in a military boarding school. I mean, sometimes we'd sneak into each others' rooms if we could get around the guards, but...it's not like it was an official slumber party or anything."

         "I had a few," Serena chimes in. You notice her accent sounds French. You think you recall that in the Pokemon world that's called Kalos, though. "We would stay up late and gossip. We would talk about Pokemon, fashion and our favorite trainers. We had a lot of fun."

         "Is there any conversation in your world that doesn't eventually cycle around to Pokemon?" Ellie asks.

         "Not really, no," Serena answers, amused.

         "What about you, Newbie? Ever done a slumber party before?" Ellie asks.

         "Oh...um..." you begin. "A couple of times, I guess. But...we never did anything like this," you gesture at the cards.

         "Ha! Yeah, I bet not," Ellie says. "That just means you'll have even more fun, since it's your first time. Which reminds me, we have to go over the all-important rules. We're playing basic five card draw so the game doesn't take all night, so that means no betting. At the beginning of each hand we'll all get five cards. After we have those, each of us can turn in any of those, up to all five, for new ones. Once we've done that, everyone puts down their hands and the loser has to strip. Once a person is bare-assed all of us here at the table get to decide what that person has to do as punishment. The last person left with anything on wins. Everyone got that?"

         "I think so. I've never played poker before, though. I just know how it works," Clem says.

         "Ah, you'll do fine," Ellie answers.

         "What about you? We...uh...kind of both didn't exactly have normal childhoods..."

         "Yeah, sure. I played loads of times with my friend Riley."

         "Strip poker, though?"

         "A...few times, yeah. She had terrible luck, though." Ellie grins. "You actually kind of remind me of her."

         "Gee, thanks."

         "No, not the luck part. Just in the general attitude. Ya know, the whole confident, survivor badass kind of deal. It was always kinda hot." Clem raises an eyebrow. "I mean she was! Not that you aren't, though, or well I'm...ya know...not trying to...you get what I'm trying to say."

         "Not really..."

         "She was saying that she was attracted to another girl who was like you in many ways, and thus likely finds those qualities in you attractive as well, though she does not want to come out and say that," Serena says, smirking.

         "Thanks for the input, Frenchie," Ellie says, rolling her eyes.

         "I do not know this French, but I do know what you are feeling. I personally had a very similar experience with my friend Shauna. We played a game similar to this. Only instead of cards, we battled our Pokemon. She was never that adept at it, though, so she never saw much. I certainly did not mind the view on my end, of course," Serena reminisces.

         "Let's...just play cards..." Clem says.

         "Yeah..." Sunny agrees.

         So it's about to start. These girls seem pretty cool. You hope you don't embarrass yourself.

1552.title: Junior League Table

choices: Drop the four and go for a straight
15521.content:
You decide to throw away just your two lowest cards, hoping to pick up another king; or better yet, a third ace. You aren't so lucky, however, as all you're rewarded with are an off-suit four and seven. You bite your lip thoughtfully, a tick you've had long enough that you barely notice it anymore. You know a pair of aces is a pretty strong hand, and the king just adds extra insurance. You're not likely to win the hand, but you're almost certain you won't lose. What are the odds of all four of the other girls having at least two pair?

"Hey, relax. It's just a game, right?" Ellie casually smiles at you. She's obviously noticed how nervous you are. You realize your little tick could give away more about future hand than you'd like, so you make a note to try and keep it under control. You're not confident you'll be able to, however, given how long you've gone without breaking that particular habit.

"Right, uh...yeah." you smile back uneasily as the last few cards are swapped out. "Sorry. Just a little nervous, I guess." It isn't just about the prospect of losing your clothes, although that's certainly part of it. Some people have a knack for talking to new people and being in the group spotlight. You are not one of those people. You're worried you'll say something dumb and embarrass yourself, or that you'll be the first one out and have to sit there naked as a jaybird while the other girls laugh about you.

Everyone shows their cards while you nervously chew your lip. To your surprise, your hand is the strongest after all, as most of the girls had some sort of pair. Only Sunny comes up short, with just a queen to her name. A little rush of relief eases your nerves. It's just one hand, but still. Sunny pulls off her gloves, flexing her fingers and cheerily commenting on how much easier it'll be for her to hold her cards now.

As the next set of cards are dealt, Serena's bright smile finds it way to your corner of the table. It's obvious she's some sort of social butterfly, at least compared to you and the other girls in the group, so the fact that she doesn't immediately break eye contact makes you just a little nervous.

"What?" You stammer out quickly, sounding slightly annoyed entirely by accident. You remedy that immediately. She seems nice; all these girls do. You don't want to give any of them the wrong impression. "I mean, uh, is there...something on my face or something?" you ask nervously.

"Oh, no, not at all. I was just thinking that you are probably very pretty when you smile, but that you also seem very nervous. You should try and relax and enjoy the game." Serena said, picking up her new hand without a care in the world.

You blush, at a loss as to how you might even reply to the Pokemon trainer. You certainly don't mind the compliment, but having someone just come right out and say it is kind of embarrassing. Besides, has your nervousness really been that obvious?

"Don't...worry about Serena." Clem says wryly. "She says things without really thinking about them first. Seriously, though, loosen up a little. We're all here to have fun. And it's not like any of us are going to see anything we don't all have, right?"

You laugh sheepishly and agree, looking at your new hand.

15521.title: Keep the aces and the king.

choices: Keep the eights and the jack
155212.content:
It's risky, but that straight is too tempting to pass up. Doing your best to sound like you know what you're doing, you coolly ask for just one card.

"Sounds like someone's got a good hand." Sunny grins, passing your card over. For someone who lost first, she sure seems to be in a good mood. "Maybe you're better at this than you let on." You know it's just a joke, but she actually sounds a little impressed, and that makes you even more confident that you've made the right choice. Feeling a little proud of yourself, you look at your new card...and find that it is exactly what you needed! You're holding the jack of clubs, completing your straight. You think you manage to hide your smile until everyone's cards are shown, but you beam with pride when you see that you have the strongest hand yet again.

"Looks like I win again!" you announce, a little louder than you intend. You clear your throat and force your smile down to an awkward smirk, expecting some annoyed eye-rolling from the other girls, but they don't even seem to have minded your unnecessary volume. Serena's last this time, with ace-high easily losing out to the others' pairs, but the whole table is more focused on you.

"Ah, crap. And here I was, hoping you wouldn't be good. Guess I'm still the worst player at the table." Clem comments, pouting without actually seeming at all upset.

"That was ballsy, going for the straight when you only traded one card. Nice one." Ellie grins.

"Yeah, but this was just good luck. That's a big part of poker, obviously, but the probability of it keeping up for the whole game is so unlikely that-"

"Sunny. Sunny, it's okay, we know." Ellie laughs, causing the teen prodigy's cheeks to flush.

"Eheh, yeah, sorry. You know how it is. Work-talk and stuff. Anyway, good job." Sunny adds sheepishly, giving you a small nod before returning her attention to dealing out the cards. You smile a little brighter. You're feeling pretty good about this game now, and you're actually having a lot of fun. You seem to be fitting in just fine so far, so maybe this won't be so bad.

You glance over at Serena as she slips off her stylish shoes, placing them neatly underneath her chair. You had expected her to take off her hat, and you say so out of curiosity.

"Oh, no. I like this hat quite a lot. I would much rather take off my shoes." Serena replies smiling absentmindedly as she draws her hand.
