155212.title: Drop the four and go for a straight

choices: Keep the hearts and try for a flush
1552122.content:
Deciding to try your luck at a mostly fresh hand, you keep your eights and throw away everything else. The other stuff wasn't really helping you, anyway. At least, that's what you think until you see which cards you're passed.

A three, a five, and...another jack. Keeping the one you had would have given you two pair; a significantly stronger hand. And to make matters worse, you didn't even gain anything by throwing away what you had. You try your best not to pout, but you know you've got a bad hand and a bad poker face.

"Alright, show 'em." Ellie says, and the table does just that. A quick, nervous scan of the cards tells you you've got the worst hand. All the girls have at least a higher pair than yours, although Clem's nines just barely beat out your eights.

"That's you, new girl. Knew your winning streak had to end sometime." Clem grins as you slip your small feet out of your pink sneakers. Now the playing field is a bit more even. You think you liked it better when you were ahead.

"Well, actually, I don't think it would be considered a streak, since it was only two in a row, and a streak is typically- oh, shoot. I'm doing it again, aren't I? Sorry." Sunny blushes, shrinking down in her chair slightly as she catches herself going off on another lengthy explanation of terminology.

After a moment to collect the rest of the cards, new hands are dealt out once more.

1552122.title: Keep the eights

choices: Keep the face cards, lose the rest
15521222.content:
You bite your lip as you stare bleakly at your cards. Garbage. Nothing to do but throw some away and hope to make something out of them. The three hearts could make a flush if you happen to get lucky,but poor luck cost you your shoes last hand. You decide to play it safe and keep your king and jack. Finding another of either should at least keep you out of last.

"Hmm, so..." Serena smiles at you, suddenly sounding very playful. "What do you think of playing strip poker with only girls at the table? It's exciting, no?" Serena's soft accent makes her question sound downright sensual, and her smile is anything but innocent.

Your cheeks turn rosy, but you attempt a nonchalant grin, despite your shyness. All you end up doing is making yourself look more flustered.

"It's...okay, yeah." you reply quietly.

"Just ignore her. She's just trying to get you riled up." Ellie sighs, eyes rolling.

"No, no, I am just making conversation. Although it would be interesting to see her all riled up..." Serena smirks coyly, and you can feel a soft, stocking-covered foot brush against the top of yours underneath the table. You blush more deeply, waiting until she moves her foot off yours, rather than pulling away.

"Knock it off, Serena. Everyone just show your hands." Sunny huffs.

You steal glance at your three new cards, realizing you've been too distracted to even remember to look at them yet. As luck would have it, last among your cards is a jack! You have a pair, at least, and a high one, at that. Cards are shown, and you're surprised to see that both Sunny and Clem haven't even made pairs. Clem's queen trumps Sunny's paltry nine-high, however, making the teen prodigy the loser.

Frowning, Sunny unlaces her boots and slips them off her feet, sliding them underneath her chair.

"Guess I'm in last again. Oh well." Sunny shrugs.

"Maybe you are the one who we will get to see all riled up, hmm, Sunny?" Serena grins, cocking a playful eyebrow.

"Geez, laying it on a little thick, aren't you?" Ellie comments, dealing out the new cards. "We get it, you like seeing girls naked."

Serena's thin fingers cover her mouth as she giggles. "I like seeing boys naked, too, you know. I am, shall we say...not picky."

The conversation is left at that for the time being. You look down at your new hand, hoping for the best.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------

15521222.title: Keep the face cards

155212222.content:
Yeesh, with the crap hands you've been getting dealt it's a wonder you've only lost your shoes so far. It's lucky so many people are still in the game. You can survive on mediocre luck for now. In any case, the odds of getting a straight are way too low for you to consider it a safe bet, so you decide to hold on to your face cards and hope for a fortuitous pair.

         Your new cards don't include a jack or a queen, but you did get two sixes. A pair is a pair, at least. It will hopefully prevent you from losing more clothes so early in the game.

         "Alright, ladies, let's see who's next on the chopping block," Ellie says cockily. She lays down a flush, clubs. Serena smiles and puts down two pair. Sunny has a three of a kind and looks relieved she won't be losing a third article so soon. You put down your pair of sixes and Clem puts down an ace high.

         "You're up, Clem! And, whoa, look at that! I'm the only one still wearing all her clothes. Just call me the poker master already, girls," Ellie says with a smirk.

         "Cocky attitudes have a way of coming back to bite you," Clem says as she unlaces her shoes and then kicks them off.

         "Pssh, I don't believe in jinxes."

         "You're not gonna take off the hat?" Sunny asks.

         "Not yet...it's got...sentimental value."

         "We don't take the clothes you lose, you know," Ellie cuts in, amused.

         "I know, it's just...a good luck charm," Clem says. Ellie shrugs and deals out the new cards. So far there hasn't been much skin, but you know it won't stay that way forever. You look at your next hand.

155212222.title: Keep the face cards, lose the rest

1553.content:
Ah, that's right. The Zombie Hunter Table. Without further adieu you step out of the car and towards the nondescript building in which The Inventory is housed. A bouncer, who may or may not have been Dudley from Street Fighter, opens the door for you as you show him your invitation. You step inside and inhale the musty smells of smoke and alcohol. You make your way through the semi-crowded room, noticing a few familiar faces as you head towards the back. You're pretty sure you saw Solid Snake sharing a a beer with Gordon Freeman, but you didn't get a good enough look. No one seems to pay much attention to you as you cross the room. Finally, you reach the entrance to the VIP area. You show your invitation to the bouncer up front (some Half Life Civil Protection goon by the look of him), and he lets you in.

         You step inside the room and you see your four fellow players already at the table: Jill (http://i.imgur.com/wTWduhA.jpg), Juliet (http://i.imgur.com/mxRXLgy.jpg), Clarie (http://i.imgur.com/gGPcoa9.jpg) and Annie (http://i.imgur.com/Y0sxHKN.png).

         "It looks like we've got our last player now," Claire says as you come in.

         "That we do. C'mon, pull up a chair. We're just about to start," Jill says.

         "Aww, she's cute! She seems kinda young, though," Juliet says. "She reminds me of some of the kids I used to babysit."

         "You babysat?" Annie asks, amused.

         "Yeah...it didn't end well."

         "That...uh...doesn't sound good," you say, nervous.

         "Oh...nothing, like, bad or anything. At least not bad by my standards, with zombies and everything. It was just a regular person's kind of bad," she answers.

         "I guess if she's here that means she got an invite, though," Claire says. "If the club cleared her I guess it's okay with us."

         "Yeah, I guess. Anyway, it's nice to see you, Claire. I heard Zoe supposed to be at this table, though?" Juliet asks.

         "Yeah, but someone dropped out of the shooter table at the last minute, so they asked her to take over since her game is all about guns," Jill says. "So I called Claire on short notice and she said 'yes.'"

         "Well, it's just nice to be doing something for a change," Claire sighs.

         "Aw, chin up. You'll get cycled back in eventually," Jill says kindly.

         "Says the girl who's been in two of the last three," Claire fires back, amused.

         "Heh, good point," Jill says. "Anyway, I guess we should go on with this, so let's get to the rules. We're playing basic five card draw so the game is faster, so that means no betting of any kind. At the beginning of each hand we all receive five cards. After we have those, each of us can turn in any of those, up to all five, for replacements. Once we've done that, everyone puts down their hands and the loser has to remove an article of clothing. Once a person is naked all of us here at the table get to decide what that person has to do as punishment. The last person left with anything on is the winner. Is that clear to everyone?"

         Everyone at the table nods in affirmation and the cards are dealt out.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------

1553.title: Zombie Hunter Table

info.brief_description: You have been invited to a game of strip poker with four video game babes. Will you win?
info.description:
The Inventory is a former speakeasy turned hangout for all manner of characters from the video game world. On a normal night you could find all sorts in the club drinking, talking or participating in one of the many high stakes gambling games that the place hosts for its diverse clientele.

         Tonight, however, is not a normal night. Tonight you, lucky gamer, have been invited to a very special game. You will play a game of poker against four lovely video game heroines. Not just any poker, either. Strip poker. The winner is the last one left at the table with their modesty intact. Will you win or will you lose your shirt...literally?

         It's going to be a long night.

General Rules:

-No growth/shrink or body modification of any kind.
-Nothing scatological. No peeing and no diapers, either.
-No vore.
-No extreme torture, violence or death. (BDSM is just fine, though)

Game Rules:

-Each entry is a single hand in the game. It will begin with the player's choice of discard from the previous chapter. The loser of the hand removes a single article of clothing. Once new cards are dealt and its time to select cards again a new page is made. There are no time lapses or glossing over of hands in single chapters.

-Don't make any of the choices at the end of a chapter be the result of the hand. For instance, none of the choices should be "X wins the hand" or "X loses the hand." It should always pertain to the cards the player has, unless the current event being decided on does not have to do with the poker game, such as a forfeit.

-Always end each chapter with the status of the current characters, as seen in the chapters already posted. This will help future writers of chapters to be clear on what is currently going on.

-Once a player loses their last article of clothing, they must perform a forfeit. The forfeit is author's choice. It can be anything from simple embarrassing tasks like posing for photos or streaking to full on sex. It's best to gauge the current tone of the story to feel what kind of forfeit would be appropriate at that time. The longer the game goes on, the racier they tend to become.

-The game continues until all but the player are naked or until the player loses.

-Should the player lose, once they strip and perform the forfeit the story branch ends with a game over. The game does not continue once the player is out.

-Don't be afraid to write dialogue between the characters. Some of the most memorable parts of the game Poker Night at the Inventory are the conversations, so throw in some good insides jokes or just some good dialogue between the players.
info.pretty_title: Strip Poker Night at the Inventory
